Service was great! Drinks are interesting craft cocktails... The salad and scallops were both fantastic!

I don't know why I'm so obsessed with this place. Staff and food never disappoint me. The chopped salad is an obvious must have. I ordered the carne asada tacos and was very impressed by how tender the meat was. The burrata salad was fantastic. My fiancé and I loved their dirty martinis as well. We will be back!

Service: amazing. Our waiter was awesome! He was super friendly and I noticed he was very personable with all his tables. Very pleasant. Their staff is very on top of it.  Atmosphere: this is why I am taking a star off. It was crazy loud. I don't know if it is normally like that but it was so loud that I felt that I was shouting across the table to be heard. It had a fun vibe but honestly way too loud. I felt like I was in a club type atmosphere and not a restaurant.   Food: started off with the Mac and cheese which was actually pretty good. Had a nice flavor to it. Also had the burrata which was very delicious!! I had the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and zucchini and it was amazing. Best meatloaf I have ever had and the portion size was huge. My bf ordered the filet, med/rare and he said it was cooked perfectly and delicious!  An overall great experience!

I have recently discovered this place. The food is really good. I have to say that the service is good. The two times I have gone..the server takes the order and the runner's who bring out the salad haven't gotten it down right. 1st time they brought it out with my main course. This time they brought out the wrong salad and brought out my partners 1st. You guys are great but I think you need to get that simple part solved. It's not fun when you guests get there's and your still waiting for yours. I also mentioned that we were celebrating a big deal that closed for my partner and nothing was mentioned to celebrate at the end of the meal, after they asked me on the phone when I made the reservation. Why ask then?

Been going here for a long long time with only positive opinions of the place and unfortunately a new insecure Bar Manager makes me write the following.  So disappointed that I feel the need to write my one and only review on yelp but the management need to know.  After sitting down at the bar tonight alone.  First drink of the night.  I order my first drink and an appetizer. Some guys sit by me.  They are having their first drink if the night.  And after 20 mins the bar man gets a stick up his ass about all of us and refuses to serve us all and returns all the food.  I have no idea what the hell got his goat.  After the other two guys left I was so disappointed I called over the manager who supported the bar guy without question!  Really?  Whoever the owner is they need to really look at the over sensitivity of their managers. Great food, great vibe,... Usually...  Unfortunately spoiled by poor management staff with self confidence issues. Good luck guys you just lost one regular and a few locals.

Such a trendy and fun dinner spot! The food is amazing and there are variety of menu options will leave you wanting several items. I got the seared scallops and my husband got the meatloaf and we were both impressed with how extraordinary the flavors and ingredients were. The others in our party got the chopped salad and the pork loin and were also very excited and impressed. This is a great spot to go with a large group or some friends as the atmosphere is energetic but the ambience is somewhat formal.

It's just one of those must go spots in Scottsdale. My friend had taken me here for my birthday and she had their salad as a main dish and since then I have gone back SEVERAL time just for this salad.

Really, really good all the way around.  From the first moment we were greeted to the moment we left the service was impeccable, the food and drink were top-notch, and the atmosphere is just very relaxed and puts you at ease.  We shared some of the dishes that folks repeatedly mentioned - pork belly pastrami, chopped salad, short ribs, scallops, bread pudding and the pudding jar - all washed down with a couple of kilt lifter ales and a couple of glasses of delicious wines.  Every single bite and sip was great.  Our server, Jeremy, and all the other staff did a wonderful job of pacing things, refilling glasses, etc., and we never felt rushed or neglected.  A must try if you're in the area.
Food was amazing!! Ambiance was great too. Very upscale with reasonable prices. Went for a business group dinner and was not disappointed. I plan to go back for a date night with the Hubby!!!
Try the Jucy Lucy...it's so good!  The mingon tacos were good too.  And they are open til 11pm on a Sunday night.
Peanut butter paradise!  All I gotta say!  Wow!!!

We went here for dinner last night. To start, the $$ rating is very misleading. The prices are on the high side. The chop salad was amazing per the previous reviews but the entrees we ordered, Lamb Burger and Chicken, were both overcooked and very dry. I can see going back here for a happy hour but never for dinner. Just not worth it.

After choosing this place after it's great reviews, I decided to give it a try. Not gonna lie, I was a little let down by the menu choices, but what I had (crab cakes & chopped salad) was ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! Definitely worth the bite! :)

After dining at Citizen Public House, it's no surprise it's one of the top rated restaurants in Scottsdale! We chose the restaurant as the venue for our post-busy season office dinner and it did not disappoint. The event coordinator was very prompt with email communication and gave us the option to choose between a variety of set dinner menus. She also offered cocktail and wine menus to enhance our dining experience.   We all had the famous Chopped Salad to start. I was a bit hesitant as I'm not a huge smoked salmon fan, but wow, this salad was absolutely delicious. Not only is it beautiful plated, all the ingredients perfectly marry together. I was disappointed the portion wasn't bigger for the set menu as I could have eaten this for my main course!  For our entree course, guests had the option to choose between chicken with saffron rice, coffee cherry glazed short ribs with parsnip purée, and pan seared scallops. I chose the short rib dish and the flavor was phenomenal. It was paired with crunchy sautéed Swiss chard and I was shocked how much I enjoyed this simple vegetable. My only teeny tiny complaint was that the short rib was just a tad dry. The chicken and scallops dishes looked amazing as well, everyone was very happy with their selections!   For dessert we all had the smores pie in a jar. While it was perfectly sweet and decadent, it tasted a bit more like gingerbread pie. No complaints from me, just an observation.   What stood out above all was the service. We had a party of 11 and our glasses were never empty. Our server was very attentive and explained all dishes on the menu in great detail before we ordered. I also loved that when I asked the host where the bathroom was, he walked me all the way through the restaurant to the door. It was a nice touch that showed the waitstaff really cares about their guests and making their experience enjoyable.   I would recommend Citizen Public House to Scottsdale residents and visitors alike. You're sure to have a memorable culinary experience!

You should consider this an update of my review of the Yelp Event at Citizen's Public House. http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=v-gCiEr8vr9JnMkkR5Uq_A&q=citizen%27s+public+house  Ever since the amazing drinks we had at the Yelp event I've wanted to go back to Citizen's Public House. So we stopped in tonight, our 23rd wedding anniversary, after dinner at a French restaurant we wanted to try. Richie Moe, mixologist extraordinare and my drink hero was busy so his apprentice, Chris, made me an amazing drink. But Richie knew we wanted a taste of his magic so when he was free, he came by.  He remembered me and Yelper Shannon M and how much we enjoyed our drinks. When he learned it was my and Jim W's anniversary he offered us anniversary shots, saying he felt like lighting something on fire. OH MY GOD!!!  He started out with these two stainless steel pitchers - way too big for a couple of shots. He put in chopped chocolate, added chocolate liqueur and banana liqueur and heated the bottom of the pot. He then gently caught the contents on fire. That's when the real excitement began. He poured flaming liqueur from one pot to the other. Back and forth went the flaming lava-like stream, a brilliant blue and gold. When he was done he poured it into two shot glasses, added some sort of cream and grated chocolate on the top. It was warm, a perfect temperature to drink. And it tasted like a liqueur version of bananas foster. IT WAS FANTASTIC!!!  I'd been wanting to go back since Presidents day. Richie reminded us why. Chris is well on his way to being an amazing mixologist as well. You need to find out why too. Go now. What are you waiting for?!

My husband and I came here to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. They were so accommodating and greeting us with a complimentary glass of bubbly. Always a treat! The server knew the menu so well and suggested many delicious items! We of course had to try the omfg salad and look forward to trying to recreate its amazingness (although it will be impossible!) truly one of the best salads in Scottsdale. Wonderful decor, service and cuisine!
The chopped salad is the best I've ever had.  Service was great.  Noise level a bit high. Worth going back!
I loved their pork belly pastrami and their lamb burger! Def on our list of places to return to on our next trip out to Arizona! Yums! And not pricey either!  You won't be disappointed!

We love this place and visit every time we are in town. The food is yummy. Love the original chop salad, the beef short ribs, meatloaf and the lamb burger.  The mixologist is top notch, the service friendly and the vibe welcoming & fun. A must while in Scottsdale.
The cocktails here are totally unique - and beyond tasty!  Chopped salad is outstanding, but so is just about everything on the menu.

The ambience was very trendy and relaxing. This being our first time there, we let our very exuberant waiter tell us his favorites. He was a fountain of information and did a wonderful job explaining the whole menu. He recommended the tossed salad as an appetizer and it was a great mixture of texture and taste that was refreshing. I chose the meatloaf entrée and yes you may think it is just a home style classic but this meatloaf was elevated in taste and the zucchini was cooked perfectly (wish I had gotten more than three slices, but succulent each of them). I was stuffed but when the desserts were explained to me, I could not resist and ordered a the trifecta dessert that included fudge, strawberry ice cream and brittle. Delicious! This was a great find in Scottsdale that was pretty close to our hotel. Bonus!
Best drinks for your money in town if you like whiskey and gin.

Just happened to pop in Saturday night with my husband. No reservations but there was ample room at the bar. Service was amazing and we started off with the catfish grits appetizer. Wow. We had the spicy mustard sauce on the side and are glad we did as it was too mustardy. The catfish was fresh and the crust made of grits was delish. My husband had the meatloaf and I had the crab cakes. Both were phenomenal. My crab cakes were some of the best I've ever had and I eat them everywhere! I'd definitely make plans to visit this place if you've never been. Or to go back if you haven't been by in awhile. Wonderful experience!
Unique food - I had the Chop Salad, Short Ribs & took home some of the Bacon Peanut Brittle to try later. Each of the dishes were unique but very tasty.

Elijah and the other bartender(Greg?) were great and attentive and friendly. Kilt lifter fondue was superb. I can compare to many different ones I made myself or had at different friends houses in Switzerland.  I also tried the noble bread. The bread is not special but the bone marrow butter is freaking delicious that comes with it. There also was sundried tomato with it that isn't 5 stars but still okay. Unfortunately it is the cocktails that make it lose a star. It was the size of my pinky and 12 dollars. Thanks for the service. Highly recommended for the food. My buddy enjoyed his Banh Mi quite a lot
Great food Great drinks Great atmosphere Great Service. Get the chopped salad, the pork belly pastrami, and the meat loaf. Everything I have ever ate here has been awesome or amazing.
Burrata, scallops and ribs were excellent, as our waiter recommended! Definitely a top recommendation when in Scottsdale.

I never would've imagined that I'd write a review based on a salad! I don't even like lettuce! Yet, here I am...writing about the world's best chopped salad!  1) Occassion:  For my first birthday weekend in AZ, Ryan made a reservation for us here. As soon as we walked in, we were seated at a very cozy and romantic table(it had a candle, that's romantic right?!).   2) Service: Our server (also named Ryan) was the sweetest guy we've ever met! He had the warmest smile and treated us like we were the only customers there! Although he was servicing several tables by us, we felt he was there the second we needed him!   3) Food: The chopped salad is to die for. When it's brought out, the ingredients are layered vertically. Our server mixed it up for us with the dressing and I think that's the best way to eat it. I saw a table near us eat one section at a time and I think that's missing the point! (Who watches others eat..this weirdo)  The salad consists of lettuce, salmon, sunflower seeds, corn, and some sort of green dressing. It is super good! I want the recipe so I can make it every day!  *Seared scallops: Also to die for!   4) Ambience:  It's a fairly small restaurant with cozy seating. There is a bar in the middle. Although we were here for a birthday, it seems pretty awesome for happy hours etc.  We'll be back regularly!
First time visit was really enjoyable.  We benefitted from the Happy Hour prices and were pleasantly surprised at the quality and portion sizes of the cocktails and food.
Really nice dinner - great service.  Interesting beer and cocktail list.  Keep in the rotation
Love this place.  Great food and good service, had this amazing salad. I could of just eaten double of that.  Yummmm.  Nice atmosphere and great service !!

We came to Citizen after being recommended to it by a friend (plus the good reviews didn't hurt), but what a disappointment. Bland food and service. Velveeta on $35 chicken doesn't make it gourmet chicken. On top of that the service was less than ideal and slow.   I will say that the restaurant itself has a nice atmosphere and maybe we just came on a bad night?

Pan seared scallops with corn grits and wilted snow pea greens and cola gastrique: humble-poser sounding dish, corn grits were fine but the scallops were too salty  Lamb burger: lamb patty lacked flavor except for the bitter gamieness, loved the kennebec fries that came with though, very unique chunkier texture, homemade ketchup was also too bitter and I'd rather have heinz/sirracha/korean bbq sauce/mayo/anything else generic  Could've just paid $10 tops at any southern restaurant for grits and fries instead.

I enjoyed my experience at C.P.H. and will go back. I want to point out the positives and negative of my experience. After a long day of catering, I started with their version of a Manhattan. To no surprise, it was great. Their cocktails are always great! I love the alterations they make to the list from time to time and it also shows how good their bartenders/mixologists are. Before my meal arrived, Eric(a mixologist) was just finishing his shift. He, like me, had a long day. He treated him self to a beer and a pour of Amaro and we struck up a great conversation. A truly genuine person. He is incredibly knowledgeable about spirits and He will be the reason I go back. I want him making my cocktails in the future.  As for the meal. I chose the game hen. The presentation was great. The flavor was good. The sauces they put on the plate could be kicked up a notch, especially the one made with the peppers from Calabria. I would say commit a tad bit more. The most  displeasing thing was the amount of vegetables they gave you. In total, 1/8 of a full size Portobello mushroom, maybe 12 English peas and one tiny marinated in a can artichoke heart. To pay in the high 20's for a plate I want to be full and also feel like I got a fair amount of food. Is that not fair?  C.P.H. would of received 3 stars, if it wasn't for Eric saving the night.
Great experience at Citizen PH...highly recommend the food and ambience trust me well worth the price!!

Fantastic service.   Great variety in menu.  Thai margarita to die for.  Hummus good, macaroni and cheese good,  grilled cheese super yummy.  This place lives up to its great yelp reviews.  Prices medium to low in my opinion.  Would go back for sure!
Food was incredible and server was very attentive to us. The potatoes were incredible as well as the macaroni and cheese. Very impressed with this choice and you may want to make a reservation.
The food and drinks there are amazing. However, Brandan Casey, The tall glass of water behind the bar, is the main reason we keep coming back. The whole staff kicks ass actually.
Had the turkey sliders appetizer which were decent but the chopped salad and pan seared scallops were phenomenal! Service and ambiance--excellent. Pricing is average considering the location

We went here tonight for the Valentine's Day special dinner menu.  There were 8 in our party and between us all we probably had almost every course option there was.   Salads were great, but endive was quite meager portion size, and tortilla soup while tasty was only lukewarm.   The chicken (these chicks had augmentation lol!) with risotto was fabulous as was the meatloaf.  Those who paid extra for filet did not feel it was any better than ones at chain "Texas" restaurants.  Scallops were large, well presented and tasty.  Sides were good and plentiful. Dessert was excellent.  Service was ho-hum.  Those with mixed drinks were offered refills but iced tea and water were not refilled. No one asked if they could get us anything else and some would have ordered coffee to drink with dessert.  To go boxes were provided.  Atmosphere was very noisy, difficult to have a conversation.  Dessert was delicious, but it felt very prepackaged. For the price I expected something very special and this left me wanting more.  Much more.

We're from DC and were generally not impressed by Arizona cuisine. But CPH was the exception. Best meal we had the whole trip.  Salad special was just that. Scallops fine too. Wines good and reasonable. Honored our reservation. What's not to like?
My boyfriend took me on a date here and we absolutely loved it. We loved the food, drinks, service and the ambiance. Can't wait to go back for a date-night.
Really great, strong drinks. very unique too. The bartenders are all expert and friendly.

By far the best service I've ever had in Arizona. Our waiter, Sam, knew everything about not only the menu, but the intricacies of how it was prepared. The scallops and the chopped salad are amazing btw. I can't believe I haven't been here before. The perfect place for gastronomers in the area who are picky with what they want.

Tonight was my one year anniversary with my girlfriend. We wanted a safe bet for good food, we are big fans of the Gladly, and were willing to pay a larger bill. Sadly we only achieved the later. I am hoping this was an off night as all the other reviews were rather strong.  First we were presented with the Summer menu, which being October should have been the Fall menu.  We had the tuna and peaches on the appetizer list. The tuna was really good 8/10 - slight fishy taste, but hey its Arizona. The sea is far away. The baked peach salad was pretty bad though. The lettuce and bacon was ok, but the peaches were hard as rocks. Its a dish we have all done and if you have peaches a little less than ripe you can usually wing it, but these were solid like a rock. They were most likely very apt for the Summer menu, but as it is Fall, peaches are no longer in season.  We ordered the scallops as our main. I'm a big scalop guy, but these were undercooked and leveled off with a huge pile of greens on top. The photograph of the scallops on yelp showed them with a deep brown sear. Ours were white with a hint of brown and pink in the middle.   I think the best part of the meal was true to scottsdale form, the cocktail. Extra strong which made my girlfriend a little more flirty.   We decided to cut our losses and go to a different restaurant. Frank and Alberts over at the Biltmore. If you want a really good dinner and ambiance you should check this spot out.  The meal came to $80, and we were charged an extra $8 for an extra scalop on the plate which we left behind as a casualty of a bad dining experience.  Moral of the story: if you are into the scottsdale drinking scene bring your date here they serve a strong cocktail, if you are into good food look elsewhere.

Do yourself a favor and try the pork belly pastrami appetizer. Or the scallops. Or better yet, both. You will thank me later.   Great ambiance without being "too much". I would recommend Citizen for a date or nice night out with the girls. If you happen to be flying solo or hanging out with the boys, the good looking gentlemen behind the bar will make you feel at home and whip you up a delicious cocktail.  I appreciate how passionately the staff talks about the food. CPH definitely gets my stamp of approval.

My colleagues and I had the best experience at Citizen Public House.  While in Scottsdale for a meeting last week, I was tasked to find a great place for dinner and this place was recommended.  When we first arrived, I immediately liked the vibe and trendy look of the place.  Dim lights and their cool interior created just the right casual elegant atmosphere that I love. When we arrived, our party of 11 were seated quickly in a semi private area alongside the dining room that was perfect.  All cocktails and food were excellent and exceptional which is important for any 5 star rating.  But what solidified 5 stars for me was our stellar waiter Sam.  Talk about exceptional service and someone who so naturally has mastered the concept of connecting with customers.  He was funny, sociable,  enthusiastic and addressed me by name.  He flawlessly handled our party's cocktail demands without a hitch.  We went through quite a few rounds but he was on point and attentively got our cocktails ordered and served with such efficiency.  He then suggested we leave the ordering to him, where he would help decide on the best appetizers, mains and desserts to serve our party.  He nailed it.  We all absolutely loved the fondue, burrata, chopped salad (extremely tasty!), seared tuna, rack of lamb, scallops, shortribs and chocolate and caramel desserts that were just too luscious to describe.  We literally just sat back, relaxed and enjoyed an exceptional meal and service.  Bravo Citizen Public House, for standout food, service and such a star waiter like Sam!

My friends and I came here as a big group for a birthday dinner. For some reason I thought this was more of a bar, but it is actually a foodie's delight! Our group was quite a handful (the drinks were flowing, therefore we were all very chatty... with everyone around us) but the server was SO nice and accommodating. None of us could decide on anything so we decided to get everything instead. My highlights...  #1: Chopped salad. Doesn't sound like much but literally THE BEST SALAD EVER. It's probably not the healthiest salad in the world, but is so so so worth it.  #2: Pan seared scallops. Perfect seared outside, nice smooth delicate inside. Delicious entree.   Overall, great bar area for mingling/happy hour and a fantastic foodie spot as well.

We had a dinner with 4 last night and would fate this as an average restaurant. Obviously went because of the reviews, but did not find the food, service or ambiance remarkable. The grilled octopus was nice, but the remainder of the food disappointed. In an area with lots of competition, we would recommend trying another spot.  I also agree with the other reviews that the inside seating is loud and we noticed a number of people move to outside seating.

I was looking forward to the heart of Carmel, but my server said it came off the menu six months ago. I substituted the Black and Tan which was lovely but probably not the same. I enjoyed my chopped salad but it was not one that I was used to. My server Robbie was exceptional!

Good food. Very knowledgeable staff. Great drinks. Cool ambiance. Atmosphere was a little muted, especially for a Saturday night. Not that many people there and the tables are spread far apart. Overall though, a great restaurant for Scottsdale.

I have been here a few times for business dinners.  Not my choice, but my boss's choice.  :)  The menu is heavy on the meat, so perhaps not the best choice for vegetarians and vegans.  However, they are willing to customize your meal to your liking.  A couple of things off the top of my head from the menu that I can remember that are vegetarian are the olives (appetizer), the green salad (appetizer, comes with goat cheese), and the Hippie Dippie sandwich (comes with cheese).  My waitress was very helpful to create a vegan entree for me.  They have a vegan entree, but it is not on the menu, so you'll have to ask for it.  It is a marinated and cooked portobello mushroom with purple rice, and cooked kale.  To be honest, I can make better tasting vegan food at home.  It was just okay.  But I was happy that they were accommodating to my desires for a vegan meal.

Get the Chopped Salad! Always busy in a fun part of town so get a reservation.  Really interesting menu & craft cocktails. The chopped salad is notoriously awesome! Went for my birthday & couldn't resist the Fried Bologna salad?!  I know sounds so cheap & weird but it was so amazing! Don't forget to try some of their custom on sight aged & flavored whiskey! (if you like that sort of thing)
Place has a nice feel to it. The food is good but it is expensive and the portion is lacking.

I went to this highly recommeded restaurant for my birthday dinner. I was looking for great food, service and a cool vibe. Well, I found it! From the moment we were greeted by the pleasant hostess our experience was nothing but professional and welcomming. The place was moderately busy on a Thursday night, service staff bustling around, but not "panic mode." Our server (Gary?)was very knowledgable of all the menu items and the wine list. We were told by him as well as friends that we had to get the pork belly pastami app, it was the best thing we had! The crab cakes were good, not the best I ever had, but I would get them again. The short rib entree was outstanding. Perfect balance of savory, salty, sweet, sour etc. Gary even split the dish for us even though we didn't ask for that, he over heard us saying we were going to share, very nice touch. We passed on dessert, since i had a special one waiting at home for me. Gary still brought me a tiny box of truffles to enjoy later and knowledged my birthday, with out a big fanfare (which is what i prefer) We didn't have any cocktails, since I was having a champagne kinda night, but I know Richie Moe makes some of the best cocktails in town. We will be definately be back soon and I have already told many people of our experience. Thanks to gary and the rest of the staff for a memorable b-day dinner :)

Citizen Public House is my go to place for an amazing bite to eat and excellent service. I have been to CPH at least 6 or more times and every time I am never disappointed.   CPH is comfort food taken to the next level. Whether you order the Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn (don't fear it, it's awesome) or the chicken and waffles, taste bud satisfaction is the norm at this place.   I think the reason I keep coming back, despite the excellent food and amazing white sangria is the amazing service. Whether it's a busy Saturday night, or an early dinner on a weekday I am continually impressed with their level of knowledge and service at CPH. It's how a restaurant experience should be, and it's consistently amazing, just like the food. A plus also is they offer Gluten-Free options for my celiac sister. Believe me she is very hard to please, but CPH always puts her at ease when it comes to the GF options. Go to CPH and I promise you will not be disappointed.  What I love to order: white sangria, original chopped salad, pan seared scallops

They have a great cocktail list, and offer affordable bar snacks. From rosemary roasted nuts to assorted olives, plenty to choose from. Oh, and order the Original Chopped Salad. You won't be sorry. One of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale.

We visited her Mother's Day weekend, and shared quite a few of the dishes, but the most memorable was the short ribs. I make short ribs at home, and even use a coffee rub, and  I often order them when dining out, but these were the best, hands down. I hope to return here on my next visit to the Phoenix area. Any guesses as to what I will order??
All of the bartenders are true mixologists and always willing to answer questions or explain drinks.  Had a lot of fun on every visit while enjoying superb cocktails.
Food was burnt,  what else is there to say.  Nothing worse than horrible service and burnt food.  Spent $96 dollars total.  Next time I will buy steaks at Costco and call it a day.

This place is going to turn me into a alcoholic.  The cocktails here get five, big, huge amazing stars.  They are as great as everyone says they and you will want to order "one of everything" - and that's okay.  I started with the Citi-Zen as the waiter said it was their most popular and I was not disappointed. I followed that up with a traditional Pisco Sour - I say traditional because they include a RAW EGG in their recipe - just like the pisco sours in South America!  The menu is slightly lacking in the 'vegetarian' department, but to be fair our waiter did offer up an off-the-menu risotto type dish for my honey and I.  Instead, we ordered this grilled cheese type sandwich. Okay, but get this, the cheese itself is grilled. Its this weird/awesome Middle Eastern cheese that doesn't melt easily so they put a thick cheese slice on the grill! YUM!!   Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable in both the food and cocktail menu and brought us out a complimentary dessert for our anniversary.The decor itself was kind of plain and lacked in the ambiance department - but after two or three Pisco Sours, who cares?!

Good foods. Had pork cheek and meatloaf. Pork Cheek. Well cooked and tasted 5 flavors like Chinese uses when they cooked pork. Thought about the owner or the chef is oriental. Anyway, it was good.  Meatloaf. Good. Nothing I can say more.   I think this restaurant is fusion style which I don't like most of all. But...this restaurant deserves 5 stars for the taste of foods and servers. Waiters are well trained for upsales. Need to hire him in my restaurant.

For anyone that wants a wicked cocktail, a great meal, and an atmosphere that is part speakeasy (barrel aged cocktails by a mixologist with a heart) and part modern incarnation of Cheers (truly felt like everyone that worked there new my wife's and my name)...go to this place.  Everything from the bar is a gift (thanks to Michael who is a true artist and a helluva guy) and anything from the kitchen is worth skipping meals for the rest of the week (this ain't your mom's meatloaf).  Hands down the best meal in Scottsdale.  So bummed this place isn't just down the street from my house in Portland.  Citizen something special. Go there tomorrow.

I really dig this place, the white linin, the neatly lined tables, clean and orderly...I love the original chop salad, the tuna is always so fresh there isn't a hint of 'fishy' anywhere near it. A must have for me Overall, the place garners 3.5 dollar signs, It's a bit pricey and pretentious but save up order a whiskey cocktail and enjoy the atmosphere.

Here is a straight up review. Food was decent, prices were avg for Scottsdale, Service was ok as well. Atmosphere is where it lacked. The place echoed and WAY too loud. Almost to the point of annoyance. Unfortunately that is something that would be hard to correct. I still give it 3 stars though

4.5 stars.  Service:  Friendly, attentive, and helpful - this place did a great job of hiring a 5 star staff  Atmosphere: Trendy, yet casual - you can pass with jeans, but I did see a couple tables that were pretty dressed up  Drink: The Citi-Zen cocktail was a little on the sweet side, but still absolutely amazing  Food: The pork belly pastrami and chopped salad were the highlights of the evening as they were both delicious. We also ordered the buttermilk chicken, which was good but nothing special, and the scallops, which were extremely salty - on the border of being inedible.  Overall, even though Citizen didn't stand out enough to make this a 5 star review, it's still a great place to eat in the Scottsdale area.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Old Town! When my husband called to make a reservation he happened to mention that the dinner was for our anniversary. Not only did the hostess welcome us when we arrived by saying happy anniversary but there was a nice card on the table and we were served two flutes of champagne when we sat down! Those nice extra touches made our dinner that much more special and memorable. I love the omfg salad and every dinner we've had there has always been flavorful and delicious. Service is friendly and sincere and we can't recommend it enough to our visiting friends and family!

Word fail. They elevate taste and dining to new levels I never thought possible. Sheer perfection. We could think or talk if nothing else but our blown away taste buds. You must dine here to complete your experience as a human being.

Happy New Year 2016!! We wanted to celebrate our first meal of the new year in style and ventured over to Citizen Public House for lunch.   It wasn't too crowded, but we wanted to keep it casual and sat at the bar. Our friendly bartender came over and went through the menu with us. He spoke with such enthusiasm and passion for the food. We decided to go along with all his recommendations.  Appetizer: The Original Chopped Salad: By the name, chopped salad sounds like rabbit food, but our server warned us that we would soon be chopped salad addicts. He was absolutely right! WOW! It was one of the best salads we had ever eaten!! The separated ingredients were beautifully presented to us on a platter and then mixed together with a delicious dressing. Smoked salmon, couscous, dried corn, diced tomato, trail mix, arugula, creamy dressing-the perfectly articulated combination. The texture and flavors were really incredible and we all fought for the last few bites. I would come back just for the salad alone! I found out later that this particular salad has its own Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/TheOriginalChoppedSalad  Crab cakes: Scrumptious and served with unique crunchy cole slaw. There was a decent amount of lump crab in the cakes for being in Arizona and not near the ocean.   Entree: Duck burger with duck fat fries, how meta! The duck burger was mouth-watering with shishito aioli, fried egg, tomato, spinach, and potato bun. Juicy and incredibly flavorful.   Short ribs: We were drawn to the dish because of the local coffee rub. The meat was super tender.   Dessert: The Dude Jar: Intrigued by the name, we tried out this dessert. Basically it tasted like pudding with some crunchy cookies.   Anyway, back to the main star of this meal- the chopped salad! You must try this dish! So thankful that our server made this recommendation. Absolutely superb service and food! What a fantastic way to start the new year!

I've been here several times and just realized I never reviewed it. Shame on me.   My first visit here was about 2 years ago and that is when my addiction to the import started. Let's just say the import is a drink that is made with Jameson, Guinness foam and stuff like tobacco bitters. Take my word you want 1 or maybe even 3.   The bacon popcorn is awesome as a starter or a desert. Both wins in life.   I've had the filet, their rotating specials, the porkchop, meatloaf and burger here before and not one bad bite of food.   This place is trendy so it gets busy fast. Also get ready to pay a little more but the quality is top notch.

This restaurant was a huge disappointment. I ordered the short rib which was extremel dry and the parsnip purée had way too much cinnamon and tasted really strange. My husband got the meatloaf - one of his favorite meals - and it was not restaurant quality. To top it off, our waiter was stuck up and rude.

My oh my... I've never been happier to accidentally stumble upon a restaurant. It was one of those dining experiences where everything was perfect from the food to the service. I was debating between this restaurant and Bandera since both have excellent reviews, but I realized there was a Bandera location in Chicago so that helped me make my choice.   Starting with drinks, I've always wanted to try a Moscow Mule, and at Citizen Public House, all of their drinks have a signature mix to them. I HIGHLY recommend it... it was done way before we received any food :)  Now onto the food...   I ordered the Pan Seared Scallops with Roasted Corn Grits - it was one of the BEST meals of my life!!!! I've had scallops numerous of times, but these were the most delicious and delicate I've ever tasted. The corn grits were an incredible addition to the scallops as well... just trust me and get them!  My fiancé had the Buttermilk Roasted Chicken - smart Chicken breast, sweet corn-butter bean succotash, roasted Brussels sprouts, truffle oil, pecorino Romano. It's a very popular item and I tried a bit and it was great (not as good as my scallops though). We both practically licked our plates clean... and he's not much of a food lover ;-p  We were stuffed, so no room for dessert, but I WILL be back when I'm in the area again. Our server, who's name I forgot, was excellent and very helpful. The entire night was amazing and definitely the best dinner of our trip to AZ!

This was hands down the best meal I had during my recent trip to Phoenix.  Our waiter was very friendly and helpful - walking us through the menu, making suggestions, and just being overall very pleasant.  My husband and I started with the Pork Belly Pastrami, which was tender and delicious.  We scarfed down the whole thing.  For entrees, I went with the scallops and grits.  The scallops were nicely prepared, but I could have eaten a whole bowl of just the grits with bacon. Mm - so so good. My husband had the short ribs which were definitely the right way to go.  They were delicious.  And, even though we were both too full to move, I really wanted to try the bread pudding, so we went for it.  So. worth. it.    The only unfortunate thing was that at 8:00 on the Sunday night before Columbus day, the restaurant was pretty much empty.  I would have expected more of a crowd - it felt a little ... i don't know..not happening.   But, despite the lack of a crowd, this place stands on its food and service and I will definitely be back the next time I'm in AZ

OMG, you guys, I think I'm in love.  Maybe I've been stuck in the suburbs for too long, but I was so impressed with Citizen.  I finally had a chance to check it out, and during "social hour" no less.  I had been hearing about those barrel aged cocktails, so I had to give one a try.  I don't normally go for the bourbon and whiskey cocktails, so the waiter recommended the Pacific Coast Cocktail, and described it as "sort of their version of sangria".  It was really good, really strong and $5 to boot (during social hour).  I had to switch to wine after that because I didn't want to get completely wasted in front of a bunch of strangers.  I also took the liberty of ordering the bacon fat popcorn for the table because Holy Jesus.  Bacon.  Popcorn.  How could you go wrong?  You can't, and this was truly sent from heaven.  Or hell, maybe.  Either way, it was freaking amazing and I would eat it every day if I could.    I ordered the Short Rib, much to my boyfriend's chagrin.  I always seem to order what he wants, and then he has to order something else (sorrynotsorry).  Oh Lord, not to be a yelp stereotype here, but it was TO DIE for.  Short Rib?  Amazing.  Parsnip Mash?  Why didn't I think of this?  Swiss Chard?  Yes.  And it is gluten free, for those of you on that food trip.  Our waiter was totally on top of things, made great suggestions, and was super sweet.  Basically, everything I ask for in a waiter.  And the atmosphere?  Yes, it has that "cool, hipster vibe" described by other reviewers, but I like it, and I didn't find it pretentious or snobby at all.    Overall, I want to go to CPH like EVERYDAY, but alas, I cannot.  I will settle for going as often as I can to enjoy their delicious food and libations.  And I encourage you to do the same.

If I could have given a negative star I would have. Those with ALLERGIES, BEWARE!  I planned a birthday dinner here for 8 of us. Coming here nearly ruined our night. Called in advance to inform them of my allergy and request that they simply change their gloves and use clean cutters when touching my food to ensure that I don't get sick on my special night. The waiter raised his voice at me and said that he could write it on the paper but wasn't sure if those preparing the meal would actually change their gloves, that they were too busy to care. He probably didn't realize he kept spitting on me when he spoke, he was so animated about it. I explained that it was my birthday that day and that I had called in advance. I had all my guests seated and didn't know how I could eat there if I couldn't trust them to honor basic food preparation guidelines for those with allergies. He continued to insist that they get too many orders and may not follow these guidelines. When my friend began getting upset and asked him to just make sure that it happens, he yelled "what did you say?!" in an extremely rude manner. By then there was no way we could order there and risk getting sick or trusting the food he brings out. All 8 of us walked out and had to find a new place for my birthday dinner at the last minute on a Saturday night. Would definitely NOT  recommend this place. Such a shame that they turned away our business, spoke rudely to us, and even didn't apologize for their behavior even after I informed the receptionist that we were very offended by the way we were treated by their server. So disappointed.

Went this past weekend - little loud and dark. It was restaurant week so went with those selections.  The salads we perfectly constructed but the entrees were good, not great. Based on the previous reviews I had high expectations and it didn't quite meet them.
Love the service, the waitress is so nice and very helpful with all the quest I asked. Recommendations for dishes are excellent! Love this place
Pork Belly = DELICIOUS. Scallops? I. Don't. Even. LIKE. Scallops, and these were A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Fun and tasty cocktails.  Next time I'm in Phoenix, I WILL go back here. Highly recommend.

I hate to go against the usual rating for this place, but after my experience Friday night I really don't see how a 4 star is warranted. I must say though, I do see the potential and would go back again to give it a second try, but here are my thoughts about my first experience at Citizen Public House.   First of all, we went to CPH during restaurant week for a business dinner, so part of my experience may be tainted by the reason I was there. I really felt the initial service was lacking. We wanted to change seats, but our waitress didn't come to our table for about 10 minutes, so we had to ask the hostess to move us. Then, it took another 10 minutes to clear another table, which was empty in order for us to move seats. Once we were seated at the new table, our waitress was prompt, helpful, and extremely delightful.   As far as the food goes, I was expecting to be blown away based on the reviews. My experiences at FnB and other restaurants in town completely surpassed CPH food. I did love the pork fat popcorn. I had never had something like that at a restaurant and I loved the bacon. It seems that CPH loves bacon overall as it was very present on their menu, including apple bacon bread pudding, which was just alright. I had the smart chicken which was really standard chicken and risotto. My Husband really enjoyed his scallops, but didn't like the coffee pot dessert.   So, long story short, I would give CPH a second try, but I wouldn't go running back any time soon. I'd say my experience was unique given the trend on yelp.

I was really looking forward to this place after reading such good reviews but HOLY COW what a disappointment. I have no idea how anyone would rate their food five star quality.   There were four of us. All of us had different dishes -all terrible. We all had different mixed cocktails all tasted horrible. The speakeasy upstairs know how to make a cocktail. The bartenders downstairs DON'T.   The service was slow and it was so loud I could barely hear myself think.   But if you are a single guy on the prowl for cougars, there is quite an abundance to choose from here.

We are visiting Scottsdale from Chicago and found Citizens on yelp. We ate here for dinner on a Thursday night. I love the atmosphere. There is a bar in the middle of the restaurant - a great place to hang out for a drink after work or with friends. They have a great beer selection.   Our server was amazing and super nice and had some fabulous food recommendations. My husband and I ordered the famous chopped salad and added the smoked salmon. Hands down this was THE BEST chopped salad I have ever had. I had the scallops with the corn grits. So delicious! My husband got the short ribs with a coffee rub. They were super tender and came with a yummy cherry bbq sauce.

I am always excited for dinner at the CPH! I am sure every review says it, but seriously, order the chopped salad. I've been here several times and I always get the salad and then try something else from the menu. Nearly everything has been delicious, especially the chia seared tuna. My boyfriend had the crab cakes last time we were here, and I recall them being a bit of a miss.  The drink menu has something for everyone from cocktails and beer to a complete wine list.   Great place for a date night or dinner with friends. Although I will caution, when the place is full, it can be very loud and hard to hear.

5 stars. Service, food, atmosphere, friendly staff and very knowledgeable waiter. There was no waiting (for table or for food) even on a Friday night. Food was phenomenal. Love pastrami pork belly, their specialty salad and my main dish (spare rib).

My husband and I specifically made reservations for this place to see what all the hype was about.  Upon arrival, we were greeted and told to have a seat in their waiting area (we may have been about 5 minutes early). However, the slight disappointment came when we were now waiting 20 minutes past our reservation time.   After the unacknowledged and unapolgetic wait from the front staff, we were finally seated at the most awkward booth ever. It was shaped like a really short rainbow which forced us to awkwardly stare at two girls about a foot away eating their dinner. As it was quite uncomfortable for us, I'm sure it was even more strange for them.   With regards to the food and beverages, here's what we ordered: Amaro Meatloaf, Duboc Pork Loin, their Black and Tan for dessert, and a Sour Pisco and Tipperary to help wash it all down.  I can't say there was anything extraordinary about this place or the list of things they have for you to consume but most of it was better than your average with one exception: the Black and Tan. I truly think this is their money maker. I'm not too big on sugary things but this was absolute perfection - the kind that makes a Negative Nancy want something fancy.
Fun and knowledgeable bar staff. Had bacon popcorn. Fantastic!! Excellent happy hour with half price drafts and great appetizers.

The food was good, but the drink list was really the star of this show.  They feature some classic cocktails that you don't find too often, as well as some truly unique drinks.  Definitely try the Midwest Manhattan, Moe'scow Mule, and Persian.  Our waiter was excellent, and provided wonderful recommendations.  Husband had the spare ribs, which were delicious.  I had the meatloaf, which was definitely a step up from mom's meatloaf.  Prepare for big portions.

Looking for a place in Scottsdale open late, my friend and I were very surprised to stroll into CPH at 9 pm and find a very classy place. As we were seated, we had this nagging feeling that we'd look at a menu that was $25 a plate or more. Thankfully, most of the menu was very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food, which I'll get into later.  The service was downright flawless. I wish I remembered the name of my waitress, because she was probably the most attentive waitress I've had in years. The atmosphere is classy, very white and black. However, the indie rock playing on the restaurant speakers reassured me that this was a place that was also comfortable with being casual as well, a juxtaposition that I am sure only exists in the state of Arizona.  Now, to the food. I wasn't in an appetizer mood, so I went right in with the Wagyu Burger. I am not kidding when I say THIS WAS THE BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD THE PLEASURE OF CONSUMING! I ordered it medium well, as is typical with me and burgers, but with the quality of the meat they used, I should have gone with medium at least in retrospect. Everything in the burger, the bun, the veggies, the cheese, the homemade mayo they had on the side, was flawless. The arugula fries on the side were some of the best fries I've ever had as well, and went amazingly well with their homemade ketchup.  The cocktails were expensive and didn't contain anything that particularly stood out at me, but I'm sure they're great if you like what's in them. I paired my burger with a Duvel, which is great because I can rarely find that beer anywhere and it went perfectly.  For dessert, I had the Cookies and Milk since I was feeling pretty full from the burger but still wanted a nice way to cap my evening. What I got was a bag of five of the best cookies I have ever tasted. They came in exotic flavors such as "spicy chocolate fudge" and "apple bacon brittle oatmeal" so if you want to take your sweet tooth on an adventure, I highly recommend it.  This is quite a place if you're looking for a classy joint to enjoy a few drinks and great food, especially kind of late or on a date. One of the best places in the area, IMO.

The starter foods were fantastic....the food was perhaps a little too fancy for my liking. I don't care for sweetened mashe potatoes :) you may say that's just a personal preference, but this is just a personal preference post :) The atmosphere is beautiful but not great for large parties because the sound is way too loud. I could only realistically speak to the person next to me and have meaningful conversation.
great service, food, and atmosphere. Loved the scallops, chicken, and chopped salad! Try their other restaurant, "The Gladly" in Biltmore, too!

Citizen Public House  Citizen is my favorite place for happy hour when I'm in old town. Their cocktails are always strong and perfectly executed (thank you Brandon Casey), and there's a good selection for $6 on their happy hour menu. The Rose Garland with bourbon, Solerno blood orange, Sangue Morlacco (Luxardo) liqueur, and coffee-caramel bitters is my personal favorite, probably the best twist on an old fashioned I've ever had. They also make an awesome Bulleit julep.   You really can't go wrong with any of the food here, but you absolutely can't leave without getting Bernie Kantak's infamous chopped salad - smoked salmon, pepitas, freeze dried corn, Israeli couscous, bruschetta and arugula. The ingredients might sound a little strange together, but trust me, it's freaking magical. There's a reason this salad has its own Facebook page - it's basically a local celebrity. FYI: if you're ever flying out of Terminal 4 at PHX, you can pick one up to go at Cowboy Ciao by the B gates. The short ribs and scallops are my other favorites from their menu. And if somehow you saved room for dessert, the pot du creme is absolute heaven.   Don't forget to sign up for the In Good Spirits mailing list - you get a free chopped salad for your birthday!

We followed the recommendations of the waitress and got the chef specialties, pork belly pastrami, chopped salad, the duck and the scallops. The results, a wonderful meal. One of the bests I've had in the Phoenix area.

Good sized bar surrounded by tables with white table cloths, casual, sophisticated atmosphere.  Wine from US, France, New Zealand.  Good selection.  Everything from inexpensive snacks to sandwiches and salads to delicious full blown meals.  The whole nine yards done well.  I had the pork loin served creatively with sweet potato in phillo with delicious goat cheese and figs.  Absolutely delicious.  My date had halibut and was very happy with it.

Citizen Public House is a gastropub in the Old Town Scottsdale that has vibrant local community feel.  Food was excellent:  - Shrimp and tomato salad - Amaro meatloaf  Both dishes were simple, but execution made the difference.

This my first review on yelp. I'm not usually one to review anything but felt compelled after the delicious meal my family had here.  I was a little skeptical about the chopped salad but after having it, I would highly recommend.  The service was excellent too.

In town for spring training and wanted to have a nice dinner after eating ballpark food...lol. This place is phenomenal.  We ordered an appetizer, Pork Cheeks which were to die for.   For our main entree I had the Rack lamb and my friend ordered the short ribs.  Both were delicious and we are still raving about how good dinner was the next day.  Definitely try this restaurant you won't be disappointed.

Love this place.  Great atmosphere, great drinks and wonderful food.  The Original Chopped Salad is the best salad ever and I'm glad CPH has it on the menu.  The scallops are also delicious.  The best thing is the bar.  CPH has a ton of great and unique drinks and for those who can't make up their minds, the bartenders will concoct something great for you.  Only things that get it 4 versus 5 stars are the menu--I love what I've eaten but would like to see more options, and some of the staff are not knowledgeable about the menu and could be a bit friendlier (i.e. I went while pregnant but not yet showing and declined to order a drink and the waiter acted like I was absolutely nuts.  He kept asking me if I changed my mind and wanted a drink).

My wife and I finally tried CPH and were greatly surprised by everything.  The food, as expected, was superior along with the professionalism of the staff.  The ambiance too was well set as the place could hold large parties very comfortably.   We began the nigth with a bottle of wine, the original chopped salad alons with the rock shrimp.  All were exceptional!  As out main courses, my wife orded the sea scallops and I ordered the short ribs.  (Peter of Cowboy Ciao's must miss this guy.)  Both dinners were cooked to perfection and the staff never left alone.  For dessert, we had coffee and the evening's special, the donut holes with three dipping sauces.  All were fantastic.  The wife and I don't usually rate places with five stars, but this place actually gets how food and service are meant to be as one.  Can't wait until we head back.

Five stars for the cocktails, desserts, and service, four stars for the entrees I've sampled so far and the ambiance.  Over a total of four visits to CPH, I've sampled five of their cocktails and a number of their appetizers and desserts along with two entrees, met and interacted meaningfully with all three of the owners (including the at least locally-renowned Chef Bernie Kantak, creator of Cowboy Ciao's Stetson Chop Salad [which is recreated here]), and generally thoroughly enjoyed myself on each occasion.   The space is large enough to accommodate large parties or couples with equal aplomb. I've twice now toured the private upstairs space, and look forward to finding a fitting occasion to fill it with close friends.   I've had fantastic service upon each of my visits - twice sitting at the bar, once at a Yelp event, and finally for a normal dinner, and feel completely confident in suggesting CPH to the most demanding diner.   I'll update or edit this review to talk more about the food once I've had the short ribs and the lamb burger. The entrees I've tried thus far (the salmon and the chicken) didn't quite plumb the depths of my soul, and while the appetizers I sampled on other occasions were excellent, I don't remember any of them well enough to cover them in any detail. Hey, it was a busy month! I will say that the salads I've tasted are all amazing and that the bread pudding dessert was an absolute revelation right up there with the one delivered to John on the Isle of Patmos.  I've saved what I feel to be the best feature of CPH for last: the drinks. I could attempt to describe the feeling of anticipation I felt watching Richie rinse the old fashioned glass in preparation for a sazerac, or the deep happiness the feel of the froth of the pisco sour brings me when it hits my lips, or even the wistful yet satisfied feeling I got when I drained the last drops of the bijou (pronounced bizh-OOOh) from its martini glass, but I won't bore you any further - just go and taste (and *feel*) for yourself.  The wine and beer lists will certainly offer you something you'll love, should your tastes run that way.    In sum: good food and great drinks served by lovely people in a nice setting for reasonable prices. Far and away my favorite bar in Old Town.
Second time here and it did not disappoint! Had a wonderful dinner and Gary was our waiter... service was great and food was amazing!

"Have you ever been over to a friend's house to eat and the food just aint' no good?"  You know the famous line from the Sugar Hill Gang. You won't have to feel that way at this house, because this house has the sauce that is awesome.  Yeah, Citizen Public House might just be the most legit place in all of Arizona. I don't know what took me so long to get here.  This is a destination for foodies, and not just because it's been featured on the Cooking Channel or the Food Network.  Some Highlights:  --Tender Belly Bacon Fat Popcorn! (Not for the pretentious and idiotic) --Gorgonzola-Emmental mac-n-cheese (Not for the lactose) --The Chopped Salad (This ish is famous yo) --The Squealer Burger (yeah, it has bacon in it)  This place is absolutely amazing.  If you appreciate food, and can afford to splurge both in the wallet and palate, then make this a destination.   Absolutely worth it. Next time, I want to try the Lamb Burger.  Also, the cocktail and draught list is solid. Goose Island Matilda FTW! (Yes, I know its a Budweiser product)

Wow I never thought I would find delicious food in Scottsdale. I was here for Spring Training. Here to see my SF Giants. Go Giants!  I tried to make reservations through Open Table and nothing was available for the night. SO I called and the gentleman accommodated us by saving a table in the patio for us. If service was this good, I was already thinking the food must be good as well. When we arrived, we got seated. Yeah.   We ordered the Original Chopped Salad. They mix the salad at your table. The salad was the best chopped salad I've ever had. It even has it's own Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/TheOriginalChoppedSalad  We also got the Pan Seared Scallops to share. Since they knew we were sharing our food, they divided the entree to 2 dishes. Wow! That's service. Scallops were cooked to perfection. Very tasty and I wanted more!  We got the Bernie's Mac 'n Cheese and was also really good.  So CPH is known for the house cocktails. We HAD to order. Midwest Manhattan and the Sangria are amazing. If you like a good manhattan, go for this one!  As for dessert, we shared the blueberry pie with graham cracker ice cream!!! I LOVED it!  Overall, I was pleasantly surprised with CPH. They had fantastic service and memorable food. If I lived in Scottsdale, I would be a regular.

This place rocks. The real deal.  Late night menu is a real treat.  Superb mixologists at the bar.  Mind blowing cocktails.  High quality food that's fresh and scrumptious.  I love going here prior to partying in Old Town Scottsdale.  Very sexy establishment.
Perhaps it is me, I prefer decent portions and good food over the "plate presentation" of some places, such as this one.

The high stars for this place don't lie! It's a very unassuming looking place and the interior is simple but obviously upscale. We went here for our anniversary and they offered us some complimentary bubbly to celebrate! The food was delicious and we went home very happy with the food, service, and overall experience.

Really not sure what all the hype is about.  Ate here about 3 weeks ago and it was nothing but forgetful - no really had to look at menu to figure out what we ate...   He -  the scallops, they were good enough She (me) - the short ribs.  Not very tender and just OK.  I can make them better.   Burrata was our starter -  Good but again nothing that left any real impression.  Not the type of place that left me thinking "Gosh I cant wait to return".  Probably wont.

I'm still kicking myself for not venturing into Citizen long ago.  I found myself hungry and wanting a good meal a week back.  Citizen had always been in the back of mind and I decided to make my way to Old Town and give it a try.  Do not walk, run to Citizen.    I was greeted warmly by staff and a lovely atmosphere.  Dark wood beams surrounded by warm butter colored walls and soft candle light.  White table cloths and black and white pictures adorn the walls of this beautiful structure.  I started with the pastrami pork belly with hints of horseradish that play perfectly with mustard and brussel sprouts.  A dish that could be too rich if executed carelessly.  Absolutely perfect.  Followed by the scallops.  Perfectly cooked to medium rare.  Very sweet with the right amount of pan sear.    The staff is attentive and not overwhelming.  I felt at home.  I'm still dreaming of the pastrami pork belly.  Well done, my friends.  Well done.

I can't believe I've never reviewed this place! Their food and drinks are always fantastic & on point. It's a definite go to place in the neighborhood. Mac & Cheese-eat it, chopped salad-eat it, anything else that sounds good to you-eat that too.   Go there, eat some delicious food, drink some great cocktails, & thank me later.
Amazing service!! Food is incredible. Love it!!!!! Would definitely suggest this for a date night. Try the dessert!!

This is one of the highest rated restaurants in the area. I didn't know what to expect here. I was in T-shirt and jeans which seemed a bit underdressed because people were in dress shirts and ladies in nice blouses.   Food:  I ordered Scallops and a beer.  Scallops - Cooked to perfection.   Service:  I sat by the bar and didn't really need much service. The bartenders were fairly attentive though dropping by every now and then to see if I wanted another beer.   Environment:  Great first date spot. Heck there were 3 couples in the bar area that seemed like it was their first date. Good food with loud vibes. Dress to impress type of restaurant.   Price:  $20 - $40 per head.   Food: 5 Service: 5 Environment: 5 Price: 3

Sat nite @ CPH. Early dining at the bar as is our wont. Lotsa room at 5:30; crowded by 6:15. Service was outstanding. Could not have been made to feel more welcome by the entire bar staff. They serve a killer sazerac and have a monster selection of liqueurs. Is there another place in town that features a ' sausage of the day'? Chorizo soup was the s-o-d this lucky night. A richly textured meal in itself, I piled on with the mac n cheese which could've earned the 5 stars on it's own. They offered to add sausage: Momma didn't raise no fool, I accepted. CPH earned the hype! Hope you love it like we did.

Just came for dessert but it was tasty! Cocoa chile bread pudding and some brownie madness dish. Both awesome. Drinks were great too -  had the Citi-zen and hot pink paloma (not hot pink btw). Lots of furniture moving out of dining area during peak evening hours was kind of loud/annoying and seemingly unnecessary but otherwise great service and fare. Ambiance on patio was ok.
After visiting this place, I enjoyed the drinks and food; however I was sent out of due to homophobic reasons

The service was great. We had a table of about 16 people, and our server was very attentive and helpful. The atmosphere is a very lively but classy. I ordered the Jerk Short Rib Tacos, which were delicious. My friend ordered the Chopped Salad, which I think is the best thing on the menu. Definitely will come again!

In my first review, I indicated I would give this place another chance.  So glad I did!  After a concert Thursday night, we decided to stop in here for a late night drink.  It was pretty late, so not much of a crowd.  The lights were dim, the atmosphere was cozy, and I was happy to see an interesting tap selection.  I had some kind of pale ale by Anchor Steam, and it was yummy.  While I hadn't intended to eat anything, I saw the late night menu and had to try the hummus plate. Best part?  The sweet pickled baby cucumbers. Just like my mom makes!  Bartenders were knowledgable and attentive, crowd was mellow,  it was a romantic way to end our night out, and our last night for this trip to Scottsdale.  Couldn't have been better!

I'm giving it 5 stars in many ways due to the context of being in Arizona. I have to spend a lot of time in AZ for work and amid the myriad of chain restaurants and mediocre food this place stands out far above the rest.   The Chopped Salad is nothing short of excellent, quite possibly the best salad I've had in my life. Look at my photos. Go, look at them. Do I look like a salad guy? No, I do not. Yet every time I come here I have to get one (once I even got two...yes, I'm a monster). The ingredients, the freshness, how it all works together, it's just excellent. You must get this salad if you come here must. The rest of the menu is solid, albeit not as spectacular. Probably more 3.5 star caliber food, but still very good (espec. for AZ). I've had the Filet (3.5), a panini (3.5), the mac n cheese (not that special), the pastrami appetizer (very good), and scallops (very good). The desserts are also very good, I enjoyed the Peanut butter dessert and flourless choc. cake very much, although the latter is very heavy.   The ambiance and drinks are also excellent, making it a great date spot. Though there are a ton of slutty (sluttily?) dressed women here so keep your eyes on your date. But hey, that's Scottsdale, it comes with the territory
Everything was outstanding - appetizer (pork belly pastrami), main (amaro meatloaf) and dessert (black & tan). Service was very good also. Highly recommended.

Not sure what happened to my previous review, but... EXCELLENT FOOD. Our server, Gary, was super informative about the menu, and we even let him surprise us when we were being indecisive between two entrees (short ribs or meatloaf) after ordering the scallops. The scallops and braised short ribs were TOP NOTCH. We followed dinner with this chocolately, caramelly heaven of a dessert. So glad we decided to come here and have a new restaurant to enjoy when passing through PHX/Scottsdale.

This was as good a meal as I've had in quite a while, and that includes places like New York and San Francisco.  The food is exciting and delicious--no tired old dishes that you've had elsewhere.  The service was up-beat and cheerful.  And the food came surprisingly fast.  The restaurant is beautiful and not particularly noisy, even at the height of the dinner hour on Saturday.  I was surprised to be able to get a reservation for such a good place at the last minute, but maybe they had a cancellation.   We picked it entirely based on Yelp reviews.  We were a party of four and had the following:  1. Rosemary roasted nuts.  A bargain at $5, you get a large quantity of roasted nuts, warm and elegantly served.  One serving was plenty for 4.  2. 'Tender Belly' bacon fat heirloom popcorn.  Another $5 bargain.  Popcorn like you've never tasted anywhere else.    3. Crispy Squid. $9.  A pile of lightly-fried squid and a light, delicious dipping sauce.  The pickled fennel on the side is amazing.  4. Mirliton Chopped Salad.   $12.  I seldom like salads, and most are nothing to write home about, but this one was a delightful mix of flavors and textures--including popcorn.  I only used half the dressing they give you because I wanted to taste the ingredients, and that was the right call.  Start out with half and add more of you really need it.  5. For my main course I had the Fair Trade Coffee Charred Short Ribs  $28   The meat was pretty much perfect--crispy on the outside, tender inside.  The parsnip puree and greens were to die for.  No kidding.  6. My wife (and one other person) had the Pan Seared Scottish Salmon.  $26.  She asked for it rare, and it came perfectly rare, though still crisp on the outside.  I had a bite and it was delicious.  There were plenty of delicious beets to go with it, so I had a few of those, and loved every bite.  7.  One person in our party had the Pan Seared Scallops.  $17.  They were large and seared to perfection.  The side dishes were delicious, like everything else.  8  We've been trying to stay off deserts, but couldn't resist, so we ordered one of each of the four:  Irish Coffee Pot de Crème  $10.  This came in two layers--the chocolate at the bottom and the cream on top, with an embedded wafer.  One of the best I've had.  The Strawberry Pound Cake. $9.  I'm not a fan of strawberries or pound cake, but this was ordered by someone else and I had a taste and thought it was pretty good anyway.  "Pig in the Orchard" Bread Pudding.   $9.  My wife and I had jokingly said ahead of time that if there was a desert that used bacon, we'd order it, so we had to order this when we saw the desert menu.  It was unusual and amazing.  Just goes to show there's no dish that can't be made better by addition bacon fat to it.  Finally, we had the Cookies and Milk.  $6.  There were several cookies served in a paper bag with a glass of milk.  We only tried one, being full by then, and that one was quite unusual and delicious.  We took the rest with us and we'll find out tomorrow, but I have every confidence they'll be great.  Oh, yes, I ordered a Moscow Mule as a drink and it was pretty much perfect:  Served in a metal mug (as it's supposed to be, but seldom is nowadays), it  was made with real ginger beer (not ginger ale) and came with slices of cucumber in the mug.  Surprising attention to detail for a $10 drink.  Everything was carefully prepared and beautifully presented,  The staff was responsive and upbeat without being obsequious.  Everyone seemed genuinely proud of the restaurant, and with good reason.  I've spent a lot more money on meals coast-to-coast, and can't remember when I've had as good a meal, as pleasant a dining experience or as great a value.  I'm anxious to go back and try some of the dishes on the menu that we missed this time, and will certainly go back in my next visit to the Phoenix area.

The food and service were outstanding but the cocktails were a surprising fail.  We enjoyed the food immensely.  I never would have ordered the chopped salad without the advice of the other Yelpers and it was amazing.  What made it special was not just he flavors but also the way everything was chopped (of course) into very small pieces so it was easy to eat with large spoonfuls and get every flavor in every bite.  THe pork belly pastrami killed and was the best of the evening.  The scallops were excellent according to the guy that had them and wouldn't share as were the short ribs from the guys who was much more generous.  The beet appetizer was very good also.  Our server (Greg?) was excellent and really engaged with us and offered knowledgeable & confident advice on food, wine, and the unfortunate cocktails despite being very busy.  All this excellence is why I was surprised by the poor cocktails.  I started with The Beast - which tasted like blanco tequila on the rocks.  Now I love tequila, but that isn't what I ordered.  I'm a huge fan of Ancho Reyes but couldn't even pick up a hint of it or the limoncello or bitters.  I would have chalked this up to a mistake at the bar expect that the next cocktail - The Mexcacillin was only slightly better.  Despite being warned by our server that the smokiness could overpower lighter food - it wasn't very smoky at all and was itself overpowered by the grapefruit and lemon.  Not balanced at all.  Citizens need to get a mixologist with a better palette involved with the cocktail recipes.  Or at least stop promoting innovative and great sounding cocktails that are so poorly done.  But everything else is awesome.

Fantastic experience from beginning to end. Ask for Paul if you can, as a former server I can say he was beyond excellent. Cocktails were fantastic, including barrel aged manhattan and tequila drinks. Try the short ribs and scallops, but everyone loved everything we got.

This place has plenty of 5 star reviews, but I figured I would add another one! The food and drinks are of course delicious, but what impressed me was the incredible service! Everyone that we encountered from the hostess, to the bartender, to our server were super friendly and professional.

This place is awesome! 1st time and was blown away. Great bartenders, the layout and tried the bacon popcorn! Delicious.  Definitely looking forward to coming back and trying dinner there.    I had a variety of cocktails and all were superb.  The wine list is good too, reasonably priced.  If you have friends from out of town I'd definitely recommend this spot to take them to.

Second time here was not as pleasant as the first visit. This was during restaurant week. I loved dining the first time and was excited to dine the second time. This time around I tried the Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn for $5, their Fair Trade Short Ribs which is prepared with a coffee rub, dried cherry bbq sauce, roasted parsnip puree & seasonal veggies for $30; and their Bread Pudding for $6. The Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn was regular popcorn with bacon bits and fat. If you're a bacon lover you might want to taste this. It's a simple snack to munch on while reviewing the rest of the menu.  Hmm how shall I put this ....... I can only equate the entree dish to nothing but "Fair" - exactly as it says!! And I didn't get a fair trade at all either for $30. It was coffee rubbed so dry and over cooked that my jaws  were gnawing on each piece pretending to like that darn meat! I dipped each piece in the cherry BBQ sauce but it was still parched and punishing experience to the mouth. Luckily I had asked for the bread pudding which was well hydrated served with strawberries and cream. This is a restaurant week dessert not in their main menu.   The final straw of the evening was the check for a party of 9. At the bottom of their menu it states in fine print: Split checks unavailable for parties larger than 8. First of all, the waitress allowed one person in the group to have their own separate check leaving 8 people left. If you allowed one person then you must do for the rest at the same table.  Was she afraid she wouldn't get her 20% or more gratuity? If the waitress allowed one person in the group to have their own check the group becomes 8 people or less. Which means we CAN technically split the check any which way. Instead the waitress proceeds to tell us she can't do that. And on top of that she proceeds to tell us that we need to calculate our own tax and tip!! You mean to tell us that a nice sophisticated restaurant lacks a POS system with zero capabilities of generating the math for you?!?!?!  Here's another kicker: At the bottom of the original receipt the waitress hand wrote herself a 20% gratuity. Again, the POS system lacked being able to incorporate the added gratuity on a receipt and the total cost. I find that a shocker. After the whole fiasco and doing our own calculations and making it inconvenient for us diners we were glad it was over. The experience overall was a disaster but the bacon popcorn and bread pudding made up for a bit of it.  Maybe a hit and miss type of deal. :/ Never dine here with a group more than 8.

CPH is the real deal. Phenomenal food, friendly service, decent-size portions, nice wine list. Hubby had already been and was a fan, so we went for the New Year's Eve fixed-price deal. Chopped salad is justifiably renowned, but the chia-seared tuna is just as good. We're not usually big fans of filet mignon, since it's usually flavorless, but Citizen's is delish and super tender! Scallops were perfectly cooked and properly seasoned -- yum. Deserts were good, but not TD4. We'll sooooo be back!!

I recently had the opportunity to give this place a second try, and what a world of a difference! Had reservations with my husband for our wedding anniversary and from the beginning we had a change of heart about the place. From being handed black napkins so that we would not get lint on our clothing, to the bread service (neither of which happened on previous visits) everything was outstanding! Our server Gary was prompt, friendly, knowledgeable, and made us feel very welcome.  I again had the Filet, which of course was AMAZING. We tried the Mac N Cheese but it really wasn't all that impressive.  I really cant wait to eat there again, and bringing more of our foodie friends with us! Thank you CPH crew for making me see why this place gets 5 stars!

I was very much in "convivial" company my first time here, but having tried at least 6 different main courses and an assortment of cocktails, snacks, and starters since then, I can comfortably say Citizen Public House is my favorite eatery in Old Town to date. Best bang for the buck, if you will. That may not seem like much based on my number of reviews, but I've been around - The Mission, Roaring Fork, FnB, La Petite Maison, 5th & Wine, Mastro's City Hall, Tommy V's...I really should have started a Yelp account a long time ago. In any case, with the exception of the lamb burger, I have been thoroughly pleased with everything I've tried. Their bar is well stocked, and service is great - somewhat casual but appropriate, attentive, and not overbearing. Two recommendations: The pastrami (starter) and the scallops (only 3 to an order, but still worth a try). The chopped salad is good too, just a tad small. Remember to take a picture of it before it gets tossed tableside.
