Great service and just okay food. The food is fine if a bit oily, but it's just not particularly memorable. Our table had pretty much everything off the menu: scallops and meatloaf were the stars, lamb burger was dry and a bit boring, chicken was okay, desserts were tasty (wished we had gotten the PB & J Pudding as it looked amazing over at the next table). The grilled cheese was an only carbfest.  The Chopped Salad menu item is a bit bizarre. The menu directs you to the Facebook page of said chopped salad instead of offering any hints to ingredients. Odd marketing choice.  So, it's a good time with fairly good food. The cocktails are tasty and the service was all in all very friendly.

The menu is really out dated and boring.. for a place that advertises on yelp SO MUCH and also has a huge following, I really feel they can do better with the menu  I do like this place, but I feel there could be more option for entrees and appetizers.. The famous chopped salad is very good. I'll always order it when I go. I also felt the red wines were nothing new n sub par. The beer was ok n the vodka to gin room upstairs makes a good effort.. I've never had a bad meal here but I also haven't been blown away.. I came in for the duck my friend had ordered my first time there but it was no longer on the menu, everything else didn't suit my tastes for the night, so I ordered the hummus, chopped salad n lamb burger. It was fine. Lol sorry I'm tuff.. I would have  liked a lil more something on the burger. The hummus I almost forgot about while writing this, and the salad stood out again. Well anything w smoked salmon tastes f*ing good to me. I love to make certain restaurants staples for when guest come to town, this didn't make the cut.

We came here for my fiancé's holiday company party. To start, we shared Bernie's Macaroni and Cheese, the Burrata, the Golden & Red Beets and the Humus & Tzatziki. All the appetizers were tasteful, but nothing really stood out. For my main course I ordered the Swordfish. The presentation of the dish wasn't appealing. There were 4 pieces of radish on top of the fish and it sat on top of golden beets. The flavor was good and it wasn't too "fishy." The server was nice and attentive. However, the music was quite loud so our group really couldn't hear each other unless we raised our voices. All in all the ambiance was okay,the food is good, but the prices are a bit pricey for what you git.
The chef is always cooking up nightly specials, I have eaten here 20 times and its never bad, they got my vote! Oh - and have the chicken and waffles for an appetizer, it's not weird = it's D'Lish!

What a cool place! It's an upscale pub and refreshingly versatile. If you wanted to come with a few friends and have bar food, it's great. If you want to come with a big group, it's a fun, loud atmosphere. But somehow there is something very romantic about it - I'm not sure if its the dim candle-lit mood or the way that you just feel in your own world, but you can have a very intimate dinner right in the middle of it all and not even notice.  The food is delicious!! I had the BEST GRILLED CHEESE ever. High quality cheese and bread, and white truffle scented mashed potatoes! Mmmmmmmm. The crabcakes are delicious and the short ribs were excellent! The catfish was also delicious but it's pretty spicy, so be aware. It's a little on the pricier side, but you're in the middle of downtown Scottsdale with great ambiance and very good food. Definitely makes for a special night.   4.5 stars so I'll round up!

We went to Citizen Public House because of the multitude of huge Yelp reviews and it didn't disappoint. Our waiter was so knowledgable from the cocktails to the food and wine. Amazing memory. Thanks Citizen...we will visit again when we are in town.

Stopped in here on a whim whilst roaming in downtown Scottsdale.  Was looking for a dive bar but found this instead.  Good mood lighting, friendly staff,  good atmosphere.  The place was busy but plenty of room at the bar.  I enjoyed a lovely Bombay gin martini which was well presented and well made.  Just what the doctor ordered.  The bars located in a super cute area with lots of kitschy shops nearby.  Great place to roam around!   If I lived here, I'd come again.

I've been in the restaurant biz for over 50 years, and believe me, it's really,really hard to find a restaurant gem like this one. My Wife & I stopped in & sat down @ the bar. We were immediately greeted by Ryan & Mike. These guys are consummate professionals! Drinks were good, food was absolutely fabulous. I'm so glad that everyone from the front of the house to the back of the house "gets it." IF you live or are staying anywhere near this outstanding,locally owned place, put CPH on your 'bucket list' asap!
The food, atmosphere and spirits are tops. Definitely need to put it on your list of places to eat in Scottsdale.

We came here late Friday after getting turned away at our beloved FnB. What a great runner up! We got seated right away and started devouring their fantastic warm bread. I got the Persian cocktail because I love all cucumber drinks. I remarked I hadn't had a cocktail that good since being in New York.  For my entree, I asked for a veggie plate mostly because I was too embarrassed to ask for what I really wanted-- a big plate of brussels sprouts. The waiter offered the risotto that comes with another dish as a veg entree so I went with that. The risotto itself was kind of bland, but the earthy mushrooms on top made up for that. My husband loved the scallops and said the grits they came with were the best he's ever had.  We went for the peanut butter dessert which was a decadent combo of chocolate ganache and pb mousse. There was way too much ganache for my taste. It was hard to dig into the dessert, but it still tasted good, especially with the tasty crumble on top.  Two things I loved about CPH: our enthusiastic server and the space. The server was great at the get go, but I wish I would have seen more of him throughout the meal. I am surprised to see people bashing the starkness of the interior. I think it looks sleek and modern but still warm and inviting.  We'll be back whenever we can't get into FnB.

4 stars only because this was the first time here. It was a little loud, but the food was amazing (I had the sea bass *****5 stars there!) and the wait staff was friendly and attentive. We never had to ask for anything and always had full water glasses. I would certainly come back!

Very Good. One of those places where you just can't decide what to get cause it all looks good. The fondue is a must. I would go back for that alone. Also me got the beff belly BLT. Awsome!  And the lamburger. We will be back.

Hipster cool and backs it up.  Great bar snacks - bacon popcorn ?  Of course!  Dropped in for a late Valentines Day dinner and was thrilled with the service and quality of food - great hand made cocktails too ...had filet - perfect rare with a nicely charred salty crust...wife had the Ono with a spicy tomato-based sauce.  Very well prepared!  Ill be back next time in in the Scottsdale area.  Cheers !
I went here for my birthday and the food and service was exceptional. The scallops!!!!!!!!! No words can describe how amazing they were.   Such a great place for a romantic night out.

What a lovely place.   It's so good that while we were traveling, we visited this diamond three times. We would have come more often, except they don't open until 4pm.   First of all, they know what they're doing. The ambiance is fabulous. In a sea of sports bars with TVs everywhere, the Citizen is breath of fresh air. No TVs. Dark Wood. Warm uplighting. Lots of conversation. Of all of the places we visited, this one had the most "Northern California" feel to it - some people were there in Tuxedos, some people were there in flip-flops. And everyone was obviously having fun.   Sitting at the bar, we got to know Thomas, the bar manager - who is a great guy, intelligent conversationalist, and passionate about making a perfect cocktail - and it shows. We deeply enjoyed the Salutation on multiple occasions, as well as the World's End, and I will say they make a mean Negroni.   The food was fantastic - the bacon fat heirloom popcorn was out of this world. I can't believe I've never thought of that. Perfectly air popped corn with chopped bacon pieces, dressed lightly in bacon grease danced on my tongue and gave me the mouthgasm I was looking for.  We loved the fondue, perfectly made sausage, bread, and asian pears with beer cheese. Aw yes. The burrata was absolutely fantastic and flavorful. We also decided on scallops one night, for which they are well known - GET THEM. I've never had scallops prepared like these.   Service: Excellent Ambiance: Excellent Food: Out of this world Cocktails: Delicious  My only wish is that they opened a little earlier, because I could've spent even more hours enjoying this place! Thank you Citizen for an awesome experience!
I came based on race reviews. Atmosphere and place is nice, but a cod dish for $30 was shockingly tiny, the rest was just OK. This place is just overpriced hype.

Visited Citizen at the end of March while in town for a few days of spring break. Dined with local friends who suggested it. Had a wonderful meal. The bacon popcorn as an appetizer was a definite hit. Ditto for the Pork Belly Pastrami. DO NOT pass up the chopped salad - an unusual combination of ingredients that was delicious. All six of us were very pleased with our choices, which inckuded meatloaf, trout, crab cakes, filet or osso buco. Good wine selection. (Specials during happy hour.). One of us made an interesting observation: there was no salt and pepper on the table. But they weren't needed, since everything was seasoned perfectly. Alas, we had no room for dessert. One final comment: AJ was the most solicitous and engaging waiter we've ever met.

I've been looking forward to eating here for months after hearing such raving reviews from my friends and family and I have to admit, they were absolutely right.. this place is amazing!  I came here with friends to celebrate a recent engagement and when our waiter asked what brought us in tonight I had mentioned the special occasion, and without even asking he had sent over four glasses of champagne to toast the occasion. Kudos CPH.   I had a chance to enjoy the short ribs braised in a red wine sauce and my taste buds instantly became my taste BFF's, wow this dish is incredible and if you don't order this you're outa your dang mind.. enough said. I cant recall exactly what my friends had ordered because we all know what really matters is what is in front of your face. All I know is they all had the same great experience I had as well.  Thank you Citizens, you did not disappoint!
2nd visit - Social Hour.  Great cocktail specials and a decent tap beer menu.  Very good small plates and bar snacks.  Great atmosphere/decor. Comfortable and welcoming.  Exceptional service!

I was so pleasantly surprised with the food and service at this restaurant. We had the Applewood Smoked Duck, Pan Seared Scallops and Chopped salad and they were all amazing. The food duck and scallops were cooked to perfection. Our waiter was hilarious.  I would absolutely come back here next time I'm in Scottsdale.

I've been to CPH 3 times now and will definitely be back again. The scallop dish Is a must as is the short ribs. My dining partner ordered the yellow tail special which was excellent. Lets face it, you can get scallops and short ribs at a lot of restaurants  but not of this quality and price, most dish's are $20 to $25. What CPH does is deliver consistently high quality food at great value, add in the good service and friendly staff and you don't have to wonder why this has become a local favorite. I'd be remiss if I didn't give a shout out to the bar manager and mixologist Tom, his craft cocktails are a great, I'm a fan of the Boulvardier.

I got the Truffle Grilled Cheese and it was amazing. Every time I go there, everything is delicious. This is the one place that I know will always be amazing. I've tried the crab cakes, lamb burger and mac and cheese as well and they were delicious as well!
Ask for Eric at the bar!!Most passionate & knowledgeable server. Definitely order the Original Chopped Salad. Coming back for Duck Burger or Tuna. Ugh, can't decide. Maybe 2 visits.

This is a solid restaurant. I've been here twice and enjoyed it both times. The food is delicious and the service is rock solid. I've had the scallops both times I've eaten there. Good presentation and tasty dish all around.  The wine list is impressive not in quantity but in quality. A nice selection of different wines for different tastes. My dad had a Manhattan and he said it was the best he's ever had. And he's drunk a lot of Manhattans over his life.   When I came here the first time, the server messed up on my friend's order. When notified right away about the mistake, the server said that our table could keep the mistake dish and the actual order will be out right away. It showed up five minutes later and the server was apologetic. Nothing over the top but apologetic. He ended up not charging our table for either of the dishes. Completely unexpected and appreciated. He got a good tip.   I deducted one star because the the noise level inside is very high. The restaurant has concrete floors and drywall. The only thing soaking up the sound is people's clothes. It's hard to have intimate conversations since it's so loud inside.

Loved it and can't wait to go back. Great atmosphere while still paying homage to the location's historical roots.  Food was inventive (but not crazy)  and fresh and delicious. Appreciate the creativity to put the out of the norm spin on old favorites.  We'll be back.  And soon.

Oh what a night ! We found this gem on a fluke. We were looking up another restaurant and saw this and decided to give it a try! We arrived in time for Happy Hour(on a Saturday!? What???) and ordered unique appetizers. Fabulous! In fact we were full at that point! But we did order the special of the night and a wonderful dessert. But best of all was our friendly female waitress! She made our night! I highly recommend coming here if you are near Old Town Scottsdale(MAKE the time!)

The chopped salad is everything it's cracked up to be- must order! We also had the yellowtail crudo, I personally loved it and the rest of our table thought it was ok. Meatloaf portion is a very large portion, delicious comfort food. The tacos had good flavor but far too much meat and needed more sauce or salsa. The galette was very disappointing although if you like banana/chocolate/peanut butter flavor profile the push pop dessert is over the top good! Our waiter was helpful with his recommendations. We joked that he seemed slightly condescending about the quantity of food we ordered per the number of people at our table (we ordered a lot). Overall a nice dinner, nice atmosphere (slightly warm), and good food especially the chopped salad. I'm not dying to go back immediately but I'm glad we went and would dine there again when the menu changes and if I'm in the area.

Get the chopped salad.  Had dinner here recently.  Ordered the highly recommended chopped salad, the chia crusted tuna, and some drinks.  The chopped salad was amazing.  Get it with the smoked salmon.  It was large enough to be a meal.  Tasty, refreshing, great texture.  Just excellence.  The chia crusted tuna was rather weak.  It was almost like it came from a different kitchen.  The flavor, texture, and temp were all displeasing for me.  For 30 bucks this piece of tuna should have been WAY better.  The drinks were pretty decent but not 12 dollars worthy.  Bottom line is I would come back for the salad and only the salad.  If I was hungry after the chopped salad then I would order another chopped salad.  Oh yeah, everyone that stated it is loud is correct.  My right ear is still ringing.  I think it is the acoustics in the building.  We had to shout to each other right across the table and the place was only half full.

Probably one of the best restaurants I have been to in my life.  I make sure to make a reservation anytime I am in Scottsdale. The food, service and ambiance are amazing. My top recommendation is the short rib. It is impeccable every time.
A gun place to be in. The food is very good, mostly healthy food. Love their salad. The waitress was very nice and helpful. Friendly atmosphere and good food.

I've been here three times in the past week. Love it! Insane comfort foods. Pork osso bucco, fried chicken , all amazing! Pork belly appetizer is crazy great! The cocktails and service are the best. Ask the bartender to make you their version of your favorite drink and you will not be disappointed. I am telling everyone how great this place is and you will be missing out if you try it at least once. Ha... Try it once and you'll be hooked!

The food was all sub par, especially for the price. I ordered the scallops and nothing ruins scallops like biting into a small shell on your second bite. My girlfriend ordered the grilled cheese and it was one of the worst I've ever tasted. The bread resembled store bought and there was some sort of mashed potato in it. The chocolate cake dessert was good, a little stale, but still good. The drinks were the lone bright spot, disregarding the price. The moscow mule and old fashioned I ordered were pretty spot on.   All in all this place is not worth the price mainly due to the uninspired and expensive food. I would, however, go grab a drink there. If you are looking for a nice restaurant with a cool ambiance keep looking because you won't find it here

The menu was quite limited. Greens were fresh. Coworker ordered the fondue and she didn't care for the cheese, says it didn't take like cheese. Also ordered the Cobb salad, was told the salmon was cooked but looked and tasted fresh, not cooked. Pastrami was ok. Would have really liked to see more on the menu. Service was great though.

This place is ammmmmazing and definitely lives up to its reviews and comments. We went with our couple friends and sat at one of the half moon shaped booths by the back wall which arguably was the best table in the house. To start, do yourselves a favor and get the chopped salad - its unique, refreshing, just the right amount of flavor and has its own Facebook page. They presentation is impeccable and they mix and dress it table side - the dressing (buttermilk pesto) is INSANE. Then you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, except if you skip out on the scallops. They melt in your mouth. The pork shank is like a dinosaur bone so bring your appetite. Also, try the pork cheek - I was very hesitant but the fennel and caramelized onion really balance it out. To finish, we did the Black and Tan for dessert - the layers of chocolate, salted caramel and some other whipped ingredient from heaven was the perfect finish. ;)

My first time at EM Salon. My friend and I decided to go get haircuts last minute and even though it was busy Sam made time for us. He even put on the hockey game and asked if we wanted a drink. My friend and I were really happy, we got really good haircuts. I was pleasantly surprised by his skills and level of service. Really nice place. Reminds me of the good high end barbershops in NYC.

We began our meal with the famous chopped salad, which easily met our high expectations. My date didn't care for her cocktail -- too heavy on the bitters for her -- but my Moscow Mule was excellent. She loved her scallops, and my meatloaf was pretty good.  The service was excellent. Our waiter was friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. Couldn't ask for more. We went early in the week, and the restaurant was active but not overly busy. The ambiance was perfect for a dinner date.

Sitting at the bar this evening, almost every seat is filled in the restaurant.  The bartenders tonight Elijah , Will and James are text book service providers, super  solid team.  Great service from the get go, knowledgeable about everything they provide. The food is amazing, it speaks for itself. Come and enjoy!

Went on a Saturday night and it was easy to get 7 people seated. Though yelp says it's "casual" I would venture to say you should dress a bit nicer than jeans and a t-shirt. I had the Juicy Lucy I think it was called and at $18 it wasn't a bad burger, one of my friends also had the fillet mignon tacos and she really enjoyed them. Over all it was a good atmosphere but costs can add up quickly as what was supposed to be meet for drinks turned into a $500 dinner.
Citizen public house was a great experience. The service has always been great. The chopped salad and their scallops are amazing. Will be back again.

I was pretty excited to eat here because they had a great rating. I have had better chicken from Chick-Fil- A. General lack of flavor. I feel like I was at a different restaurant than what everyone else experienced. My boyfriend got the scallops...same mediocrity.
Great food and super awesome drinks! Fun place to enjoy in the evening with friends or a date.

I had a great meal here tonight with some colleagues. The service was great and food even better.  I had a Odell seasonal ale to start.  Great to see a awesome Colorado brewery on the list of beers.  That said, I would expect a stronger and bigger selection of beers for a restaurant categorized as a Gastropub.    For dinner I had the scallops and they were amazing.  Desert we shared every option and the bacon and apple bread pudding was phenomenal.
This place has the best chopped salad and is worth it every time. The other food is so-so, but the atmosphere is calm, but it is normally busy. Be ready to make a reservation.

Food is very creative and slightly avant guard. Had the short rib with cherry bbq sauce and parsnip puree. It was absolutely delicious.  Had two drinks, a Tom Collins and a margarita. Both were horrible. I mean just absolutely terrible and I should have sent them back. I've had better drinks from the bars on Mill Ave.  It can get a little loud in there. And they don't have any cider; hardly befitting of a so called "Public House." But the food is excellent and they do seasonal menu changes.

So much fun and so good!  Started with happy hour and we drank a whole bunch of the seasonal mule(strawberry, balsamic vinegar mix - i think);    For dinner I had the Bavette medium rare which was unbelievably good, along with the risotto and mushrooms sides, I did not ever want to finish.  I so love this place!

I made 8:45 reservations for a Saturday night and was glad I did.  The place was packed, and for good reason.  The chopped salad was amazing, the scallops were cooked to perfection and the dessert was decadent.    This is one of those rare places that can pull off casual and swanky at the same time.  You won't feel under dressed in jeans or overdressed in a cocktail dress.  The waiters are fun and efficient and the wait for our table and food were surprisingly fast.  I'll be back for certain!

Five stars for the chopped salad alone. I have never tasted something so amazing. The service was also great we had a very large party and they took care of us all in a calm and timely manner. But back to the salad, I will absolutely be back for more.

Went to brunch had teh apple pancake was very good.  Wife had the scrambled eggs ( 6 yes 6).  They were good but not great.  There were no meat choices for sides.  Cost $96 including tip for 4, NO BOOZE

While the baby in my stomach has been extremely well fed over the past 9 months, I think the meal I had at Citizen Public House was one of my best I've had in a long time. Considering the source (yours truly) has 2080+ reviews you can betcha this meal was pretty incredible.  My large party of 15 or so people was waited on by the oh so fabulous Gary, who did his best to provide serious VIP treatment. Gary started the meal by bringing out the popcorn bacon appetizer...can't go wrong with that combo! From there I had the chopped salad, which I've been dreaming about ever since. I opted for mine with chicken instead of smoked salmon (looking out for the little guy). It's the best salad I've ever had and I bet it's even better with salmon.  I ordered scallops for my main entree and they were delish, but I was too full to eat more than 1 (it comes with 30). Somehow I made room for a few bites of the variety of heavenly desserts Gary brought out to our table to end our oh so fabulous meal.  Guess where I'll be eating during my next trip to Scottsdale? Yep, Citizen House...and hopefully by then I'll be able to indulge in those cocktails everyone is yelping about!
Came back from Texas for their infamous chop salad.  We were not disappointed and it was better than the last time!
Amazing food and drink combos, service was excellent! We sat at the bar and had a great experience, highly recommend this place

Love this place. Cocktails are fantastic, innovative and great bartenders. The food is incredible. I finally tried the chopped salad (famous and on Facebook). The salad has smoked salmon, Israeli cous cous, arugula, tomatoes, sun dried cor, pistachios, almonds in a buttermilk pesto dressing. I have been thinking about it ever since. I had the butternut squash chowder, which is not like most butternut squash chowders. Think bacon, squash, corn, chicken broth. Yummy. Food is delicious every time.

Upon walking into Citizen's PH, we were greeted warmly by the hostess. Once seated, we were promptly approached by our server, Gib, who was personable and helpful in his suggestions from the menu. After enjoying our mouth watering app of Pork Bell Pastrami, melt in your mouth Filet and the best damn Chopped Salad with Salomon I've ever had, Gib escorted us to the very hip and chill Mixology Lounge, upstairs. I highly suggest enjoying 'dessert' AKA: cocktails, where an amazing Mixologist will perform his magic in whipping up a delectable spirit.  We enjoyed sitting around the fireplace, enjoying our cocktails, and interacting with the Mixologist and his staff, who mingled with us. A rare find in top notch service, food and ambiance.

WOW!!!! One of the most creative and delicious dining experiences in years!   My wife and I were traveling, and had had a kind of meh day.....I read some of the reviews for this place -- and was intrigued by the menu. What a creative master chef.....Everything was delicious -- fabulous!  It was the kind of place that made me very sorry to have just the one night in town, because I would have loved the opportunity to come back again and again -- the menu was full of irresistible things that I just couldn't sample.  If you're in Scottsdale for the night or live there full-time but haven't yet tried this place -- go!  It's really one of the most creatively designed eating experiences I've ever had.

4.5 stars  While in Scottsdale for work, I came across Citizen Public House. Good food, good drinks and good times. All of these are true. Tom, our bartender, for most of the night, as we sat at the bar was incredibly friendly. After hearing it was our first time, he tossed us some free bacon popcorn (popcorn with bacon lardons on top). The drinks here are top notch. At happy hour (4-6) you can get half price beers and half price on many cocktails. They have a bunch of house aged cocktails which are killer.  The food here is not to be missed. The chicken, yes, i said the Chicken, is great. Sure, most restaurants have chicken on the menu as their throw away dish, not here. Here they braise the breast in buttermilk and serve it will Brussels Sprouts and a sweet corn and butter bean succotash. I also tasted the house made pork belly pastrami. Everything here is great, and the bartenders are all friendly.  If you are here for business or pleasure, you want to stop at citizen public house.
Everything was fantastic from beginning to end.  The servers, the food, the atmosphere.  Highly recommend the chop salad & the short ribs.

Chopped salad and pastrami were the best things I tasted on their menu so far. The crab cakes are good, typical, but good. The truffled grilled cheese was lacking in the truffle area like almost nonexistent and the  veggies that came with the grilled cheese were tasteless, and the accompanying salad was boring in comparison to the full flavors of the chopped salad.  Recommendations: - chopped salad - pastrami

YUM. That really sums it up. we went here last night after having received a gift certificate for a wedding gift. We were so impressed with the food, and my husband actually uttered the words, "I don't want this to end." We started with sangria and fondue which were both fantastic. My entree was the smart chicken and hubs had the pork tenderloin. Both  were unbelievably good and our server was wonderful. It's rare to have all the components of a nice meal come together so perfectly, and this is definitely worth the money!

Citizen was recommended by multiple people. ......plus Yelp had it rated very high......so Citizen it was...... we sat at the bar and Brendan was our server......he was very helpful with recommendations.......we made it there for happy hour and so we tried the hummus and pita plate......this was very good......then came the very highly acclaimed chopped salad. ......not expecting this.......it was totally different then anything I ever had........it was excellent. .......so far Brendan was 2 for 2......then came the scallops........they were excellently. ......a great choice......it must say......the service was excellent....the food was excellent and our total experience was excellent. .....it f you want to recommend a nice place with quality this is the place......good job Brendan.......

Nothing wrong with this place. Just nothing special about it either. Another upscale casual Scottsdale bar that won't make it out of it's 3rd year. I remember it being more of a 3 star pricing, not 2 as listed on yelp.

My husband Matt B. and I met our friend Stef P. for dinner one night in Scottsdale, at Citizen Public House. We'd just flown into town and were looking forward to an easy gastropub dinner. The place was not at all what we expected. It was less gastropub than full-on upscale sit-down restaurant, with entrees creeping into the $30 range. Thankfully, we ended up loving the place.  Citizen Public House is in cozy Old Town Scottsdale, and it was vibrant and charming on a Friday night. We had a late reservation (9:15) and the place was still pretty busy. I liked the atmosphere--it was nice, but informal. We hadn't seen Stef in four years, and had a great time catching up over dinner. Service was excellent. Our waiter Brad was on top of his game.  We had a couple rounds of drinks, and I really enjoyed the cocktails. The Im-Port was particularly good, a smokey drink made with Jameson, Tawny Port, tobacco bitters, and Guinness foam, served on the rocks with a smoked sugar rim. The Thai Margarita was pleasant, too, a mix of Patron silver with galangal and kaffir lime simple syrup, tamarind reduction, Thai chili sea salt, basil, and lime, served on the rocks. It tasted more like a straight margarita than I thought it would, but I liked it. I also had a sample of the barrel-aged Craftsman, made with Jameson, Cocchi Americano, and Charbay green tea apertif. (Brad brought it over because I was waffling between the Im-Port and the Craftsman, and he gave me a free taste after I'd already decided on the Im-Port.) It was pretty great, smooth and boozy with a definite sweetness. Probably would've gotten it if I wanted a third drink. Matt tried one of the other barrel-aged cocktails, the Boulvardier [sic?] made with Maker's 46 bourbon, Campari, and sweet vermouth. Another solid drink.  The food was fantastic. The three of us shared the pork belly pastrami and an order of Bernie's mac 'n cheese, which worked as both appetizer and side. The pork belly pastrami seems to be Citizen Public House's signature dish, and it's a great one. Pork belly came pastrami-cured and spiced, with rye spaetzle, brussels sprout sauerkraut, and mustard jus. The pork was juicy, fatty, and intensely flavorful, and I loved all of the sides. It wouldn't be right to come here without trying this dish. The mac 'n cheese was also delicious, made with curly cavatappi pasta in a gorgonzola and emmental cheese sauce, with a chilled tomato relish on top. The pasta was cooked al dente and I loved the sharp cheeses and the spicy tomato relish. The portion was huge. We split it three ways and still had leftovers.  I had the pan-seared scallops for my entree, while Matt and Stef had the fair trade short ribs. Both were excellent. The scallops were plump and beautifully cooked, served with Hampshire belly bacon, roasted corn grits, wilted snow pea greens, and a cola gastrique. There was so much great flavor and texture on this plate. It was exactly what I wanted. The short ribs were another winner, a giant plate of tender coffee-rubbed ribs with dried cherry BBQ sauce, roasted parsnip puree, and seasonal vegetables.  We ended up spending more than we meant to at Citizen Public House, but we were on vacation and had a truly lovely meal. I'd recommend this place for a nice dinner out in Scottsdale, to locals and tourists alike.

I stopped in after work to check it out since I've heard sooo much about it.  The happy hour menu offers many affordable choices. So I started off with the cocktail of the day which was $6. I'm definitely not a professional at happy hour so the drink was very strong for me.  I sent it back in exchange for a glass of cab. Sometimes you have to stick with what you know.  Bartenders are very into their cocktails which seems intimating a bit to me.  If you want a great cocktail then this your place!

I have gone here 3 times during my work trip to Phoenix.    The first night, started with the Original Chopped Salad, followed by the Filet Mignon, and finished with Strawberry Poundcake.  Salad was very good with a great pallet of different flavors.  The steak was perfectly cooked and paired with the potatoes and greens was phenomenal.  The poundcake was ok... nothing too special.  The second night, I started again with the Original Chopped Salad, followed by the Wagyu burger.  Once again, the salad satisfied my craving created after I had it the first night.  The wagyu burger was cooked as perfectly as the steak.  The fries were fresh with a slight crisp.  The third time I went was during lunch.  Again, decided to get the Chopped Salad.  Shared the crabcakes with a buddy.  And had the Wagyu burger again.  The salad again was great.  Crabcakes are a bit on rich side for my taste.  The wagyu burger was awesome.  The fries were a bit stale.  All in all, great restaurant and would definitely go back.    Recommend: The Original Chopped Salad, Filet Mignon, and Wagyu burger.

CPH for short has always delivered an exceptional dining experience from beginning to end.  This visit I strayed from the norm- the must try Scallops that are 4 huge scallops with a side of corn grits (yes it works trust me), some greens and what gives it that pop or taste is the homemade cola reduction that is drizzled on.  This is by far one of my top scallop dishes ever tasted.  But for this evening, we (the fiancee) got there early and took advantage of the happy hour.  The rosemary salted nuts where good and flavor was great.  Order the fondue which came with a nice side of break and some jerky.  Cheese was great and didn't become to hot like some places that have to much heat underneath the cheese.  Final appetizer was the pork belly pastrami.  Again, nailed it with layers of flavor, even from the slight hint of mustard at the end.  Not to mention a very tender pork belly.  Next the chopped salad which I've had at least 5 times.  Won't go into detail but the ingredients are so different they have their own Facebook page!   Entrees for me was the Fair Trade Short Ribs and my significant other just had the macaroni and cheese side.  Short Ribs where good, maybe 30 seconds less on the cooking for me- which is a personal preference.  I'm not a fan of parsnip puree, but the texture and flavor was great.  My significant other's mac and cheese was huge.  Lots of cheese flavor and lots of noodles.  For me it needed a "pop" of something but I can't place it.    Last, but not least, they do know how to serve a decent cocktail.  I've complained before how restaurants want to charge but not deliver, but CPH gives a real drink with real flavors.  Try their Manhattan if you like whiskey and you'll be sure to love house made bitters with the orange and cherry twist.  My fiancee had the Mia Margarita which had some nice hints of lemon and lime with a surprise salt rim that had a smokey taste.

I would have given it 5 Stars because of the food; however, we would never go back there due to the incredible noise level because they have so many tables packed in to the rather small space. Also, the place is so good, and the food is also, that it is busy busy busy.  We all enjoyed the food, but we couldn't enjoy our out of town company because of the noise level and zero noise abatement features.
GREAT food and great ambiance  had the chopped salad and buttermilk chicken.  super yummy.  will be coming back!

If you passed Citizen by because of the "meh" exterior, then great! More for meeeeeeeeee! The drab atmosphere is easily forgotten once you've experienced an amazing meal from start to finish.   If you're waiting at the bar for a table, don't miss the opportunity to have the bacon popcorn with your cocktail. Yes! I said it. BACON POPCORN! With real bacon.   Be prepared for a wait Thursday-Saturday.   Enjoy!

Very loud atmosphere and can't hear each other talk. Food portions pitiful. I had the trout which they expected you to eat the skin. My friend had the chicken and said it was salty. Two people had the scallops, one person had ossu buco and one had the meatloaf. All were acceptable. We all agreed we won't be back not worth the money.

I must say I am pleasantly surprised at the quality of food here at Citizen Public as well as the service! The food came out quickly and was extremely fresh. The drinks are yummy, the atmosphere relaxing. So happy we gave this a try!

Great meal! Fancy place but very kid friendly. They had crayons for the kids to use on the paper table cloth and offers great options.  Mac and cheese has the fondue cheese used for it. Scallops-out of this world-if you're a scallop fan-you will definitely enjoy. Best item on the menu was the chopped salad. So popular of an item that they have a recipe card they hand out when asked. Freeze dried corn, cactus veggie, oh it was divine. Even non salad eaters will enjoy. Huge portions of pasta-FYI.
Great selection of healthy food choices and the service was pretty good! I wish our server had more knowledge about the wines on the menu.  Cute location and atmosphere, too!

I came here as part of a large party (approximately 50 people).  The restaurant was convenient to the hotel.  It was nicely decorated but he space was VERY loud.  I can't stand this in restaurants.  Especially if one is conducting business.    The servers were very accommodating.  I enjoyed their hospitality.  They brought out a perfect Guinness.  They were always ready with refills and suggestions.  We were provided with some very good bruschetta and even better chicken pesto kabobs while we waited for the entres.  But here is the rub.  We had a limited menu with 5 selections.  It took almost 90 minutes to get our food.  They had several other parties.  I do not know why they did not have additional staff.  But this is pretty inexcusable.    I will say that the scallops were exquisite!  They melted in your mouth.  The corn grits were also delicious although there could have been more grits on the plate.  Come on folks grits are $2 for a tractor trailer load.  How about an adult 3/4 cup portion?    Finally, they had some unidentified green on the scallops.  It did nothing for the meal except remind me of baling hay in high school.  This did remind me that I went to school to pay prices like these!?!

We came back for dinner on Friday evening and it was everything I hoped it would be.   If you're an alcoholic...err... "alcohol aficionado", this is the place for you.  They offer barrel aged cocktails which is a truly unique experience.  They're a bit spendy at regular price but if you go during "Social Hour", they're half price and a steal (note to CPH: I appreciate not being forced to be happy.  Thanks for validating the preferences of pissy people everywhere.)  The term "craft cocktails" is starting to go the way of  sun-dried tomatoes (sad and overused), but currently there isn't a better description and this is definitely a destination for a twist on the sauce.  If my husband were granted full access to their bar and nifty ingredients, I might never see him again.  (But granted, it's been a good run.)    We ordered the mac n' cheese, chicken and waffle, and crab cakes for appetizers.  All were fantastic.  I thought the chicken and waffle was a strange offering but an app but it works.  For din-din, our table had the short ribs, filet, duck, and meatloaf.  Six loud tipsy people were quiet for maybe an entire minute which should tell you something.  Desserts were an exercise in competitive eating but we managed.  Our table had the pumpkin bread pudding, apple pie and dream pudding.  YUM.  We then accomplished a gastronomic feat by indulging in their house-made egg nog.  It was a thick, creamy, delicious glass of shame.        The service was fantastic.  Our waiter was friendly, funny and engaging.  They did a wonderful job of taking care of us without hovering.    I'm not the biggest fan of Old Town thanks to the douche bag/Ax factor but this is definitely a compelling reason to make my way through guys in too tight t-shirts who say "dude" excessively.
Went here with friend- dinner was excellent service was exceptional- would recommend- good looking crowd

First experience was for Restaurant week 2011, been back for Yelp Eats week and then back again. Comfortable atmosphere and great wait staff. I even have the same chandelier lighting that is over their bar in my home. Will be visiting again soon.  Love the Original Chopped Salad and the Mirliton Chopped salad a close second which is a bit more on the refreshing side. The sausage of the day has been a good choice.  The seared scallops can be done to your liking, mine request is rare and they do it  to perfection. I have asked my pork "not too done" and it comes lightly pink, just the way I like it.    Finish it off with a very rich and dense Irish Coffee Pot de Crème. Wish they would serve it in a less "vertical" glass so I can get the Irish whiskey, coffee crema and chocolate easily in a single spoonful.
Love the food, bartenders are top notch, atmosphere is fun.

I went here the other night with a friend of mine and we both agreed it was okay. We both got the chicken and it was good but it was anything out of the ordinary and for 20 dollars for a piece of chicken I guess we were expecting more.The service was good but we just weren't really impressed as we thought we would be.
Bacon popcorn, short ribs and our waiter Sam were all phenomenal. Drink pours were light.

Would it be rude or pretentious of me to admit that I wouldn't find great food and cocktails in Scottsdale? Well, mea culpa. I honestly didn't expect much out of this city when it comes to comestibles. But Citizen Public House surprised me on all levels.   The cocktails here are crazy good. They even have a little 'speakeasy'-ish mixology lab upstairs that's all secret and only accessible by... wait... can I tell? Anyway, these folks are making some interesting drinks with house-made infusions, tinctures, and various chemistry equipment. Better than the best drinks in PDX? I don't know about that, but impressive all the same.   The food is a very big surprise for me. The chop chop salad is, from what I understand, legendary, and from tasting it I am not surprised. I also sampled some tasty meatloaf and delicious scallops. The fact that I can't recall the dessert doesn't mean it wasn't memorable, I think it had to do with my focus on the drinks and mains. I recall everyone at the table enjoying them.   Service? Impeccable. 'Nuff said.   Consider me a little humbled.
Got the cuban sandwich.... Nothing to right home about. Neat location.. And server was good. Chop salad is same as cowboy chow.

What we ate:  Bacon fat popcorn - yummy  Gorgonzola Mac and Cheese - yummy BLT of the day - glad we split this, it was good but super rich  At this point I wish there would have been a small palate cleanser offered, the food is so rich and something small and light would have helped me decide to order more.  Instead I ordered the chopped salad and I was happy with it, though would have ordered a main course instead if something small and light would have been offered.    The rest of our party ordered main course's and I tried all of them, the roasted parsnip puree was awesome and so were the scallops.  The BBQ dipping sauce for the short ribs was very heavy and the short ribs were better without it.    The service was great, we had a reservation and were seated right on time.  The drinks were great and inventive.   I probably won't return to have a full dinner here, but drinks and the popcorn for sure, maybe a happy hour.

Citizens public is a really chic place, especially on a fri or sat night before going out. I love the indoor / outdoor feel created by the large doors at the front of the building. Interior decor is classic fine dining elegance with minimalist qualities. R and D is the upstairs speakeasy joint, you should definitely check that out as well, after dinner. Be sure to check with the host on getting up to R and D as that part can be tricky. When I first went to Cit pub almost a year ago I was enticed by their Moscow Mule served traditionally in a copper cup, with a garnishing of a sugar sucker. It's a very good mule. I tried the chop salad and while all my girlfriends die over it, it's not my thing. I didn't enjoy the separation of flavors and didn't overall like the ingredient mix, but I'm sort of particular so I encourage you to try that salad for yourself. It's pretty famous. I had the chicken entree which has a delicious sauce, was not dry, and had a lovely hash type bean and brussel sprout thing on the bottom of the plate. It was amazing, definitely a step up from not loving the salad last time. I paired it with their better rose available by the glass. Wonderful meal and highly recommend eating at this restaurant soon.

This is a terrific place!  It has every single thing going on.  Cool environment, great atmosphere, some serious mixologists behind the bar making fantastic cocktails and truly great food.  It's a "happening" place, with a welcoming atmosphere.  If you haven't been, you should go.

As first I was skeptical... But mad I haven't been a fan longer!  Chopped salad, pastrami pork belly, kilt lifter fondue and scallops what was for dinner!  I don't even like scallops and I thought they were okay! My fiancé sure did love them, he said the best he has had since City Hall. The chopped salad is a must do-- see my tip!!   AJ was our sever and he had his hands full of tables. He must be the most friendliest server I have had. He was very engaging with us and the rest of his tables. He even sent us home with a dessert! I know I will request him next time we dine here.  I love the lighting in this restaurant too , very romantic and calm.  Great place !

Everything we had there was excellent and reminded me of Austin: the pork belly pastrami, the beef short ribs, the smoked duck, my Arizona Mule cocktail. It is definitely a lively, noisy atmosphere, but it has a good crowd.

Yes! I love walking into a place like this and feeling my bougie self get juiced up. Service was good. Great bar snacks and plenty of drink options during social hour, although I wish they used less gin and vermouth.  They may have had the best roasted nuts I ever had.  I already had dinner plans and didn't order an entree so I can't speak much about the actual food.  I did take a bite of my friend's cobb salad and it was pretty darn good, even though it reminded me of the smoked salmon salad at LGO.  I wish I got out of work earlier to catch their happy hour more frequently.
I just keep coming back for their Chopped Salad. I always come back with the intent to get something different..but the chopped salad!! It's so good!

I had the Crispy Steelhead, and it was delicious! The sweet pea risotto and roasted tomato-chanterelle ragout were a great addition. If you're looking for a great restaurant with an original menu, this is the place to go! Friendly staff and they were quick to seat us.
Service is always spot on, My go to in old town!  The chopped salad and meatloaf are insanely delicious! Service is great n a fun crowd
My favorite place to dine in Phoenix. The staff is exceptional and the OMFG Salad is worthy of its distinction.

Although my fiancé and I only stop by this place for some desserts and drinks, it was tasty and the ambiance is chic. We decided to stop by here because of the high yelp reviews that we had to try it and be able to say "we've been here and tried it."  Well, I'm glad we did!  Even though we sat at the bar, our service with our bartender was superb.  He was able to make some fancy mixology cocktail for my fiancé and I.  He also sold us on their dessert menu.  We end up getting the soufflé which our bartender recommended.  As always, soufflé takes awhile to make but it was worth the wait.  It was made just right because watching Master Chef educated me how and what makes a soufflé go wrong. It was nice and crisp on top and the inside wasn't too mushy.  When I'm back in town, I'll definitely try out their entree menu.

My review is only for the bar and drinks!   My girlfriend and I came here upon hearing that they serve Irish Coffee. We recently visited San Francisco and had Irish Coffee at the Buena Vista Social Club and wanted to relive that amazing night.   The Irish Coffee here of course wasn't as good as SF but it was very good! The bartender was very friendly. The drinks were pretty steep at $10 each but they are meant to enjoy at a leisurely pace.
Highly recommend the chopped salad! It is to die for. Also their soups are heavenly. Has a great atmosphere and the servers are all super friendly.

Ok. Good not great. We had reservations and we were seated quickly. My scallops were decent, but the fondu was just ok and the salads were very average. I have no problem paying for good food, but it was a bit expensive for a mediocre experience.

Ok so I really wanted to love this place. Service was great. Chopped salad was a little weird but ok. The food was overall prepared well, just not to our liking. Unfortunately no one in our party was a fan of the food.

Dined in March, 2013 for a late dinner/pre-drink snack w/ friends. Ordered 2 apps, salad, and one entree, w/ good but not extravagant wine; out the door for apx $100. I could see noise becoming a potential problem with its layout. Service was very attentive, informative and friendly. the pork belly pastrami and applewood smoked duck were both A+++; chopped salad A-/B+; crab cakes were not remarkable. I will absolutely return to this restaurant w/ very high expectations next time i'm in the phoenix area.

Went on a Saturday night around 10pm. We were on the waiting list so we went to the bar for some drinks and noticed that there were at least 2 table in front of us that were clean and empty. Waited for a bit and asked hostess why we weren't being seated when there were tables available. They seated us right away thereafter.   We ordered family style - mac n cheese, pork belly pastrami, chicken & waffles, crab cakes, and bacon popcorn. Food was great. Loved the cheese they used for the mac n cheese; pork belly pastrami I wasn't even look at on the menu but tasted it and it literally melts in your mouth; the breading on the chicken was unique (in a good way, not your typical breading) and the waffles and syrup with some kind of nuts on top that was delish; bacon popcorn i didn't see what the big deal was but then again I don't get the whole bacon craze but all the guys devoured it at the table.  Tried 3 different cocktails all with a unique taste, all excellent. Bartender isn't too attentive, it was hard to get his attention may be because I wasn't sitting at the bar? But it wasn't like he was busy or anyone else was asking for drinks so no bueno on that.  I asked the server (2 because they switched on us in the beginning) to bring out bread because I was starving and the menu said you had to ask for it. The bread didn't come out until after the food, major disappointment.  Overall I can't say much for the service but the cocktails and food are good enough for me to want to come back which says a lot about the eats. Everyone was friendly but may cause I came at the end on a Saturday they were tired? Anyways, worth checking out and definitely order family style.

This was definitely the best meal of this year's holiday trip....  The Kale Caesar! is a very creative interpretation of the timeless classic.  We loved the melted Scamorza cheese.    I had the Applewood Smoked Duck for my entree, accompanied by a glass of the Siduri pinot from Willamette.  The wine was perfect with the cherry sauce, besides the fact that pinot is a classic pairing with duck.  A glass of Siduri for $12 is a great deal, too.  I loved the way the duck was prepared, too, and it did not weigh me down afterwards like duck often can, either.  My wife had the buttermilk roasted chicken along with a glass of their creative (and delicious) interpretation of sangria.  Roasted Brussels sprouts and sweet corn are part of the presentation.    Dessert was the decadent Dream Pudding Jar.  We always get excited about an original dessert dish, and this one did not disappoint.  Service was top notch all the way, also.
Up all night sweating and with stomach pain after visiting last night. Will never go back.

This is a classic Old Town staple. I frequently come here and enjoy the Stetson chopped salad. Seriously this chopped salad is worth coming to Phoenix for alone. Two other restaurants, The Gladly and Cowboy Ciao, also serve the same salad. However, The Gladly and Cowboy Ciao do not have the same menu items.  One of the best items on the Citizen Public House menu are the crab cakes. They're a bit pricy, but what crab cake isn't? It's one of the crab cakes that has a solid amount of crab in it which you rarely find anymore with restaurants trying to keep food costs down.  I have been coming here for years and the menu has recently changed. The staples have remained, but the drink menu has a few new options that are all fantastic. There is a rum drink on the menu that is extremely strong, and extremely tasty. A few of those and you won't remember the dinner conversation! Definitely one of the best Phoenix restaurants with fantastic service and knowledgeable wait staff.
I'd give them five stars for the Original Chopped alone, but their great service and other tasty menu items, in addition to an impressive drink list only make it better.
Great ambiance! All the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had the pan seared scallops and the filet, both were amazing. Everything was delicious!
Excellent!!!  We went with the recommendation of our waiter-  chopped salad & scallops.  Wonderful explosion of flavor.  It's definitely a place I highly recommend.
Love the atmosphere no the patio and food is a solid 4*

We had an amazing experience here! The server was knowledgeable, friendly and professional, and the drinks and food were fabulous!! The chopped salad was unique and incredibly delicious!! The pork belly pastrami was unbelievable, as was the dessert! highly recommend!

I ordered the Cornish game hen. It was very tender but did not have a lot of flavor. My companion had the short ribs. It was tender and flavorful. The accompanying kale was also very well done. For dessert, we had heart of caramel. The cake was very rich. Good for sharing. The Arnold Palmers were tart, different from any others I've had. Service was good. I would eat here again.
Outstanding. Service was fantastic. The original chopped salad was amazing. #micdrop #yum #orderit

Just to throw my voice in with the choir: this place is awesome.  Yelp helped me find this restaurant, and I had an absolutely decadent time.  Everything was on point for my visit.  Service was attentive, fast, and polite.  The food was fantastic.  The cocktails were some of my favorite I've had in a long time.  The place was full of people even for it being a Wednesday night.  I highly recommend the food and cocktail that I enjoyed during my visit.  The End of the World gin cocktail was refreshing and intoxicating.  The beef short ribs were incredibly tender and rich.  My friend's scallops were perfect.  Just go.  The place is great.

Loved it. We shared a ton of dishes. Started with the fondue, fantastic. The sausage, pear and bread all blended well together with the cheese. The chop salad, pork belly pastrami, spam cubano, roasted acorn squash with chorizo were all fantastic. I recommend the Pinot Grigio, not expensive and was fresh and crisp. Then for dessert we had the dude jar, which was good, but rich. By far the superior dessert was the heart of caramel. Bradley made sure that the service was spot on. The ambiance and the music were great. Ridonkulous!
Very friendly staff and excellent service. Food was amazingly good. Starter portion was small (crab cake) but extremely good! Main course portion size was good and filling.

Had dinner here and our waiter Sam was by far the most fabulous guy and they are so lucky to have him as an employee. He went above and beyond and made our last dinner in Scottsdale so memorable! Congrats to Sam on his promotion! Well deserved!!!! The food was excellent and definitely order the salad it was delic!!!

Had a lovely time here trying some of the best cocktails I've ever had. Didn't try the food, though I plan to next time. Keeping to the bar, I had several drinks that were all winners. The bartender was attentive and made my drinks with just the right amount of flair. As far as I could tell, the staff were all very professional, but my particular bartender, Will, has clearly practiced to the point of perfection and has a natural gift for making unforgettable drinks.
The chopped salad was off the charts amazing, a must order. I also had the short rib which I really enjoyed. Our waiter also made great wine selections.

Dark, noisy, overpriced, weak customer service. We ( two couples) had dinner here tonight for the first time. An appetizer of fondue-curdled cheese, lots of bread. Weak. An appetizer of Capprresse- decent,  Two entrees - chicken and sprouts, poor plating, bare-looking, weak. The other was a lamb burger- plain, tasteless, frozen French fries. Weak. Customer service- the worst. Long periods of time between visits from server. Empty glasses, empty table, no food, weak. Scottsdale, this is typical of your dining options, all show no substance. I will not be eating at this place again.

We had a delicious meal. The Original Chopped Sald was so good we shared it as a starter and then I ordered it for my entree. My husband had the Pork Belly Pastrami and it was so good. Our server was Gina and she wS so sweet and personable. We had a drink at the bar before dinner and loved Will the bartender. Two big .

This review is for my second trip to CPH.  It was a special family affair that brought us back.  We were celebrating joint 50th Birthdays with our two children.  We arrived prior to 6 Pm and were able to order some of the reduced Happy hour drinks and bar appetisers.  I good value.    I did order one of the barrel drinks for $5.  It was ok, and for a few bucks more, i would have preferred my regular gin and tonic. Too much flavor and spice in the barrel drinks for me palette.  We had the bacon popcorn and fondue as bar appetiserrs, both excellent.    For entrees we had the meatloaf, the scallops, the black cherry roasted short ribs and I had the grilled cheese.  There were also all wonderful.  Well prepared and presented.  Our waiter was suberp and it made for a ncie evening.  Noise level was not so bad until the place started hopping around 8 PM.  Then the noise level was a bit much for us old fuddy duddities.

We came for happy hour/dinner and were glad we did. The less expensive wines drop to $5 during happy hour. We had some. Others had ice tea and Arnold Palmer.  We had olives and bacon popcorn snacks.  Three had a lamb burger which was good but not great.  I had a mortadella slider and it was good. The kennebec fries with the burgers tasted good but were very chewy. The almond and bacon brittle wasn't bad but difficult to eat after dinner. Service was very good. we will want to try it again.
Very impressed all around with the service, ambience and food. Our server was spot on and you can tell this crew is well trained to make your dining experience vey enjoyable.

Citizen Public House is awesome! I've been here twice now, and am wondering why I don't go more often. The food, drinks, & service is impeccable, and the ambiance is great.  Here's the breakdown of what I've tried so far: - bacon popcorn: you really can't go wrong with popcorn cooked in bacon fat and bacon pieces - chopped salad: this salad has it's own facebook page for a reason, I had a sample of this at an event and that is what brought me here to begin with. https://www.facebook.com/TheOriginalChoppedSalad?fref=ts - watermelon & halloumi salad: marinated sweet watermelon chunks with tangy halloumi, so good - pork belly pastrami: simple but so flavorful - burrata: creamy goodness, fresh ingredients, you can't not like this - scallops: generously sized scallops with bacon, cooked perfectly - rockfish: served with a mild curry sauce, also cooked perfectly, also a generous portion I would highly recommend Citizen as it's one of my favorite Phoenix restaurants!
Fantastic food & service, loved the ambiance. We'll be back again next year for Spring Training.
Pork Belly Pastrami - excellent Chopped Salad - unique Smoked Duck Breast - delicious Bread Pudding - fantastic  Excellent all around.

This was a pick for a girls night out.  I ordered the pan seared scallops and they were phenomenal.  Their "Persian 9" specialty cocktail is crazy good.  I'm glad I was with a group who like to share plates.  It allowed for a nice sampling of the menu.  The friendly staff and great service along with the fabulous food make this a place I recommend with confidence.

I had a confirmed reservation but unfortunately made it (via Yelp) for Wednesday and had intended for Tuesday. When we walked in on Tuesday in March at 6pm there was only 1 table that was occupied by patrons (the place was empty) and the hostess was very rude...she said that she wasn't sure if she could accommodate the 4 of us. Screw her, we left and went to the Herb Box.

Always a favorite spot when I'm in town. Meatloaf is one of the most unique dishes and boy is it a treat! Happy hour specials are solid. Service is top-notch. If you are in the area, don't hesitate to come by and every seat in the house is good!

Always have the best experience when I eat here. For some reason Gary is always my server but he's fantastic! He always makes wonderful recommendation when I can't figure out to eat. Can't go wrong with anything...

CPH is amazing! We have never had a bad meal there.  We have tried a few of their salads, including the Chopped, Fernet Steak, and local field greens, all if which were good.  We also tried the Pork Belly Pastrami appetizer, which they have received numerous reviews on, and it was delicious.  My husband LOVES the short ribs in the coffee rub.  My absolute favorite is the scallops.  They are fresh and cooked properly, and are paired with some wilted greens, corn grits and a cola gastrique sauce.  The whole combination is amazing!  We are normally stuffed, so have only tried dessert once, but it was incredible as well.  We ordered the apple pie in a cheddar cheese crust, and it was by far the best apple pie I have ever tried.  We love Citizen Public House and will continue to call it one of our favorite restaurants in the Phoenix area!

I absolutely love this place! I was working out of town in Phoenix recently and visited here on a whim on a Sunday evening - wonderful wine on the happy hour list, impecable service - I sat at the bar and there were amazing bartenders, and the scallops were to die for! I highly recommend this place.

Service was great, food was awesome!  Yelp is right.  Definitely try the pork belly pastrami ($12) and the Citizen chopped salad ($12).  The pan-seared scallops were also winners ($24).  The cask cocktails are also amazing. So smooth.  The Manhattan ($11) was amazing.  The flavors definitely mellowed in the cask and gave it a unique flavor as well.  And don't miss the bread pudding!  Yum! $10 and worth every penny!  Plus one of the only places in downtown Scottsdale that's open past 10pm.  Score!

I have Mixed feelings on Citizen Public House. I truly want to love it more than I do and because if that I've been here about 3 different times. I almost wish I could write two seperate reviews. If I were writing this simply on the drinks the service and the atmosphere I would give them a solid 5 stars. I just feel like for me, the food is a hit or miss.   The first time I came in was for my boyfriends birthday. We eat out almost every meal and were so excited to try Citizens public house. I had called before hand to make the reservation and they seated us in a great location.  The service was top notch. I dont remember our servers name but he was fantastic. We ordered three smaller plates to share and every thing was just ok.   The Chop Salad: Our server told us we had to try it. This is something that they are known for. We both thought it was good but not overly fantastic. I honestly expected more. Presentation wise it was really pretty  The Kilt Lifter Fondue: So-So once again not overly impressed. The idea of fondue is fun but i wanted just a little more.   The Truffle Grilled Cheese: They honestly need to take this off the menu. It is aweful. It tasted like someone just put a huge mass of potatos on bread and called it a day. DO NOT ORDER THIS.    PB&B Pudding jar: Yum im a fan. Im a sucker for anything with caramel and bannana and this hit the spot.   I dont remember the drinks we ordered but they were all great. They know what there doing behind the bar.   We left that night a little dissapointed. I still left the server a great tip because he was awesome and deserved it but I wish the food had reflected the service.   Ok So now for EXPERIENCE #2:  I came in with a girlfriend for restraunt week and had a Fantastic time. We were seated in the same great place as before. Our server this time wasnt as great as the guy Id had before but he was a gem. They have somewhat of a pr-eset menu for restraunt week so heres what we ordered:   Squash soup: Not always on the menu. It was a little bland but over all good. Its hard to make butternut squash soup pop. I was happy.   The Pan Seared Scallops: OH MY GOSH YUM. These scallops are fantastic!!! The corn grits they are served on are to die for and the cola gastrique is Awesome. This dish is killer and I would come back for them. I even ordered them at thei sister restaurant the gladly.   Amaro Meatloaf: The meatloaf was huge!! I only tasted one bite because it was my friends but she loved it and the bite I took was great as well. Tasted as good as moms meatloaf!! The only quam we had with this was My friend had asked to switch the veggies it was served with and our waiter just  flat out said no. She could have at least asked the kitchen for us.  PB&B Bread Pudding: I feel like it was different than the first time id had it. Maybe not in a jar? Still good though!!  Now for the drinks: The Sangria here is the Bomb. I dont know what they put in it but man is it good. I also love the Citi-zen cocktail. So Yummy! and they put a rock candy stir stick on top which is so cute!!!  Iv'e also been in before just to sit at the bar for drinks no food and the experiances are always good. Like I said before the guys behind the bar know their stuff.  Alright so I have mixed feelings, One Blah experience and one great experience. Im conviced that the main courses here are all awesome and we just oredered the wrong items the first time so I still reccomend this place to people. I really Want To love Citizen Public and there are parts of it that I do.

Everything that we ate here was delicious. I started off with the the pork belly pastrami and it was delicious. For the main meal i got was the lamb burger and it was insanely good. Never had a burger like that. It was gamey but tender. For dessert i got the bread pudding. I licked the plate clean. Everything at the restaurant is great. I would recommend this place to all.

Wow this place is incredible.  We had 3 courses and drinks.  Meatloaf and pork shank was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.  The "bar snacks" and starters were extraordinary and bursting with flavor.  Go to this restaurant- you will not be disappointed.

The original chopped salad is as good as people have made it out to be! It was simply fantastic especially with the presentation and all the ingredients of the salad blended very well together. I can definitely see why this is their most popular dish. The pork belly pastrami was very good as well and probably my second favorite after the chopped salad. Lastly, the chicken fried duck leg was not bad but compared to the other options I thought it was just OK.  I missed out on the happy hour unfortunately and didn't get any drinks on my first visit, however seeing as how I enjoyed the appetizers here I plan on making a return visit here to try out their drinks and of course to get the chopped salad again.

Had dinner there Thursday night. The food was good but the noise level was unbelievable.  Strongly suggest that you sit outside. I was literally yelling across the table to try and have a conversation.  In the end we gave up trying to talk.   Our meals were a contrast in extremes. I ordered the duck  burger and my husband ordered the game hen.   The server warned that my meal was going to be large. He should have warned that the Cornish game hen meal was super small.    The Cornish game hen was described by my husband as "fine".  I on the other hand thought my duck burger was seriously tasty. I wisely halved my burger before I started eating it.   I was going to order dessert, as the menu looked so good. Glad I didn't as my neighbor on the table seated to my left ordered what I was going to the red chocolate cake with mousse etc. when I saw what he received I re thought my order. It appeared a little to pretentious and decidedly not as decadent as the menu described   All in all it was a good food experience. The noise was the big downer of the night

We went because of the high reviews. I really like the dark atmosphere, nice staff, and the drink menu. The Citizen is an awesome drink. Unfortunately, we weren't impressed by the food. The chopped salad was interesting, but I wouldn't order it for a dinner appetizer again. The grilled cheese I had to send back because it was melty yummy cheese, it was rubbery weird tasting cheese. The chicken entree was just okay, nothing special and the pork belly app didn't impress either. Maybe we picked the wrong items, but I don't think we'd go back for dinner.

I wasn't as impressed as others by Citizen Public House and I really wanted to be.  It was good, but not great.  Had the chopped salad and it was full of flavor, but didn't leave me wanting more.  In fact, we stopped ordering after it and left before we had a meal.  I can't put my finger on exactly any one thing, but didn't feel inclined to stay.  The waitress lacked culinary instincts and seemed interested to "sell" rather than guide us to what would interest us.  Overall, I wouldn't come back with all the other amazing options in old Scottsdale.
Chopped salad is so unique....and so delicious!  Zone of the best chicken dishes I have had.
The chopped salad and pork belly pastrami blew my damn mind. Great staff, great food and reasonable prices make this my favorite spot in old town.

Great ambiance and food is very good, filled with a variety of flavor. They also have a great drink menu to choose from with lots of wines. The short ribs with the cherry sauce is to die for. The meat is tender and perfectly cooked. Mac and cheese is amazing and their salads are a absolutely fantastic. Will be going here again very soon. Only thing I don't like is the tables are very close so it makes privacy impossible, I felt like we were eating with the people next to us!

Bacon and popcorn was good. Pork belly pastrami was the real treat though. After that the chopped salad was a great original kind of taste that I have never had before. Thanks to the bartender Thomas for good conversation and superb craft cocktails. I hope to visit again soon.

Sweet service and excellent food.  I am not a foodie, so I am always impressed with food no matter the place.  I had the meatloaf (amazing!) with a side of zucchini and the chopped salad.  My friend split an order of scallops with her husband.  If you are in Scottsdale, or anywhere in the East Valley area, stop by.  We loved it and will return.

The restaurant was beautiful however a bit loud. We were a party of 11. I started with the aged barrel scotch drink. This was tremendous. They delivered an olive tapenade bread with butter after the drinks were delivered. This was good. I had the short rib and mashed potatoes. The short ribs, kale and sauce was amazing however the mashed potatoes was way too syrupy and thin. I think they added this sweet sauce to the mashed potatoes. Someone ordered the mashed potatoes as a side and it was very good not like the side on my plate. The rack of lamb came almost raw and wasn't sent back because she was too shy. The beans under the lamb were hard.  She did try to tell the waiter she didn't like them and he promptly brought the exact same beans to the table. She sent those back and got the mashed potatoes. The grapefruit salad was amazing. The meatloaf was truly amazing. Best ever anywhere! Mac N Cheese was very good not great. The waiter delivered a hard sugar cookie packaged in plastic wrap for the birthday guest. It was what you would expect from Subway yet not as good. The service was very good. There was a waiter in the corner watching our table at all times. All we had to do was look up. Very cool. On the whole the experience was very good not great.

We went to CPH for Restaurant Week and were blown away.  The service, our three course meal and cocktails were excellent.  Our server recommended the meatloaf and it was delicious.  The manager Daniel was attentive and friendly and runs a great establishment.  We are definitely returning to CPH.
Love this place and will be back!  There are three things I look for in a restaurant; great menu/food, great service, and ambiance.  If you are looking for these too then you have to try CPH!

Wow!  Their cocktail list blew me away.  So rare to find a place with a well rounded list of old school cocktails!  Each one is like a pice of art crafted to make you smile.  After the aperitif this place keeps me happy with outstanding food.  Bacon Popcorn: Delish.  Olives: Excellent to nibble with cocktails.  Mac & Cheeze: American standard done well here.  Chicken and Waffles: Gluten free and tasty.  Short Ribs: Big portion and well prepared.  Scallops: A savory take on this normally light dish.  Pudding Dessert: Hit the spot.  Best meal I've had in a long time!

Always wanted to try this place and went  for my birthday was not at all disappointed let's start with the service Sam was our waiter and this guy was the poster child for exuberance at a restaurant who knew was our first time he gave his selections  we chose one he just called the salad it's a deconstructed jem that just explode in your mouth prepared the table and it's absolutely outstanding I went with the pork belly pastrami I know it sounds odd but absolutely fantastic we did start with an appetizer we chose the fondue will say probably a little too many pieces of bread out of for a little more sausage and the Pears was just a perfect match for this beer fondue the desert that was a caramel chocolate extravaganza was definitely enough for two and pack we can't even finish it was so rich but it was certainly outstanding drinks were great amdd service was top notch really can't seem to say much more about it except had a great time definitely will be back
One of my favorite spots to catch a nice meal. Their chopped salad is one of my favorites! Great drinks, awesome ambience and an eclectic menu!

Food was quite good - chopped salad was awesome! However, the place is loud and the wait staff was put in a position of having to apologize for every course being way too late. If you want a quiet quality dinner this wasn't what we expected. Kudos to our waiter for making an awkward night as best as it could be.

Lives up to its 5 star billing.  The chopped salad was the highlight.  My party of four agreed-- you've never had a salad like this.  The lamb burger was also very very special.  The lepinja roll the burger comes on is absolutely perfect, the best piece of bread I've eaten in a long long time.  The porkbelly pastrami was rich and silky, but could have used more peppery pastrami-ness.  Still, a great piece of meat.  My wife did not love her grilled cheese.  She said the varied textures of the cheeses was not pleasant.  I had her leftovers the next day, and I tend to agree.  Very good flavor though, and again, superb bread.  They serve Goose Island Matilda on draft, which is now my favorite beer.

I'll go here for a cocktail called The Import. Everything is amazing here- staff, food (famous chopped salad), atmosphere. Even being in the center of Old Town Scottsdale it doesn't get obnoxious. There are nights where they are jam packed- even around the bar. Plan ahead if you are going on a date.

This is going to be the place to go in Old Town.  I had a fantastic time last Saturday.  Thomas was excellent at the bar.  He recommended the Citi-Zen martini, it was perfect, I had two.  We only had appetizers since we had dinner somewhere else, but everything around us looked fantastic.  The couple next to us was visiting from NY and they had the scallops and the chicken, both looked and smell great.  We will definitely be back with some friends.

Crazy drink selection, food was top notch. Little pricey but worth it. Atmosphere is pretty cool. Abbey our waitress was super informative and accommodating. Definitely a must visit for either an upscale dinner or a simple hangout for an eclectic drink concoction.

We went to Citizen Public House for our anniversary and it was everything you could ask for. Very cool atmosphere, prompt professional service and the food was fantastic! I would definitely go again either for a special occasion or even just for a drink. Their cocktail selection was amazing and they had a number of great beers to choose from.
