I'm a poor college student, therefore, I don't eat at places this nice very often. We came in last night around 8. The room is very spacious and beautifully decorated with a nice ambiance. The service kind of confused me, because I'm used to servers wanting you in and out as soon as possible. Here, they get your drink order, then get your appetizer order. They don't get your meal order until AFTER you finish your appetizer, just in case you change your mind after eating the appetizer. The head chef, I believe, of the restaurant personally delivered our appetizer and chatted us up for a good 15 minutes. We got the pork belly as our appetizer and it was really good, basically melted in your mouth. I ordered the AZ BLT and my friend ordered the grilled halloumi cheese. Both were REALLY good. The BLT came with homemade bacon and the cheese on the grilled cheese was super tasty. I ended up switching sandwiches with my friend because I enjoyed the halloumi cheese more! We finished off the meal with the bread pudding which, like everything else, was absolutely fabulous. I'd give the restaurant five stars, but the drink orders took FOREVER. This was there only downfall. Besides that, I would definitely return, especially to check out the sexy, bald bartender with the tattoos.

My new favorite place in old town. Late night menu on the weekends always keeps things interesting. Thomas the bartender is always very nice and knowledgeable. I have tried just about everything on the menu, and have yet to be disappointed.

Attentive staff, succulent offerings, incredible mixologic concoctions...Citizen continues to inspire with it's near-perfect...okay, PERFECT menu of entrees, cocktails, and starters that plow new ground of satisfaction. I went to AZ88 after this place tonight, and I'm convinced this IS the best place in Lower Scottsdale - -and perhaps the Valley entire, to enjoy...everything!

I think I've subconsciously avoided writing this review in hopes that no one else would find my favorite my Manhattan joint... well that didn't work so here goes! Hands down best cocktails in old town, everything from their sangria to their Manhattans are made fresh and it's clear the recipes have been thoroughly tested. Same goes for the food.  We mostly go for the drinks and the reverse happy hour appetizers, but their dinner menu is also superb.  There isn't a huge vegetarian selection, but what they do have is tasty and filling.  Some of my favorites are the kiltlifter fondue, hummus, burrata and kale starter, and the truffle grilled cheese.  I've honestly never made it to dessert because there is never any room. Someday... but as long as they keep up the quality I'll be a CPH superfan for life =)

Came here for Restaurant Week as the reviews for this place seemed pretty stellar.  First things first, outstanding service (almost alarmingly so).  Our server Gary took great pains to ensure the four of us had a good experience and were taken care of.  Props to Gary for going the extra mile for us.    Now to the food.  Again, went with the restaurant week menu for this visit.  For the appetizer I of course went with the chopped salad.  As expected it was outstanding.  Great presentation, tons of tasty ingredients, and just the right portion.  I think the chopped salad at Cowboy Ciao might be a little better, but just barely.  For the main course I went with the scallops that were covered with greens, tiny pieces of bacon, and doused in a cream corn sauce.  Great dish.  Portion was healthy but not over top.  I had a piece of the buttermilk chicken dish from my girlfriend's plate and that was also good.  For dessert I had the caramel bread pudding.  Portion was fairly small, but tasted good and when all was said and done I didn't feel uncomfortably full.  The reason I dock one point wasn't the food or the service, but the noise.  I literally had to yell across the table for everyone to hear me.  The acoustics are such that even the smallest noise bounces everywhere.  Probably wouldn't be a big deal if I were just hanging out at the bar, but I didn't think the sounds would be so overpowering in a sit down restaurant.  Overall though, cool place and great food.  Just make sure your vocal chords are adequately prepared.

First time here. Actually it's my first time eating in Arizona! Being from LA and eating around there all the time, one can be kind of a food snob when eating outside of your comfort zone. This place does not disappoint. Everything we ordered was on point from the scallops, short ribs, meatloaf, and their chopped salad.  If you're in Scottsdale, hit this place up. Shout to Brad our server!

*Reviewing cocktails only*  I have not eaten here yet but if the cocktail quality is met or surpassed by the food, this is a huge winner.  The bartenders know their stuff and they use amazing ingredients like the antique formula vermouth (this stuff is $30 a bottle!) and luxardo cherries ($20 a jar).  My test is always to order a mescal drink and let the bartender make up what he/she wants with it.  I've had several of them and they've all been on par with some of the best cocktail places in SF, NY and Chicago.  My only small ding is the prices are high for Scottsdale.  SF has an average of $10 a cocktail at a respectable place... maybe $12.  I've paid $13.50+ at CPH.  Not a huge deal, but you get what you pay for here.
I have to say that the appetizers were pretty good and so were the entrees, though i would probably only come back for an event or special occasion.   Recommendation: 70%

I was so disappointed by our meal at citizen public house last night after reading such great reviews. I ordered the swordfish and it was so incredibly bland and the sauce was cold. My boyfriend had the carne asada tacos which were fatty and very average. Finished with the bread pudding which was alright but the ice cream that came with it was super watery and flavorless. Two stars for service and for the chopped salad. What a bummer this restaurant was
Have the Buttermilk Chicken. It was amazing and moist. Great atmosphere and reasonable prices. Great for a romantic evening!
Great experience and great food. Waitress was extremely helpful with recommendations and was always around when needed. Crab cakes, spare ribs and the drinks were all spot on

Why oh why have I deprived myself of this amazing establishment for so long?! No idea, but that all changed last night. After a long day, my best friend and I got hungry and were craving mac 'n cheese so we strolled into Citizen Public House.   We were warmly greeted by the most amazing and kind-hearted bartender, Will. He was super quick with getting us our drinks, and (I swear he was lightning fast) getting our order of mac 'n cheese in. They all must've known how hungry we were 'cause our food came out in the blink of an eye -- or so it seemed. The cheese was ooey gooey, and the pasta was cooked exactly perfect. It was topped with a tomato something -- which gave it an unique and mouth-watering flavor.   The mac 'n cheese was so good it was gone in 2.2 seconds. And what's the logical thing to do when your amazing mac 'n cheese runs out? You order another bowl, of course!!! Will was so incredibly sweet, he bought us our second bowl of mac 'n cheese, which totally made our night! Thank you, Will. And management -- he deserves recognition for his superb customer service (perhaps even a raise? Christmas bonus?). Matter of fact, the whole staff deserves recognition for their excellent service -- from the bartenders, to the bussers, to the kitchen that prepared the scrum-dilly-umptious food. The whole experience was incredible! The staff was quick, attentive, friendly, personable, and anticipated guests' needs before they even had to ask for anything. Keep it up, guys and gals! You're awesome!!!   We couldn't finish our second bowl of mac 'n cheese last night so we took it to-go... Smartest idea ever!!! I'm reliving the amazingness of last night as I write this review. So.Incredibly.Yum! Thank you, Citizen Public House!
This place has a wonderful atmosphere and amazing food. Perfect for date night or celebrations! Everything was awesome, but don't miss the chop salad!

Yum yum yum! I ordered the chicken for dinner and it was amazing! Perfectly tender and moist, the chicken was served on a bed of some vegetables (wish I knew the name) covered with sauce. You'll probably have room for a dessert!   The service was exceptional. Our waitress was very attentive.   I would also describe this place as upscale casual. The tables have white cloths, but I noticed other patrons wearing upscale casual attire with flip flops. I'd definitely recommend a reservation if you're coming in with more than 4 people and during rush times!

Great intimate place. Wonderful decor. Makes for a nice casual date night. Ordered some appetizers and a bottle of Vue. Not a high markup which was surprising. I've paid well over 130 for the same bottle at City Hall.  Overall I would recommend this restraint and dine here again.

Love this place! The space is loud and vibrant with an interesting mix of people.  Food and drinks were delicious with service being attentive without being overbearing. Had the Piggy & Waffle, lamb loin and scallops, and drank the Citi-zen, Sazerac, and Hot Pink Paloma. Food was especially tasty, and drinks were also good.  Looking forward to many return visits!

This place is fantastic.  In town for the weekend, and tired and criminally under-dressed in a hoodie and jeans, came here after not finding much else that tripped our trigger in the downtown area. Boy, what a surprise!  Classy inside, with the New York-like black and white interior, with lots of sleek lines and glossy surfaces, we were welcomed immediately and led to a table where our server showed up attentively, but long enough for us to get settled in. It's a talent I wish more servers had.  Ordered cocktails, which we enjoyed, but the real shining star was the food which was outstanding. Let me recount:  Bacon Heirloom Popcorn Chicken and Waffles Mac n' Cheese Pork Belly Pastrami Truffle Grilled Cheese  Aside from being WAY too much food for two people, everything on that menu save the grilled cheese was delicious, and the grilled cheese only didn't reach that mark by a notch or two. They have many main courses, but if you don't get the pastrami and the chicken and waffles, you're cheating yourself.  Prices are what you'd expect for this type of atmosphere and location, and I'd suggest getting lots of appetizer type food rather than getting a full-on main course, though I'm sure those are delicious as well.  Also an excellent place for sending guests who are from out of town for weddings in the area for dinner the night before.

I've been meaning to get to the Citizen Public House since I heard about it - been on their mailing list, etc., but just never managed to get there.  Finally, a friend was in town and wanted to grab dinner in old town - he said gastropub, so I told him to meet me at Citizen.  I didn't realize that the Cowboy Ciao chef who originated their fabulous chopped salad was the man behind Citizen Public House - when I found that out, we had to start with that!  In case you haven't had it, please allow me to explain.  The plate arrives with lines of chopped salad items, looking like a bunch of colored stripes.  The stripes include dried corn, Israeli couscous, smoked salmon, asiago, pepitas, tomatoes, arugula and currants.  That is topped with a housemade buttermilk dressing and mixed up.  It's a fabulous mix of flavors and textures - a truly wonderful thing to eat.  If you haven't eaten it before, stop reading this and head to Citizen Public House.  Now.  It's ok, I'll wait.  I decided to try the buttermilk chicken for my main course.  Wow.  I was expecting fried chicken (that's usually what comes after 'buttermilk' in a chicken recipe title), but it was grilled.  It was incredibly flavorful.  Very very good.  We ordered a couple of desserts for the table:  Pig in the Orchard (apple and bacon bread pudding with maple ice cream and blueberry sauce) and the Peanut Butter Strata Bar (white chocolate ice cream, peanut butter crunch and strawberry jam).  The Pig in the Orchard was spot on - order it.  I was a bit 'meh' on the Peanut Butter Strata Bar.  Cool vibe at the restaurant, and right in the heart of Old Town (kitty corner from Cartel Coffee - which, of course, you know already, because you always get your espresso there, right?)

Another visit, this time solo after work. I arrived at 5 on a Thursday eve and it was nearly empty. Scottsdale is a late-night town, so no worries here.   I was given water and menus right away. The hostess announced that it was happy hour, so I was 'coerced' into a beer.   Sam approached me shortly later and offered to explain the menu. I wasn't very hungry so I ordered the Chopped Salad and the Chia Seed Seared Ahi Tuna.   My salad arrived in 5 minutes. The salad I've had numerous times and there are dozens of reviews about it so I'll focus on the Ahi.   It arrived shortly after my salad bowl was cleared. It was presented with micro greens, fried leeks and an asparagus gastric. The Ahi was seared nicely and was a good portion. Pretty good but not great. I was pining for the fondues that surrounded me.   Sam was genuinely happy to greet all his guests and made me feel like an important part of the clientele. Very good customer skills.

Good place. I definitely came in with extremely high expectations, given the rave reviews this place has. The food was definitely good. I ordered the steak with asparagus which i thought was really dry. My sister had the sea bass which was good. Chopped salad was good as well. Crab cakes were meh. I feel like there are better restaurants around. I'd definitely be back, but I wouldn't give this place 5 stars.   Service was very good, atmosphere was perfect for dates.

One word = D E L I C I O U S!   Such eclectic small plate options, varying ingredients and nothing basic about the menu! I thoroughly enjoyed their famous Cobb Salad!!! It was delicious! A must do when in Scottsdale!

If there is a place that deserves more then 5 stars this is it!  My wife and I stopped here for a cocktail and appetizer. It was a Monday right when they opened at 2:00 pm so it would have been easy to expect poor service. Absolutely not the case.   In all my years I've never met a more knowledgable bartender. He is very committed to his craft and provided great information about the drink choices and the food menu as well. Very easy to talk to, polite and just a great overall guy.   I had a craft beer and my wife a glass of wine. My wife is very knowledgeable about wine and the suggestion by the bartender was a perfect fit for her pallet.   My only regret is that we had already eaten lunch. The bacon popcorn was amazing and I have no doubt the rest of the menu is as well.   We will be back here again for lunch/dinner and if the same bartender is working I know where we will be sitting.   Just flawless in all aspects. Thanks for a great experience on our date day away from our children.
This place was amazing. Our host. Our waiter. Our food. Our dessert. Perfect. Scallops are hard and so is swordfish. This was perfect. :)

I had dinner at the bar on a very busy night. If you plan to go here, make reservations.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, the bartender made a delicious drink full of interesting spices called "The Persian".  My biggest disappointment was the food. Some say that this is the next Food Mecca of America. I disagree TOTALLY. I had a chance to try three dishes:  Truffle Grilled Cheese-Tasted like slightly cheesy potato on bread Lamb Burger- No flavor. The kennebec fries tasted odd, but went well with maple syrup. Piggy & Waffle- I think this was the best dish out of the three, but it was just ok. At least the pork was moist.  Overall, I think this place just tries too hard.  2/5 Might come back to try the chopped salad.
we had filet, scallop and fish (3 entrees), all are delicious! good service also, we'll definitely come back again!

We made reservations for Valentine's Day and because of the popularity of this place could only get at 3 pm reservation. We did not eat breakfast or lunch and arrived very hungry. To our dismay there was a pre-fixe $60 per person menu and no other options and we were not warned of this when we made our reservation on Open Table. Since we did not know the menu prices well enough we didn't realize that for the majority of the selections one was getting seriously ripped off at the $60 per person price. We should have left but we so much wanted to eat there because the regular menu sounded so great and we were so hungry that we stayed.   The appetizers were smaller versions of regular appetizers that normally cost $7 to $12, the entrées were between $20 and $34 and the desserts were about $10. Only if you got the $34 filet mignon were you anywhere near the $60/pp price which of course did not include tax or gratuity. For those of us that ordered the meatloaf we paid about $15, maybe even $20 too much for our meal.  That being said we thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails and food and our server AJ was fantastic. He engaged us when we gave him details about our activities earlier in the day and he had very sound suggestions on the menu. We did return the next day without a reservation and sampled the regular menu.   We ordered the Citi-Zen (a vodka, lemon martini basically), a Manhattan, the Thai Margarita and The Import that had whiskey, a stout float and a smoked sugar rim. The two best were the Citizen and the Manhattan (crystal clear - no shaking!) with the Import third and the Thai Margarita not balanced and too sour. The next day we had happy hour drinks - a Bouvedier (sp?) sort of like a Manhattan which was very good and the regular menu Pleasantville which although AJ did not care for our party thought was very tasty - maybe a little floral.  Here's what we ate on both nights:  Curry Caulilower soup - has a good kick of spice to it from the curry oil - delicious.  Chopped salad - excellent. The freeze dried corn gives nice crunch and flavor. It is presented in little piles in the bowl so that you can see all of them clearly before you mix it all together yourself.   Pastrami brussels sprouts - the rye spaetzle "sticks" were dry and strange, the rest of the dish was great.  Fondue was good, not great - it seemed a little thin in flavor.  Scallop entrée was amazing.  Pork and beef meatloaf was a very large portion and satisfying, it needs more of the porcini mushroom drizzle.The mashed potatoes under the loaf were chunky as well but not overly buttery.  Fair trade short ribs - absolutely amazing! Tender, full of flavor and not fatty. Cherry barbecue sauce was a little overwhelming for it.  Pork shank - tender and good flavor but not amazing.  Lamb burger - very strong flavors, roll too chewy, french fries are the bomb, so good and crispy!  AJ had recommended the Filet Mignon and after seeing it land on another table we regretted it not ordering it as it appeared to be a 10 ounce (or more) portion that was over 2 inches thick and perfectly cooked!  Dessert was duo of flourless chocolate cake (with a teaspoon at most of a salted caramel sauce that was great) and a heart shaped red velvet cake. They were okay but a little bit of a let down to end a Valentine's day meal.

There is a reason this restaurant has SO many 5 star reviews! The service and food is PHENOMENAL. I am at the point where I want to bring everyone I know to this place after trying it out. I came in with 2 of my closest friends for a birthday around 8pm. It was busy but they were still able to seat us right away. I had my 2 month old baby with me. I am breastfeeding so it is hard to leave him at home and as many moms know at that age they really don't have a set bed time. The host staff was so welcoming and instead of being weirded out that I brought an infant carrier into a gastro pub they responded with excitement and loved seeing my little one. After we were seated the service was just wonderful. The server (I wish I remembered his name- I think Alex) was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. We had a couple small dishes, the fabulous chop salad, and dessert. This review is a little late (we dined in November) but it needed to happen. If you haven't been here YOU NEED TO GO!!

I am a fan of the late night menu which starts at 11pm, has great deals, amazing food and ends at 1:30a! Late night gourmet on the cheap!  The regular menu is great too! Everything sounds odd when described but tastes like heaven when it arrives!  First timers:  App: pork belly pastrami or share the original chopped salad Main: the scallops or the porcini filet

After multiple visits I can't complain. Food is always delicious. Servers are always personable, well informed and attentive. Take your friends. Take your family. From drinks to dessert everyone will be happy.

I admit I was super skeptical of the notorious Chopped Salad...so famous it has its own FB page! Even when the waiter described the ingredients, I still didn't think it sounded good. But I was wrong! It is strange and it is delicious. The service is great here and all our meals were excellent. We ordered the scallops, filet, smart chicken, pork shank, and short ribs. All were excellent, but the short ribs was definitely the most unique dish with a nice combination of flavors. The staff was super attentive and even though it isn't a kid friendly restaurant, they were great with my 4 yr old and he enjoyed the Mac and cheese.

Simply fantastic all the way around. Incredible service backed up by innovative food and drink ideas. I have had shrimp and grits before (a favorite on Bravo's Top Chef). Citizen Public house simply substituted scallops for the shrimp and it turned out great. For desert I had milk and cookies. No kidding.  I've not had milk and cookies since I was a kid, and it was all that I remembered it to be. The cookies were an assortment of gourmet locally made gems so whatever type of cookie you remember from your childhood, it's probably represented here.  Some soft, some a bit on the hard side, which needed a little longer soak.   There are some great new cocktail ideas on the bar menu as well as some old classics that they manage to pull off quite well. All in all, CPH is a great restaurant.
Stetson salad. Literally that's all you need to know. Get it with the salmon. Amazing.

Buttermilk roasted chicken is on point! My uncle came to Phoenix for work and I'm new to Scottsdale so I had no idea where to take him but I went here off of a local's recommendation and it did not disappoint! My dad came to visit a few weeks later and I took him as well. I got the scallops that time and they were amazing!

Great restaurant.  Went late on Sunday night. The bacon fat popcorn was our starter and it was so tasty. We shared the beets which was lovely. The salad I had for my meal was the chop salad but very unusual. Try this as a signature dish and very unique.  Loved this!

Probably the best scallops I've had!! Cooked the perfection. The only thing I wish was that the veggies were something other than the bitter Asian veggies. Didn't seem to go but the scallops themselves were seasoned so well and cooked so perfectly!  Oh and they're huge!   Came here to celebrate a bachelorette. The ambiance is nice and good for groups.

This Scottsdale jewel will have to become a regular haunt. Creative appetizers, craft beers and a nice wine selection help start a unique dining experience. The service is terrific with everyone having a solid knowledge of what is being served and (my favorite) actually having an opinion they are willing to share with you if you ask.  We started with the imported olives followed by the Burrata. Definitely need to ask for more bread. For entrees we had Pan Seared Scallops and the Gypsy Pork Shank. The Scallops were terrific but the Pork Shank stole the show. Nice large portion, plenty to bring home. We didn't hit dessert menu this time but will dive in the next time we're in.   Great dining experience. Well done!

Outstanding place!  Can't believe I never made it here before.  The chopped salad was AMAZING.  I had Scallops with grits to DIE FOR.  Our waiter was amazing, too.  I was concerned about noise with the bar being so large and centrally located in the place, but it wasn't  an issue at all.  We got a little dressy, but there were definitely people in jeans.  Recommend!

This place was all it promised it would be!  We were told the wait would be 45 mins so we left our number and went to wander the city but were pleasantly surprised to receive a text about 20 mins later letting us know our table was ready! We snagged an out side table where we could actually hear each other as the inside has a vicious echo that detracts from the ambiance in our opinion... Our server was lovely and let us take our time deciding on each course before going to the next... We enjoyed the Famous Chop Salad, to see what the hype was all about and were not disappointed, although can see why other Yelp reviews comment on the smallness of portions. The crunch of the freeze dried corn was unexpected and the smoked Salmon sealed the deal! Next we split the Chia crusted Ahi and the Oso Bucco which were both perfectly executed and left us not a prayer of entering any room for dessert!  We would absolutely be regulars here if we lived locally!

Citizen Public House has excellent food and drinks.  We had the Pork Belly Pastrami, Mac & Cheese, "Smart Chicken" and Coffee and Donuts - all were delicious.  I would give the food 5-stars.  The dining experience overall 4-stars.  We felt that the service was somewhat slow.  We had to wait quite a bit for our server to take our order.  I even noticed people who sat down after we did had bread & olive oil.  I had to ask out server for bread (even though it was complementary she didn't bring it).  If the staff was more attentive, I would have given 5-stars overall.

Can't I give these guys 6 stars?? In town for some Spring Training baseball games, we wanted some good food and drinks - on a Friday night, everything was of course packed. Instead of laughing at us for not having reservations, they were so super nice and tried accommodating us BUT 3 seats at the bar opened and we happily ate there. The FOOD was all outstanding (recommend that duck burger, bigtime!) and the bartender who served us (I think his name was Eric?) was the best bartender and server I have EVER had. So attentive, so fun, I wish I lived here so we could come every weekend. KUDOS to these guys!

My husband to be and I had a great date night here. We made a reservation using open table and were seated promptly when we came in. Our waiter Gary was fabulous and provided great recommendations on the menu. He was fun and knew the menu well. We had great drinks and great food. We tried the crab cakes and Mac n cheese both to start with. My hubby to be got the filet and I got the meatloaf and everything was super yummy. Definitely will go back and bring friends!

We were able to walk in on a Friday night without reservations (3 people) and be seated within 10 mins. This is sometimes unheard of on a weekend in Old Town, so we may have gotten lucky. They do accept reservations (to my knowledge), so if you don't want to gamble make reservations.  Service: The restaurant has a bit of a bourgeoisie feel, but the the service was attentive and polite.  Food:  We ordered the gypsy pork shank (tender and delicious), bacon fat heirloom popcorn (so tasty and even better the next day), the OMFG salad (saw many reviews for this and gave it a try -- very unique, light taste and filling), and filet mignon asada tacos.   Our server told us that they didn't have any house wine selections, but did recommend a red for me to try. I asked for a sample before getting a full pour and it was tasty. They seemed to have a nice list of cocktails, but nobody else in our party ordered drinks, so I can't speak to how those are.  Would definitely come back here for the salad and popcorn.

This is my new favorite valley restaurant. The drinks are great and the food is excellent too. A tad pricey, especially some of the cocktails.  Our first waitress Katie was fantastic, but she may have set the bar too high... Noone since has lived up to her standard.   The original chopped salad is a must. Also, the cheese fondue is a great appetizer for three or four diners.   For dinner, the filet mignon asada tacos are very tasty but I'm not much of a taco guy. Not sure why I ordered them. My own fault. The Gio Osso Burger is the best burger in the valley I think.  The peppercorn filet mignon is super tender and mine was cooked exactly to spec for the medium rare I ordered. The fair trade short ribs are terrific and tender but a bit on the small side if you are a big eater.   The best dessert in my opinion is the Black and Tan. The push pop is just okay, more something to laugh about than thoroughly enjoy, but ymmv. The apple crisp is tasty but could use more apple frankly.  My big complaint about Citizen Pub House would have to be the noise. Put up some acoustic panels or tile please so diners can converse without shouting across the table!

AMAZING experience. It was our anniversary dinner and we started with a complementary dinner. Ambience is just awesome. In starts, I tried pork belly pastrami n my husband order chopped salad. Salad was interesting. It was sweet n crunchy. Pork belly just melts in ur mouth. In entrees, we order Mediterranean Sea Bass n Flat Iron Steak. Steak was perfectly cook but star was Sea Bass. It was so beautiful n perfectly cooked. We wl visit again. It's a must visit place.
Get the chopped salad and the scallops. I love this place!!!!

I'm used to restaurants being noisy these days, but this place was so noisy we could barely carry on a conversation. Service was polite but adequate. The server offered to bring some bread since the dinner was taking so long to arrive, ironically the bread arrived after the meal which didn't arrive for at least another 10-15 minutes after her offer of bread.   My husband ordered the velveeta filled burger, I had the street tacos and our friend had the filet mignonette. Both my husband and I found our food to be quite average but the filet mignon was reported to be quite good.   Be careful with the burger, the first bite has cheese literally exploding out of it. Both my husband and I were covered in hot cheese. The server was apologetic and offered to pay for dry cleaning if needed. It wasn't needed but it was a nice gesture.   All in All, we wouldn't desire to come back.

Love the atmosphere and decor.  I think this place would be pretty good for big groups.  The bar is nice and I love the drink menu.  I'd like to try each one, they sound so interesting.  I had the Persian this time around.    The chicken and waffles had good flavor.  Loved the seasoning on the chicken and it was cooked just about right.  There was one piece that had a bit of wet batter but for the most part it was well worth the 10.  4 large pieces of chicken on top of a smallish square of waffle.  It was actually way better than Lo-Los and probably about the same price!  I tried some of the filet mignon, duck and scallop entrees.  Loved the combinations, especially the filet and the scallop - wasn't sure about the risotto that came with the duck.  The glazes for the filet and scallop was very good as well.  All in all, the prices are kind've high but reasonable for the product and experience they bring.  I would love to come back to try the rest of the menu!

My girlfriends and I came here for my bachelorette dinner and I'm so glad we did! We flew into Scottsdale from Houston for a few days and loved the restaurant scene here! Citizen Public House was absolutely amazing!  We true the pork belly pastrami, chopped salad and I had the scallops for my entree.  Everything was absolutely DELICIOUS! We did a bit of research regarding the menu here before our dinner and originally thought, "A chopped salad? Really? How much better can it be than the ones served everywhere else?".  Boy, were we wrong! It was so worth it!  The pork belly pastrami was TO DIE FOR (ignore the fact that your cholesterol may shoot 50 points)! Hehe ;) The scallops were cooked perfectly and seasoned just right.    Our server was very knowledgable about the menu offerings and even suggested a few areas around town that we might like to visit after our dinner.  He was super friendly and checked on us frequently throughout the night.    If I ever make a trip to Scottsdale again, I'll definitely be stopping by here again :)

5 stars. You heard me.  Man, am I late on this review...  My sweetie took me to dinner at CPH for my 35th birthday. I know what you're all thinking... "but Kristi...you don't look a day over 34&3/4." Stop....no, pleassssseeee enough with the flattery folks. I can't take it anymore. No seriously. Keep going..  Turns out CPH is right up there with the likes of Nobuo at Teeter House and FnB when it comes to quality and experience. Excellent wine selection. Please, if you have the opportunity, try the 'Tender Belly' bacon fat heirloom popcorn. It was delicious. Though bacon fat could probably make dog poo tasty.   I enjoyed the Porcini-dusted Filet Mignon, medium rare and had a couple of nibbles of my fiance's scallops (which were amazing). The Filet was cooked to perfection and though I'm somewhat of a purist and usually prefer my steak 'au-natural' I was beyond satisfied with the accoutrement. Impressed even.   The service was phenomenal. The distress surrounding my age caused me to consume a gigantic Ketel martini, a shit load of wine (local by the way, I love that) and a desert drink and not once was I cut off. Truly though, our server was a doll. Engaging and genuine; something obviously lacking in the service industry in Arizona.   The only thing I would change about CPH is the location and that's only due to my location, so I'll deal with it.

In a word....loud. It's so loud at CPH that it's hard to concentrate. The food wasn't memorable and my husband and I couldn't even talk to each other without shouting to be heard. The hostess couldn't hear us when we checked in for our reservation and had to walk into the hallway to hear us. Our server couldn't hear us well when we ordered. And what should have been a 5 minute wait turned into a 25 minute wait. Why bother making a reservation?   I had Bernie's Mac and Cheese. It was just ok. Husband had the meatloaf..that too was just ok. Dining out is a full experience though. It's not just about the food. It's about the service and ambiance too. The service was just alright..but again, it was so frickin loud that the ambiance is totally ruined and I think that also effects the service because there is an air of disinterest in the service staff and hostesses that was palatable.   I get that it's a pub. That said, you can't charge what CPH charges for food and expect people to have to shout at each other during the experience. We won't be back. It's not worth it. I truly do not get the hype AT ALL.

Well, we waited for water. We waited for drinks.  I've been home for hours and all that I can talk about is the salad that I had at Citizen Public House.   If I make it back to Scottsdale, I will get this salad. The meatloaf was great too!  My coworker has the Pork Cheeks and commented it was the best pork that he ever had.

Great food, good selection of wine, and killer drinks.  It was unfortunate that the only way to carry on a conversation was to shout.  Even the music seemed to be piped up louder due to the noise generated by everyone talking.  It's a shame that the ambiance of the restaurant was spoiled by so much volume.  You can even here it overcome you when to walk past the front door.
absolutely amazing service,drinks,and food. The best chopped salad you will ever had. And i hear the manager plays a wicked bass.

Love the Citizen Public House!  This restaurant has put together some really amazing food and drink for the old town area.  Its a nice change to the Rave going on east of Scottsdale Rd.  Whatever the drink is with Jameson 12 and tobacco leather bitters is phenomenal!
Great drinks, great bar, great fried pork and waffles! We will be back. Oh crap, the bacon popcorn was amazing!

The best beer I've ever had in my life, I just had at Citizen Public House!  Sitting at the massive bar in the center of the restaurant, the bartender was very gracious in offering tasting pours for the unfamiliar selection of microbrews they had on tap.  It was in this manner that I discovered Lagunitas IPA - on draft, and so deliciously hoppy, fruity, and refreshing I am determined to find it back home in Texas!    While sitting at the bar, I had a chance to pore over their menu, which sounded A-MA-ZING.  Each dish was very thoughtfully laid out with amazing-sounding garnishes for each protein.  The prices were appropriate for the high-end cuisine, ranging from $13 for a Waygu burger to $32 for a porcini-dusted filet.  I can't really comment further, since I had dinner reservations down the street and sadly couldn't stay.  The atmosphere was very cool and contemporary, very open.  It is definitely more of a restaurant than a "pub".  For a Friday night, it didn't seem that busy, which is a plus if you waited too long to make a reservation anywhere.  This will be my first meal whenever I return to Scottsdale!
The Original Salad is a MUST (but I hold off on the smoked fish). And their cocktails are fab.

Completely incredible. We had the burrata salad, the original chopped salad and the chicken over risotto. All were masterfully made with perfect, fresh ingredients. The place is not overly fussy, but the food is clearly made my someone with a great deal of skill. It was inventive but not too far out there. And it was so well crafted, but not over worked.  A difficult balance to strike, in my opinion. Our very memorable and charismatic waiter was Gary. And despite his big personality, he knew exactly when we needed him and exactly when we wanted to be left alone with our perfect food. Exceptional experience overall.

We stopped in this year for restaurant week and enjoyed the experience.  We tried the original chopped salad (the star of the meal), the soup of the day, the meatloaf, the chicken and both desserts.  The atmosphere is nice, the service is good and the food is consistent, but not out of this world, but maybe it was just the restaurant week menu.   Definitely a place worth checking out if visiting Old Town Scottsdale.

**H O L Y * C O W**  A diamond in the rough. Photos of the inside don't do the ambiance and good vibe of this place justice! The restaurant was packed and the bar was full nearly the entire time we were there.  We enjoyed the winter menu...the hubs ordered the meatloaf and it was magical...I don't even LIKE meatloaf and I asked for multiple bites. So what did I order? The field salad small plate and acorn squash with goat cheese and chorizo. Don't get me wrong the entrees all looked delicious but I couldn't get past the 'small plate' menu. Two items were perfect for me.  The flavors of all of the dishes were perfect and extremely complementary of each other. I don't believe there would be a bad choice on the menu and can't wait to go a second time.  So, not only are we foodies, we love good craft cocktails and here, again CPH delivered.   When you are looking to indulge and want something outside if the box...you won't be disappointed with Citizen Public House.  Cheers!!

I came here the other evening for happy hour and ended up staying for dinner.  I am very impressed! We ordered the crabcakes, which were light, fresh and tastey. They are deep friend but it didn't feel unhealthy or overly saturated in fat which was great. I ordered the scallops because of all the wonderful reviews on here, and yet again yelp did not fail me! My friend ordered the short rib, which was also excellent, I like how they serve the sauce on the side as to not over power it. One thing to note though: my scallop dish was very small (3 scallops) and my friend got two massive pieces of short rib. The portions were way off. I was still slightly hungry after my scallops and 1 crab cake, so of course we ordered the apple bacon bread pudding, which was nice. The blueberry sauce they put on it is great, not too sweet and compliments the other flavours nicely.  The ambiance is also very nice, with lots of light and fresh air coming in, crisp white tables clothes while still giving the allusion of being somewhat casual.   The cocktails were okay as well, the ones that we tried from the menu didn't amaze me. But weren't bad either, I'm rather picky admittedly. I did have the bartender make me an extra dirty martini which for once in Arizona was done almost perfectly. I don't know what is it with the desert but they can't make a martini to save their life. But here it was pretty good, I'll be returning for that. I should also note they have Sipsmith here! Haven't seen that in other bars in the area so I was very excited as that is my gin of choice.  All is all - nice place, good food, decent price, acceptable cocktails.

It was my first time eating alone at such a special restaurant.   The host and waiter led me to an intimate table for four and made my self date one of the most memorable dinners!   Sam, my friendly waiter, checked up on me every time he passed me by and kept me company like a friend. He also surprised me with the menu of the Original Chopped Salad, which was just a perfect combo of all the healthy grains and vegetables you would normally not eat by themselves. I can't wait to try the recipe myself and see if I can live up to Citizen Public House's expectations!   There's an intimate bar in the middle of the restaurant where all the couples sit. But I'd also recommend this place for those of you who want to bring your close family members and for all of you who are looking for some alone time; the wonderful hosts at CPH won't leave you alone.

This was my first time here, it was great. From our waiter Gary to the fabulous chopped salad with smoked salmon to my scallops, and let's not forget the bacon popcorn, everything was delicious! And we got the recipe for that great salad too.

This is just one of the best places in Scottsdale. Hands down the drinks the food the people make you feel like you are at home. You know how Norm felt at Cheers in the 80's that's how you feel here even if it's your first time they make you feel right at home.

A lovely (and very lively) pub/bar restaurants with really reasonable price & GREAT GREAT food! Two of us stopped by this place on a Tuesday evening while on our business trip after consulting Yelp. Even on a (mid)weekday evening, the inside of Citizen (although not full) was very lively (as opposed to other restaurants that seemed empty!). I love the fact that they had a list of MANY cocktail drinks for you to choose from. The waitress was great at recommending some vodka-based cocktails that my friend would like as well! For food, we opted for:  Appetizers: 1) Pork Belly Pastrami and 2) Chopped Salad. Both dishes were excellent! The pork belly was tender and with a mustard-based sauce and a bed of vegetable (I forgot what the veg was) while the chopped salad was so refreshing! (probably the bacon made it taste so great!  Main dish: 1) Seared Scallops and 2) Crispy Steelhead. The seared scallops were also great and came with saucey looking food of what tasted like mashed potato. The steelhead was actually a fillet (instead of whole fish) and I love their green pea risotto that came with it. Honestly, I actually like their appetizers more and thought the main dish was quite large (well, since we had 2 appetizers already!)...but the food was very good still!  Dessert: Pina Colada Bread Pudding (heaven~~~)...tasted/smell of toasted coconut was so aromatic after we took a bite of dessert. I'm normally not a dessert person but since the food here was so good (both appetizers and main dishes), I was glad we tried their dessert out, too!  All in all, the bill came to around $90 without tip including 2 cocktails)...really reasonable!! highly recommend this place as a place to hang out! Judging from the fact that it was actually crowded even on a Tuesday evening, I do have a feeling this place gets really crowded on Friday/weekend though!

This was my first time visiting the Citizen Public House, and have not yet decided if it is somewhere I'd go again.   Upon entering, we were greeted at the hostess stand and taken to our seats. We were seated next to a fairly loud group (not uncommon for Scottsdale on a Saturday night) who seemed to be having a good time discussing the merits of whatever their latest business ventures were and whose volume was not increasing much so chose to keep our appointed table.   The atmosphere of the restaurant was noisy and boisterous, and seemed to be filled with an interesting crowd of people. Half of them were a bit older and begrudgingly eating dinner out that evening and the other half were young  professionals. There was music playing overhead but it barely registered for most of the people there (one woman I overheard in the restroom was audibly surprised to hear it playing for the first time that evening.) The wait staff was incredibly attentive and pleasant-- the waiter introducing himself and shaking our hands was an interesting way to start off the meal.   At our server's recommendation we started off with the Pastrami Pork Belly (for him) and the Original Chopped Salad (for me.) Both were very flavorful and the salad presentation was a fun twist.   For an entree I selected the scallops, and he had the short ribs. My scallops were flavorful and well prepared, although the wilted baby kale which sat atop it was difficult to cut into in order to pair the two for a bite. The scallops were nested in a corn grit mix and the plate was drizzled with an interesting gastrique that was a little too sweet for my taste- I'm more of a vinegar fan.   The short ribs were rubbed a little too generously with coffee with very little extra flavor to add to it; the dipping sauce which was provided to flavor it was a little too salty to enjoy with the meat. Accompanying was a parsnip puree that neither of us were excited about. We agreed the appetizers were the best portion of the meal.   This seems like a great place to take a group of friends for apps and drinks to begin a fun night out in Downtown Scottsdale, but isn't really the type of place I'd recommend to anyone looking for a romantic and quiet dinner.

Food was amazing and I thought it was pretty reasonably priced for the amount you got, including drinks. We split the chopped salad to start and it was plenty for two people to share as an app. I got the chia ahi tuna and my wife had the scallops. Both were awesome and we were stuffed when we left.  The restaurant is pretty loud, so it makes it hard to hold a conversation.

I first heard about this restaurant when our son came home for a visit and showed me a picture of 'the best chopped salad I've ever had, Mom." So when we came out to visit him, we headed there. Our waiter was simply amazing - attentive but not hovering, very very helpful in choosing a wine (and letting me take a pic of the bottle so I could remember it!). He remembered our son from his previous visits.  The chopped salad lived up to the raves. The smoked salmon and dehydrated corn made all the difference in the taste and texture. It was simply amazing! My mushroom tartlet was earthy and tasty with some great light crust.  A must visit for Scottsdale!

Went last night for a drink and a little nosh with some coworkers. I didn't want to come here but the four girls I was with drag me in. I started of with a Manhattan and I love a good Manhattan, so I usually watch over the bartender when making them. I've seen it all from shaking one to using cherry juice and if I'm paying $10+ I want it done right. Our bartender out did me. He was on point and it was a perfect Manhattan. Thanks buddy. I order the cheese fondue and for a late night snack it was amazing. I pretty sure I got like 3 bits in before the girls attacked it. (I'm still raving to my friends about that bacon popcorn).  I'll be back for dinner soon.

Two things stand out:  1) Chopped salad. (I'm told it has its own Facebook page and a man doesn't just toss that salad aside.) It was celebrity-worthy.  2) Pregnant lady drink. That's not the name of it, but I happened to be dining with two expecting mothers in my group. As the only other non-drinker, I was happy to sip water. However, when these ladies got their fruited drinks and saw my simple H20 they took it upon themselves to ensure I joined the fruited party. They order the "pregnant lady drink" for me. Seeing the opportunity, the restaurant did it up right and packed more fruit and garnish in that drink than in most grocer's produce section. Well played.  I lied--the meatloaf also stood out, the scallops were outstanding, and I had a steak. I rarely order a stake, but when I do I order it rare. So tender. So simple, but with a nice, rich sauce to accompany the beef.  Honestly, the evening is a blur. The server handled our big, rowdy crowd with aplomb and grace and deserves a huge pat on the back for the effort. They showed us a tremendous time. The space is gorgeous, happy, and legitimately serving up some fantastic dishes.

Best salad I have ever had.....may sound strange but the most delicious, unusual creation.  It is a lively atmosphere, so having conversation is a bit of a shouting match.  Not a bad thing...just a thing.

So we went during restaurant week last Friday. And definitely had reservations, previously had tried to go to Citizen in April and it was slammed.    I loved the multiple course menu idea and to be honest I think they should do it often for certain weekends as nothing beats that. We both had the Chopped Salad, which to be honest...was amazing.  Great idea, and it sports it's own Facebook page. We also shared the drink pairing, the first one which was vodka based made sense but we really weren't that interested in it.  For the second course she had the Buttermilk chicken and I the pan seared scallops.  Both were amazing, the grits were very fine and I hate grits.  The grits were quite tasteful.  The second drink was a citrus and gin cocktail, definitely see how it went with the scallops or the chicken, it was good but no idea how it would couple with the meatloaf.  For our desert I chose the Peanut Butter Strata Bar and she the Pig In the Orchard, the peanut butter strata bar tasted as though I could ascend to heaven.  The bread pudding was ok, but the maple ice cream that came with it was decadent.  The cocktail was patron cafe based and it completely went with either deserts.    I would say the skills of the bar tender and the chef were in full display, the only thing that could have made this a five star night would have been our waiter being way more attentive.  He gets a pass as it seemed they needed more wait staff, so given how many patrons he had he did good work.

Stopped here for a New Years Eve meal with my wife before heading to the block party next door.  Set up a reservation on Opentable.  They had a set 3 course menu for $55 due to the holiday which was not clear when making the reservation, however we went with it figuring that it could be more expensive elsewhere. I had the Lentil and Sausage soup - which is good and tasty and my wife had the greens, both were pretty tasty.  Next up was a Filet for me and Butter Chicken for my wife.   I would say I got the better end of the deal but the food was all good.  To finish was a chocolate tart and sorbet "duet".  This was ok and probably the weakest part of the meal. Beer selection was good (we are not wine drinkers) they even had Framboise which is unusual. All in all a good start to our NYE celebrations!

Meh....not really sure what the hype is all about?  The food is not that great and the prices are outrageous!  Had the chopped salad and it was good, we have had something similar before though. My hubby had the scallops and I had the grilled cheese. Nothing wow about either one. We can say we went, we tried, we defiantly  payed but we will not be going back.  Sorry

Impromptu Friday night date.  First drove to a popular Tempe restaurant where the wait was 1.5 hours.  Then called another Tempe pizza place to inquire if they had gluten free pizza.  No.  This was the next call based on yelp reviews.  Was informed they have gf designation on the menu and they could seat us as soon as we drove over.   Restaurant was a tiny bit hard to find with entrance on the side road for a first timer.  Staff was extremely friendly.  Seating is odd as you are likely to be sat in the middle of the restaurant among many other tables as we were.  I hate having people sit behind me.  Waiter was very nice and informed us of the specials.  I ordered an iced tea with sweet and low.  Informed they don't have sweet and low - that's okay... it is important enough to me that I carry it in my purse.  Never got the iced tea.    My husband ordered the tacos.  They were okay.  Start off with a spice that quickly goes away.  Well prepared but simple.  The french fries that came on the same plate with the three small tacos were actually the best part of the meal.  I ordered the short ribs.  Small serving on a bigger plate which was fine I don't need huge portions.  The short ribs were super tender but lacked any flavor.  I didn't even finish one.  The cherry BBQ sauce was disgusting.  So sweet it overwhelmed any other flavor.  (Now to be fair my husband really liked the sauce and used it to dip his fries in.)  The parsnips were also average.  The greens on the plate were good.  I asked for different sauce to try with the short ribs and was brought out a demi glaze that was equally disgusting.  I'm confused by all the 5 stars but will agree to disagree.  Not all foodies will like the same thing.  With tip I think we paid around $53.

Even though Open Table had this venue booked solid we took a chance and arrived at Approx 830PM. We scored what I believe was the best table in the restaurant. A nice corner table in the back that was semi-private and great for people watching.  Even though you can show up in Jeans and/or shorts the Citizen is definitely upscale. Linen table cloths, excellent service, and wonderfully strong craft cocktails and of course a strong menu gives these guys an easy 4.5 stars.  Plus 1 ordered a Ketel One Martini with blue cheese olives. Her quote "This is as good as the ones you make at home". I went big with The Beast: Herradura silver tequila, Ancho Reyes chile liqueur, Averna Limoni, Aztec chocolate bitters. This is a one and done cocktail especially if you already had a robust HH and are planning to barhop post dinner. I would gravitate toward this craft cocktail on my next visit.  Appetizer was Chilean Crab Cakes: roasted corn salad, Oaxacan chile remoulade, micro cilantro 20. What, you thought they were your standard Krab cakes thing again as nothing is standard here. The two cakes are easily shared and ours were cooked perfectly just a tad crispy on the outside and buttery on the inside.  My main course was their gypsy pork shank. According to our waiter this dish is adapted from the chef's Hungarian family recipe. It was fall off the bone tender and I did not want my meal to end. Plus 1 stated that her smart chicken entrée was not that smart. Surely not a bust but she said she was expecting more flavor. Now the Brussel sprouts were another story. Perfectly cooked and seasoned.   Throughout the meal our waiter made sure we were well taken cared of and we never lacked for water or attention. I read that their HH is a great deal so that's on the short list for a return visit.

OMG the mashed potato grilled cheese with truffle oil will BLOW YOUR MIND. I love it. I've also had the duck which was equally life changing.   I'd suggest making a reservation, it's usually busy and the wait can be a damper to a fun date night.
Visited Scottsdale last week and Citizen's was highly recommended. The food was very good. But, the atmosphere was very bland and not inviting at all. I was surprised given the great reviews.

My friend and I recently came to Citizen Public House for dinner (Tuesday evening). The restaurant was crowded (past 6pm), but the host was kind enough to offer us a table, as long as we could leave before 8pm as they had reservations. I appreciated that they accommodated us despite their busy schedule.   The restaurant has a great ambiance and a bar in the center of the place. It was slightly loud but not an annoying level of noise. We went for two beers from the draft beer menu (a house brew and a locaL IPA). We shared a salad as a starter.   Our main courses were really outstanding. My friend had the seared scallops, and I had the amaro meatloaf. I didn't try the scallops myself, but the meatloaf was exquisite. The look if the dish is extremely appealing, to the extent that my friend HAD to try it (picture in the review). It's a delicious veal demi-glacé meatloaf that comes with roaster zucchini and smashed gold potatoes, and a tasty and rich mushroom cream. It was surprising that this was the cheapest priced item in the menu, at 20 dollars!  It was my third time in Citizen Public House, and it was consistently outstanding. I've been to this place in both, high season (winter/spring), and low season (summer), and it's always busy, so I really recommend making a reservation.
Great service and great food! They went above and beyond for our anniversary dinner. We enjoyed the ambiance as well as it was casual but relaxing. Definitely coming back during a future trip to AZ

Food done right with service that brings the menu to life.  The duck was  WTF good and the pig belly bacon was as rich as the decour.  If u like cocktails that mean something then the mixology at this place will make you happy, we will be going back!

What a pleasant surprise. Thought we'd try a new place. For starters the server was knowledgeable and friendly.......Sean (Shawn). Recommended superb beverages as well as dishes that paired with them.   Great value and great place to get porked!!!!

The food is delicious, the kitchen runs like a top, timing was perfect and the ambiance was wonderful.  Only thing that keeps this being 5 stars is that the damned waiter kept winking and flirting with my date.  I may go back, but only with my guy friends from here on out, lol.

In town from LA and chose this place based on online research and reviews. Had high expectations based on our readings, and were unfortunately disappointed. It wasn't bad, but just didn't meet the mark.   Pork belly pastrami appetizer - This was good, but the ratios were a bit off.   Rack of lamb - Lamb itself was cooked to the right temperature, a simple preparation. The flavoring of the dish was light and the sherry reduction a bit thin...Leading to a dish that was good, yet underwhelming.   Rib eye steak - Meat was over cooked and not to our liking, so this dish was sent back. (It was served with a Serrano mushroom compote, which was quite interesting and tasty.)  Mac n cheese - This was good, had some interesting sweetness to it. Would be a good dish to order for the table alongside entrees.   Pork cheeks - Good appetizer, flavors were an interesting, compliment.   While nothing was necessarily bad, the food wasn't good enough to return to this restaurant in the future. While we may be quite spoiled with the LA food options, this place was unmemorable and underwhelming.

Their original chopped salads is a MUST order! Best salad I've ever had!!! So much flavor and good for you!  Smoked salmon, couscous, arugula, Asiago cheese, currants, pepitas, dried super sweet corn, marinated tomatoes, buttermilk herb dressing!!!!  I also ordered the pan seared scallops that were cooked to perfection! One of the best meals I've had in Old Town!

The Chopped Salad is a must for a starter.  It features a unique blend of varying textures and flavors like crunchy freeze-dried corn kernels and black currants that add a hint of sweetness.  I also had the meatloaf which was very savory.  A reservation may be a good idea on the weekend.
Delicious food and attentive service. They accommodated my group of ten on a Friday evening. Will definitely return the next time I'm in Scottsdale.
The original chopped salad is the best thing I ate my entire trip to Scottsdale/best salad I've ever had! A must order!

Chopped salad, believe the hype :)  its very good.  I'm not vegetarian or a big salad eater but this salad is a great way to start your dinner, esp if shared.  Get the smoked salmon version okay.  What makes its special is the great mixture and variation in texture of the different ingredients.  And I am not a very selective palate eater and cannot usually detect any subtle differences, but this mixture of ingredients screams very soft, to soft to medium to medium hard to hard to crunchy.  Its very well balanced.  I had meatloaf and it was very good, the sauce they use to coat the meatloaf gravy is very good.  My friend had the scallops and it was cooked very well.  Just right, not over cooked and rubbery or undercooked and raw.  U may think its not a big deal but trust me, not a lot of restaurants can do it properly.  service here is top notch and everyone is very nice and polite.  the place is a little noisy and can get crowded which might make it a tad noisy to have conversation.  but its pretty good overall and I had a wonderful experience here.

Had one night in Scottsdale at the end of a Southwest trip, and chose Citizen Public House based on the wonderful Yelp reviews.   The earliest we could get a same day reservation was 8:45 PM, so we had drinks and appetizers elsewhere. Upon arriving 15 minutes early for our reservation, we were promptly seated. We enjoyed the cocktails. We shared the OMFG chopped salad, which was just as advertised! Such a unique mix of flavors and textures - I really enjoyed this dish. The server explained that this is a signature dish at all restaurants by the same owner, which was neat.   Because we already had appetizers beforehand, I opted for a second appetizer as my main course. The yellowfin crudo was absolutely delicious. Very fresh and crisp tasting. My husband really enjoyed the short ribs - the meat was melt-in-your-mouth.  Service was good. The server was definitely busy and apologized several times for our wait, which was fairly minimal. The bill was certainly high, but on par with what you would expect given quality of food and atmosphere. The one knock I would say was that the restaurant was somewhat dark and loud.  Would definitely recommend!

This restaurant /bar is in a nice location in old town Scottsdale . The food is always delicious and the servers are great and up beat. Our favorite is Sam he is very knowledgable in regards to the food and cocktails and gives great recommendations. It can be difficult to have a good conversation as it gets pretty loud towards later in the evening when the bar fills up. It's dim lighting , candles, and white table cloths gives it a nice feel. Enjoy
Been here on several occasions. The food is good, the drinks are tasty but expensive and the atmosphere is fun, but the acoustics are really bad. Not sure what there is to be done about that...

Great place!  I could give it five stars but I definitely have to go with a solid four due to a couple of minor things.  I took my boyfriend here for an early Valentine's Day dinner on Saturday night.  I found it on yelp as I just moved to Phoenix and had no idea where to take him other than the usual Flemings that he loves.  We started with a couple of the recommended drinks. I had the Manhattan, it was definitely good, not the best I have had though.  My bf had the Citi-Zen and it was FAB!  Probably one of the best drinks I have tasted.  We started out with the Chicken and Waffles.  Really good, Almond Butter and Honey was so different but super yummy.  The only complaint was that they gave you one square of Waffle to five pieces of chicken.  We would have been satisfied with two pieces of chicken and maybe just cut the price a little.  Which I wasn't unhappy with the price per se but it just seemed a little off portion size.  I had the scallops which were AMAZING and my bf had the meatloaf.  Which I tasted and it was was really good. I like meatloaf that actually tastes like meat instead of everything else they put into it and that for sure delivered.  We were both really happy with our entrees.  We also had the Black and Tan dessert, which was yummy. But for the life of me I do not understand why we cannot find a restaurant that does caramel pudding the right way. This was by far the best we have ever had out but it still had a grittiness to it.    The only drawback to the restaurant per se is the noise level in there. I felt like at times I was straining to hear my bf talk or I was yelling at him and we both are not old enough to be having those problems lol.      I would definitely recommend this place, maybe not for a romantic dinner but it is for sure one of the best restaurants I have been to in the area!   Thanks fellow yelpers!!

great food & drinks.  service was very attentive & helpful with food allergy concerns as well.  BACON popcorn!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had the sangria & my hubby had Lost in Translation.  both tasty.  Hubby had chicken & waffles, I had chopped salad & we split a lamb burger.  No dessert this time, but we'll be back!

Great Fresh Food in this white linen tablecloth restaurant.  Excellent Wine Selection.  And Wonderful Service!  Fresh food selection on the menu with many choices.  Definitely recommended.  Filet Migon superb!  We came early and were given a table that we quickly changed to a booth.  Servers very accommodating.

We came here for my birthday, and service was phenomenal.   I had the shrimp and grits and the chopped salad. My date had the scallops and everything was simply perfect.  Definitely make a reservation because this place was busy! But if you do get a chance, request a booth. It's fun to people watch. Will definitely be back!

I just moved here and a friend came to visit. I was looking for a fun place with good food.   Citizen Public House did not disappoint. The staff was friendly, accommodating, and gave excellent recomendations. The drinks were excellent. The chopped salad was a great start. The short rib was tender and flavorful. I have allergies, and when the desert had nuts that we didn't know about, the waiter ran off and got me a desert I could have. I can't wait to go back.  My only complaint was that I was so full I could not eat the whole next day.

We were completely confused when we walked in as we thought this would be an Irish pub i.e.: "Public House". We were immediately disappointed as we were looking forward to fish and chips. However, we drove pretty far to get there so decided to stay. It was pretty trendy and fancy with high prices and an odd menu. Our server Sean was Extremely helpful in guiding us and explained the name means 'a house the public of all types can come to'. Ok, but as we looked over the menu, it was odd foods. He explained that their chopped salad is a favorite and worth every bite.  My husband is not a salad guy but ordered it based on the server's advice. I ordered the ramen soup and we hoped. Both of these things were on the menu as appetizers. Food was odd and the salad looked small. However, take one bite and wow! Wow! Such bold flavors in the soup with a par-boiled egg, bacon, kimchee, and chopped thai chilies in a dark broth. Loved every spoonful and couldn't finish it. So spicy! The chopped salad was incredible! Smoked salmon, freeze-dried corn, currants, pumpkin seeds...all melded together so that every bite was amazing. It filled up my husband and that is not easy! LOL! We will go back but will be better dressed.  As an aside, one of the female servers near our table smelled sooo bad! She was blond, thin and looked like a hippie mess. She smelled like pachouli, BO and dirt and every time she came by our area, I had to hold my breath. YUCK!
Went for dinner with a friend, def a fan.

Classy,  casual with excellent , friendly service!!!  I had a Scottsdale blonde beer and my friend had a Gentlemen's Jack  . I splurged  ordered The bacon topped popcorn, it goes perfect with a ice cold beer! I will definitely be back for the Citizens social they serve 3-6 pm everyday.
Awesome crafted cocktails! Love this spot for happy hour. Great atmosphere and staff.

Excellent service! Fabulous food! Warm and modern ambiance!  The wait staff was cheerful and helpful, which made our dining experience very pleasurable.   On to the food . . .  the chopped salad is something to come back for with all the different textures of the ingredients and merried mixture of flavors. The porkbelly steak was outstanding and my partner loved the scallops. The star was the bread pudding (bacon pieces in every other bite was perfect) with homemade cinnamon ice cream.  I can't go back soon enough.  I miss you already bread pudding.
Really yummy from start to finish. Service rocked. I'm not one for long posts, so there ya go. Go, and go early... eat and enjoy.

Pricey, but worth it for a nice evening out! I'm from New England and hesitated when the server suggested scallops...in Arizona? But I'm so glad I went with his suggestion; they were prepared perfectly. Drinks were excellent, too.

We went for my wife's birthday with another couple. We had a great time. The service was excellent. The food was really good with a varying selection of different tastes that played on comfort food.  The atmosphere was really happening. Not very quite or romantic, but a good place to party with a group.

From the moment we walked in we were greeted with smiling faces. Once we sat down we meet our waiter. He truly was an amazing man. Gary was his name. He called us love and treated us like royalty! He helped us order since it was our first time. We had the most amazing cosmopolitan! For apps we had the pork and waffles and it was yummy. Dinner we had the chicken and it was to die for. The food was impressive and very fresh! But most of all, Gary was perfection! All you waiters out there should take note and follow his lead. Lots of love to Gary!!! We will be back!!!

I would like to apologize to the restaurant and all the customers for the profanities I yelled out after my first bite of that pork belly pastrami. I couldn't control myself. It was beyond ridiculous. That was probably one of the best pieces of meat I've eaten in a long time.  The rest of the meal was great as well. The field greens and the cheese plate were both delightful starters.  The crab cakes were a little bit on the smaller side, definitely the lowlight of the meal.  The lamb burger that my gf and I split was juicy, flavorful and well cooked. The fries were great. Thin flat slices of the potatoes, very different from the other fries I've had.  Service was great. Our waiter seemed friendly and honest.   Overall, it was a very nice meal in Scottsdale. 4 stars for the complete meal, but throwing an extra star on there for the pork belly, that was just awesome.
Amazing!!!! Citizens has a great atmosphere, great service & incredible food!!! Id eat there every day of the week if I could!!

My dad and I joined the crew at citizen on. Sunday, but that didn't dampen the vibe.  Great cocktails, meatloaf and short ribs were sure fire Sunday dinner winners.  Would have spent all night there !

Hands down, this is the best restaurant in downtown Scottsdale. During multiple visits in the past few weeks, we tried a variety of appetizers and main courses. Every dish was delicious and the service is always good. Our favorite is the scallop entree which was cooked to perfection and seasoned delicately. This is my favorite restaurant in the Phoenix area.

I love it here. It has a really unique name and I had the best time.  Went here on the first day of Restaurant week - and I had several dishes.  Started with the chop salad which had a very unique flavor, crunch and dried corn. It was interesting.  Moved into Halibut and dessert - all was awesome.  I sat at the bar and had an awesome time. The service was great and I will visit again.

This place was just 'eh' to me!  I was just whelmed, not over or under!  The service at the bar leaves little to be desired!  I am not sure what it is about Scottsdale restaurants thinking they have to be snobby to people.  We ordered drinks from an un-friendly bartender and then waited another 20 minutes to even be acknowledged again!    The food was ok!  The bf had the berrimundi which he liked but wasn't wild about the side it came with.  I had the meatloaf, which was good.  The gravy and mashed potatoes had a great creamy flavor.  My sister had the lamb burger with fries that were cold and not very tasteful.  There is not much on the wine list either.  I probably would not come back here because I dont think it was worth the hour wait for the crappy service at the bar.  I would rather venture down the road to Olive and Ivy.

Perhaps we just went on a bad night? Ordered the wrong things off of the Late Night menu?  I was SO excited to check this place out, especially after reading the many great reviews on the food and service here. I'm sad to report that our experience lacked the luster that I was so looking forward to. :(  Off of the Late Night menu we ordered the ribs, wings, and hummus & tzatziki. The ribs had nice texture, but there was no flavor to it at all! Same with the wings. It literally tasted like the wings had been sitting on the counter the whole day, and someone just threw a bunch of extra sauce on top of the wings before serving it to us. Not pleasant to eat at all.  The hummus & tzatziki, though? Very good.   What really disappointed me about this meal is that it seemed as though our server KNEW that the food was going to turn out pretty badly. He asked us if the food we ordered was enough for us, but never asked if we were enjoying the meal. When I proceeded to let him know that I thought the food was "okay" his response was...and I quote..."yeah, but is it ENOUGH?" I didn't think it was a very polite or appropriate response.  It also didn't help that he got our order wrong...twice. He even asked us to repeat our order three times, and he still brought out the wrong dish. Maybe he was trying to discreetly tell us that we didn't choose good dishes?  Regardless, I'm not going to go out of my way to try this place again. Perhaps if I'm in the area, I'll give the real menu (and not the Late Night menu) a go, but at this point, I'm not entirely sure it would be worth it.  If you do decide to try this place, hope your experience is better than mine!

We loved this restaurant!  Our waiter was extremely informative about every item on the menu.  We started with the fried oysters (he didn't recommend to us, we thought they sounded good) and it was the only thing that we did not care for.  Lots of breading and not a lot of flavor.  Next we had the pork belly appetizer which was delicious.  What a unique blend of flavors and even my husband (who is not a veggie lover) liked the brussel sprout slaw.  He had the short ribs and I couldn't stop asking him for another bite!   I had the salad, which was full of flavor and every bite was wonderful.  We bought a bag of pecan/bacon brittle and I wish we would of bought two!!!!!  Yum ... we will definitely come back to this restaurant when we visit!

Bacon-wrapped scallops with grits! Wow are they delicious as is the chopped salad. The scallop was tender and perfectly seared and the grits were heavenly and creamy.  Honestly I've never had a bad meal here, only downside is that it's a bit noisy. Highly recommend!

First of all, let's state the important stuff. Yes this place is pricey, and be prepared to sustain a heavy hit on your wallet if you're planning a dinner with your loved ones here. But the question is, is it worth it? Totally! We ordered a bunch of stuff here last night, including the burrata and crab cakes for starters, and the roasted chicken and scallops for the main courses. All of them were spectacular. For drinks we tried their house cocktails and were not disappointed either. However, the server's attitude could be better. If your customers are spending $200 on a meal, then they should deserve the humblest behavior, and suggestions/recommendations on every level. Not quite satisfied with the cocky attitude of the person serving our food though, but otherwise definitely a good return on investment!

Enjoyed this one.   The chopped salad is pushed pretty hard but well worth it. I stated it was very similar to Cowboy Ciao only to find the chef worked there for 14 years. Still, very yummy.   I ordered the osso buco.  Out of this world!  I was full, but wanted more. Going to go back to try more specials.   Server was terrific. Recommend reservations.

I decided to give this place a whirl yesterday on my lunch about 5pm from work  the space was nice open airy the staff from front of the house to The wait staff all were very friendly linens on the tables as well as linen napkins the only thing was the menu was a little lack luster the appetizer selection was fair. Hummus,tzatziki  , served w/flat bread ,selection of olives a couple of pork belly selections I had the lamb burger I ordered medium it was served a more rare but was still good the did offer some higher priced entrees and there were other selections of burgers and sandwiches thus the name gastro pub  they had some good beers on tap

Pretty solid, fun restaurant in the 5th Avenue plaza in Scottsdale.  My boyfriend and I were here for a weekend trip and I decided to pick up some to-go for us while he took a long nap. The staff is very accommodating and super friendly. This is a great place to go on a date night and the ambiance is cute - also, I do believe they're open late. Staff gave great recommendations and I ended up ordering the famous chopped salad and truffle grilled cheese along with some bread and olive oil on the side.  Overall thoughts - chopped salad was good (it has its own Facebook URL) but not amazing. Solid 4/5 stars. As for the truffle grilled cheese it was the same - good 4/5 stars but felt that a little more cheese would've made it even more melt in your mouth.  I'd definitely come back. Make reservations as it looks like this place gets busy fast.
Salad, chicken and waffels, and the lamb burger.  So good.

Food:  Good. We got the famous chopped salad for an appetizer to share, the pork chop and the scallops.  The 'famous' chopped salad was really quite good and a nice twist on a something of a staple.  Really liked the presentation before it was mixed... not as pretty after they mix it, but tasted great.  The pork chop was a bit dry and overcooked, but the portion was healthy and the sides were quite good.  The scallops were extremely well done, and the mix of flavors in this main was really good.  Serving size was on the smaller side.  Ambiance:  Really very nice. We arrived early for dinner and had the restaurant largely to ourselves until near the end.  Very nice furniture, setting, etc.  Good music (blues) that went well with their overall theme.
