The white walls are covered with a smattering of vintage photographs you'd have to squint to see-from a table not by a wall, the atmosphere isn't artsy, it just looks like bad decorating in someone's living room. I didn't really understand why butcher paper covered the white tablecloth-covered tables, since that sort of took whatever class the spot had and negated it. The seating wasn't comfy, and even though there was a patio, it was tiny and overlooked a parking lot.  There weren't many vegetarian menu options on the small American menu, so I opted for a Grilled Cheese ($12). My gut told me to leave off the Peruvian Sweety relish, a weird red mixture, but I kept it on because I figured it had to contribute to the sandwich somehow. I was wrong. It tasted gross, and I ended up scraping it all off and wishing remnants weren't still stuck to the sandwich. I got it with a non-noteworthy salad, and I've had much, much better artisan grilled cheeses that were less expensive and more filling.  My friend said she liked her chopped salad, the same one I've had at Cowboy Ciao (it's a creation of Citizen Public House chef/owner Bernie Kantak, who used to cook at Cowboy Ciao.) I also liked it there, but it's so tiny, I can't justify paying $12 for it-especially since I'd leave the meat off.  Like I said, the sangria failed to leave a big impression on me, other than that it wasn't strong. For $9 a glass, I expected something with a little more kick to it but was left disappointed.  I can't think of any reason I'd tell someone to go to Citizen Public House. If the atmosphere had been a little prettier or livelier, maybe it'd be a fun destination, but the company I had was the only thing that kept it from boring me.
Absolutely great food quality, presentation, atmosphere and service. So very impressed by this sparkling gem of a dining establishment

Another A+ meal from Citizen Public House! With the start of Yelp Eats week, I have a long list of restaurants I want to visit and tonight, Citizen Public House got checked off the list.   The Yelp Eats menu is a perfect combination of every food group. My friend and I with the Original Chopped Salad (a salad so popular, it even has its own Facebook page!), accompanied it with hummus, shared the pan seared scallops with corn grits and sweetened off the meal with the bread pudding and creme de pot! Yes, I did practically roll out of there, but very happily and extremely content!  The atmosphere at Citizen Public House continues to be chill and sophisticated. Tonight, it was bubbling with people but the tables are spread out enough that it allows each table to have their own conversation.   I am happily full right now, but I think I might try to sneak into Citizen Public House again in the near future again!
Can't say enough good about this place. The service is spectacular and the food is wonderful. Parking is difficult at peak times but there is a garage relatively closeby

It's not all that often I find a restaurant five-star worthy; four star, all the time. This restaurant fits the bill perfectly. From the location, to the fabulous wrap around bar, to the amazing food, only to be topped by impeccable service and the friendliest restaurant team I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing. Unfortunately, the restaurant patio was booked and we didn't get to sit outside as I had hoped, but the hostess was kind enough to give us a table just inside the folding doors so we can get our share of sunlight.  Gina and her team couldn't have been more delightful and accommodating.  Make it a point to try their Cobb salad.  The meatloaf was outstanding!  Who knew you could make popcorn and bacon work?   Thank you Lex for taking the time, and for the fantastic brittle.   Do not miss this gem if you're in the area or passing through. It won't disappoint.

Great vibe for a nice dinner or casual meet up. I'm giving 4 stars because the happy hour was a bit formal for my taste. The drinks and food were spot on and you will not be disappointed. The staff must get some great training - they all are very polite and super responsive. I had everything on the happy hour menu, their Negroni and 2 of their other drink specials that were very, very well mixed.

Overall the ambience is nice and is in a good location in Scottsdale. We had dinner her on a Friday night and were looking to celebrate a bday. We started with drinks and the flatbread. When I ordered the flatbread, I was expecting a flatbread pizza but thought the bread and hummus were good. We then the beet salad and the chopped salad. We ordered the chopped salad based on previous reviews but we found it to be bland. The beet salad, on the other hand, was great. The touch of honey was perfect! We next both had the scallop. The scallop was ok but the sides were amazing! The sides really make the dish. We had the cobbler dessert which was not great. The sauce was cooked into the fruit enough. The service, I thought, was not very basic and slow.   Bottom line...this place is good for happy hour but for dinner the food quality overall is mediocre besides the beet salad which was great!!   Pros Location  Ambience  Happy hour drinks and food options  Beet salad   Cons  Chopped salad was bland  Service was slow and not that friendly

Have you ever heard of a salad that is so popular that it has its own Facebook page? I know I couldn't believe it either, but this isn't any ordinary salad. Think tidy rows of smoked salmon, Israeli couscous, asiago cheese, arugula, sweet dried corn, black currants and pepitas (toasted pumpkin seeds) topped with a creamy pesto dressing all tossed table-side. The Stetson Chopped Salad should not only have its own fan page but its creator, Chef Bernie Kantak, should be given a hug every time you see him at his new Citizen Public House.   Located in what used to be the valleys original Trader Vic's, there isn't a tiki torch in sight. Instead you'll find a contemporary space outfitted with wood accents, leather booths and a stainless steel-topped bar. The vibe is casual and relaxed elevated by outstanding service on every one of my visits.   If you're wondering what a public house is, well simply put it's a tavern that also serves food. While they do serve some great drinks and have an excellent wine list, I'd be hard pressed to call Citizen a mere tavern. How many taverns have you ever heard of serving pork studded Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn ($5)? Or how about a pot filled with creamy 'Kilt Lifter' Fondue ($9) savory hunter's sausage, sweet tangy pears and toasted country bread? If you have, please let me know right away.  For dinner I couldn't recommend The Original Chopped Salad ($12) more but if you don't like smoked salmon, they can make it with chicken instead. The Mirliton Chopped Salad ($12), a composition including chayote, snow pea greens, tomatoes, popcorn, grilled halloumi cheese; cucumber-onion salad tossed with a tangy parsley-garlic dressing was a fantastic textural explosion but lives in the shadow of its older sibling.  I'm not even sure where to start with the entrees; I guess it comes down to price point. Take the lower priced lusciously juicy Lamb Burger ($12) topped with a cucumber salad, zesty tzatziki and served with fries, you'd think with flavor and quality like this would be much more expensive.   At the other end of the price range sit the fantastically meaty Fair Trade Coffee Charred Short Ribs ($28) complete with a side of brightly sour dried cherry bbq sauce and roasted parsnip puree. Somewhere in between is the juicy "Smart" Chicken ($18) which refers to the brand not the chicken's admission into the Mensa Society.   Desserts by Tracy Dempsey were all that and a bag of cookies, literally. Cookies and Milk ($6) were delightfully chewy and come served in a sealed pouch for freshness, of course the milk was ice cold just perfect for dunking. Three words, Strawberry Pound Cake ($9). A thick slice of strawberry olive oil pound cake is lightly grilled then served with vanilla malted ice cream, chocolate sauce and malted strawberry streusel and like the Stetson salad it was Facebook worthy.
Gary Gary Gary. Amazing service . The food is truly amazing very original tastes portions are perfect the price is reasonable. The service was outstanding. I highly recommend this place.

This was a fantastic culinary experience. I enjoyed the impressively creative pastrami appetizer and the artfully crafted meatloaf. Both were unique, adventurous and memorable. I will certainly be returning to try other culinary delights.

Great service, and while all of the food was very good, it wasn't life-changing like our waiter claimed ;-). We went as a group of about 10 and had a back room to ourselves. They make a great Manhattan with leather and tobacco infused bitters--ask them about their bitters program.

Most of all, kudos to our server, Greg, for his impressive knowledge about menu items and wine. The wine he helped us select was perfect.  Water glasses were refilled religiously.  Service with a smile all around from host to bartender to server to food runner.  I did not love my food. Which is why I'm giving 4, not 5 stars. There were actually a few of us at our table who were not in love with the food. For the premium prices charged, I expected something incredible.  The ambiance of the patio was awesome.

The Chopped Salad is a must! I should have just had it as an entree. Also had the burger, which was pretty good. And interesting take on a burger with some southwestern influence. The fries were some of the best I've ever had. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Perfect.  The only downside was the wine I ordered. When it came out the bottle had clearly gone bad because it tasted like vinegar. Our server basically said, yeah I'm not a big fan of that wine. And I was like cool, but the bottle is bad. If I'm ever in the Scottsdale area again, I'll definitely head back for the salad.

This place was AMAZING!  Went there for a work holiday party and it was great.  Gary our waiter made our choices even tougher as he expertly explained all the dishes.  You MUST get the smoked salmon chopped salad, it is worth all of the accolades it receives.  Also tried the pork belly pastrami and it was excellent.  Between us we covered all the main dishes and there was much being shared as everything was top notch.  Will be back again & again & again!!!

One of my favorite places to eat in Scottsdale.  Good food. Great bartenders who make near perfect cocktails, and a great high energy staff.  Try the chicken chopped salad.  Best you'll try. On a weekend, check out their speak easy upstairs.  Great little place to hang out and try some new craft cocktails

Went here to grab some dinner for one while my husband was at a conference. Greeted with really good service at the bar and they were nice enough to charge my phone while i ate, so that i could find my way back to our hotel...  I had a glass of Chardonnay and the Short Ribs. The short ribs were well cooked and seasoned and once you dip it in the bbq sauce it was just perfect. The portion size is small considering the price ($30). Thats even pricey by NYC standards.  Overall really good. The bartenders look like they know what theyre doing. They were shaking the drinks properly. I love when there are some ice chips in my drink!

Ended up here after trying to go to Citizen R+D.  We ended up sitting in the bar area on a high top. They offer a good selection of wine by the glass and had the Crush Cab, which was very good. Not sure if the bar menu is different than the main room menu, but the selections seemed rather limited.  We ended up going with the Lamb Burger and Original Chop salad. Both were very good. The wait staff was attentive and friendly,
What a great place. Came for my birthday and my waiter as well had the same birthday and treated me with so much energy and lots of celebration.  Will definitely come back

Great location and amazing food! Had my birthday here and would definitely go back! They had a sign made for the table it was so nice. Food was great quality!! The Mac and cheese appetizer is huge and delicious, definitely recommend!

I went to Gibson's in Chicago and never thought I'd find a steakhouse like that in Scottsdale... until I was introduced to Citizens.   One of my best friends + her boyfriend are steak snobs and only eat steak at this restaurant. It was their birthday celebrations and they, of course, wanted dinner here before the party. The staff was so accommodating. They let me bring cakes for both of their birthdays (see photos) and checked on our group consistently the entire night. The manager is great friends with the couple so he made sure everything and everyone was well taken care of.   The food was extraordinary. I ordered the short ribs the first time and the filet mignon during our second visit. The meat was very tender and full of seasoning (unlike most steakhouses). The short ribs come with this cherry BBQ sauce that is something I've never experienced before - but perfected the meal. Also, I'm kind of hooked on their house drink called The Citizen... but it is one sneaky ass drink! It takes like candy and you feel like you're just drinking juice... then after 15 minutes, you're drunk.  Be mindful of the price of this establishment prior to your arrival. It's worth the amount but it is on the pricey side. If that's not an issue for you... go here and enjoy!
Cool place, very good food. Prices are a bit high for what you get. Service is so-so.
Delicious Hefeveisen and the bartenders are so nice. I have not eaten here, only sit at the bar and get specialty drinks and apps. Its a very nice place, I like it alot.
Great service. Fresh food. We had the crab cakes, cauliflower curry soup, chicken, all excellent.

I was there back in November 2013. Professional mixologists, awesome drinks and up there as my top 3 dining experiences in my life. I had the short ribs with cherry bbq sauce. If it was socially acceptable I would take the cherry BBQ sauce as my beverage. Bartender was awesome.

Me and my husband like to go here any time we are in town from California. We have never been disappointed with a dish or drink. The chopped salad is amazing, the short rib w/ cherry bbq sauce is to die for and their desserts are typically super yummy too!
Outstanding meal and service. Cobb salad a unique twist with salmon and freeze dried corn. The pork shanks better than what we had in europe this year. Bravo!

There is good reason why this place is one of the highest reviewed in the area. The food was great but the service is what really sets them apart. We had a special request to alter the food to exclude wheat products for my husband and they really went above and beyond to make sure he didn't accidentally have any in his order. They were so good with our kiddos and made our meal very enjoyable.  The food: you must try the chopped salad.. it's very unique and delicious. The scallops were fantastic.. we subbed the grits for mashed potatoes and it was still great. The burrata was good.. we had to remove the pesto since it had breadcrumbs but I'm sure in its original form it would have been amazing. The kids had grilled cheese and buttered noodles which were a hit. The drinks are great! Honestly it's a must try in the area.
Bartender Michael is awesome! Good beer on draft, great food as well!! Love the chopped salad! It's unbelievable! Like the chopped salad at cowboy Caio! Yum! Mac & cheese add sausage!
Went in for drinks.  Nice place. Outdoor patio. Order the Beast Cocktail. We a nice strong pour. Did not order any food.

This restaurant is always fantastic. I have been here many times, and this week I went for restaurant week. The food and service were equally spectacular even during restaurant week. The monkfish was fantastic, perfectly done and served upon a lovely lobster bisque that did not overpower the delicate flavor of the fish.  Have a great wine list and a fantastic bar with great scotches. I have been to this restaurant many times, and it is a go-to for special occasions or when I want to have a nice meal. Consistent quality in food and service.

Gary was the best waiter I've had in years!!! So entertaining, funny, and really sold all the entrees to us. If you own a restaurant, you'd want all servers to be like him. I came one other time and my server was not entertaining or all that attentive.... Kind of dull.   The food here is great although their menu is a little small. Definitely a little too dark in some spots too.. I remember us sitting in almost total darkness. All in all it's a great date spot or good for happy hour after work.

For such a tough res to get during Spring Training, a bit under whelming. Just ok. I had the scallops, nothing special. Wife had the sword fish- overdone and too dry. She theorized it was due to the other couple in our group getting well done plates but I can only hope not. Nice atmosphere and service but won't likely go back.

The most interesting and delicious dish I've had in 2015 thus far is the Chia Seared Tuna. I can't even articulate what it tasted similar to or what it even was. All I can say is that the tuna was melt in your mouth delicious and had a crunchy exterior that I couldn't get enough of. Well done mr chef. Absolutely superb.   We also had the Pork Osso Buco and crab cakes. Both of which were great options and quite delightful.   Lastly, the ambiance is very dark and romantic. It's a great place for a date night or even dinner with family. It's not trendy, just pure classy. Great establishment.

Heard great things and was very excited to visit Citizen. Overall, I was glad it was not on my dime. I must have built the restaurant up in my mind. The entrance was quite nondescript and the interior the same. Dim lit, swanky vibe. Not bad but the only accents were old timey photos drilled into the wall through their frames. Hmm.  Service was good. A bit overbearing, but still very attentive.  My main beef is with the food and bev. I ordered the Protege cocktail. It tasted mostly of bitters with a hint of bourbon. We started with butternut squash gnocchi with pesto and bleu cheese. It was lukewarm and very dense. The pesto was nice, but there was not enough of it. My friends had salads for their entree (chopped and just the simple garden salad). They both loved them. I, on the other hand, went full force and ordered the short ribs. The parsnip puree and kale were nice. Not remarkable, but good. The short ribs, on the other hand, were very disappointing. They were at least 50% fat and seemingly "glued" to bone segments- for presentation's sake. The cherry glaze helped to cut the smoky flavor of the coffee-rubbed meat, but it couldn't disguise the fact that much of it was inedible.  I understand that kitchens do have off nights but, considering the price point, I will not return. I am more than willing to pay 30+ dollars for an entree, but you have to grab me on my first visit. Consistency is King.

Service was good. The server can really sell and explain the menu items if you are new.   Now, the food.   Started with the bone marrow and a serving of oysters.  Oysters are the size of your thumbnail. It's the smallest I have ever seen and its ridiculous that we were paying what was essentially just shells. It had a Tabasco sauce that may as well be straight Tabasco.   The bone marrow was nothing to write home about. Growing up, my family made pho often and the marrow from the beef bones for the broth were more flavorful and plentiful. It's not worth it.   Entrees were lamb and chopped salad.   Lamb was supposed to be med rare but came out exceedingly rare. Like straight red throughout. Admittedly the portion size was good but you do pay quite a bit for it. It comes with a small side of plain arugula and softened peanuts or something. The accompanying sides were not too enjoyable. It's very rich overall. I think it could have came with rice or potatoes or something. My date couldn't finish it. Too rare.   The chopped salad was what I got and it was very good. The pictures posted made it look bigger than it was but it is a salad so it's okay. I enjoyed it and would come back for that. It's a reasonable price too.   So all that plus a glass of wine came to over $80. Yikes! Just don't get too adventurous with the starters like we did.

Came here looking for some yummy food and we found it.   Tried their famous chopped salad, wow it was spectacular. Also tried their sea scallops man that was even more spectacular.   Totally recommend this place, we liked it a lot,  if we lived here we would totally come here often.

I walked in at 10:30 on a Friday and the bartender was so kind. Made me a mezcal drink (it was a long day - I didnt ask what it was). And it was perfect! I asked for spirit forward but refreshing and he delivered! I know there was also green chartreuse... if that helps.  I had the chopped salad. No idea it was so famous but two people commented on it... and I know why. It is like your slightly gourmet version of a cobb salad without the gross romaine, boiled egg and hard chicken. So nothing like a cobb salad, actually. All the ingredients paired well with the dressing and it was not overly robust. I was glad cous cous was on it so I could consume it as a meal.   While this is a nice restaurant, it is not at all pretentious. When traveling alone, atmosphere means everything. The bartenders were the best treat after a six hour day. It was so nice to enjoy good food and drinks past 10 pm and have it not be a stuffy environment! I feel like that is my bliss point and they met it.   Next time I make the trek out here from San Diego, I am coming back.  I wish I knew the bartenders names... one had a dark brown pony and beard (he ended the night) and was accommodating. He made the drink great, as well as the gentleman that initially served me. Both sweet, attractive and great bartenders. What more could you ask for, ya know ;)

I had a first date at CPH 2 months ago and had an amazing time. Great food and drinks as well as an attentive and professional staff and fun atmosphere.   Last night was our 2 month anniversary (insert your sarcasm here) and chose to revisit CPH. I made an online reservation and stated in the notes the info about our anniversary and if they could do something special. Who knew they actually read those things.   Although we had a reservation we had to wait 15 for a table to open up. The place was packed. No biggie. We saddled up to the bar for some drinks. My girlfriend wanted to start drinking bourbon. I asked if they had an obscure brand that was a mellow starting point as far as bourbons go and they did. Every 5 minutes a different host came up to us to let us know our status and that we would be seated shortly. And we were. The manager came over and wished us a happy anniversary. Much appreciated.   When we were seated the server brought us a little gift which was amazing and a great surprise.   The food was amazing and so was our server. The entire staff was friendly, attentive, gracious, funny and welcoming. On the way out I thanked the manager and let him know we'll be back each month to celebrate our first date there. What a great and unexpected experience. More restaurants should take a queue from CPH on how to treat customers. Thanks for making our special night yet another night to remember.

Definitely one of the better restaurants in the Phoenix area. The food and service were excellent. I made a reservation for a large group and they gave us our own little alcove to sit in and we had a server all to ourselves. His name was Sean and he did a fantastic job.  The drinks were wonderful. I had a Tin Cup and a Liberator Punch. The Punch was better than the Tin Cup but they were both really good. I enjoy sweeter drinks but my husband had Manhattan and said it was great.  For dinner, I had the steelhead trout. The pickled beet salad with it was very good and the fish was cooked perfectly. I'd love to find out what they seasoned the fish with because it was perfect. My husband had the meatloaf and let me try a bite and it was very tasty. My friend had the scallops and she let me try a bit of the grits and she's lucky I didn't snatch the plate away from her. I'm wondering if they'd just sell me some of those grits.  I also managed to mooch bites of the infamous Original Chopped Salad (which is really pretty before they toss it all together) and the short ribs. Both were excellent.  For dessert, my husband and I split a Pig in the Orchard which is bread pudding with apple and bacon. A most excellent combination. We also took home a bag of the Pecan Bacon Brittle which is as awesome as it sounds.  I definitely plan to go back and have my own plate of grits, um, scallops.
A little more pretentious than I expected from reading other reviews.  Good luck finding parking.  And if you want a table, get a reservation.

My fiancé and I were visiting the area and decided to try this restaurant. It was absolutely incredible. We had the scallops and short rib tacos. Scallops are by far the best we have ever had! We also had the fondue and heart of caramel dessert. Both were also incredible. The heart of caramel was a perfect combination of rich chocolate with refreshing white chocolate ice cream. The salted caramel splash on the plate just pulled it all together. The wait staff was so polite and friendly. Our water glasses were never empty and they spent time with us to recommend places in the city to check out. We will always remember this night!

Everytime I'm in Scottsdale, I make a trip to Citizen...sometimes; four trips!  Don't miss The Original Chopped Salad. This thing is unreal. I spent $50 on ingredients trying to re-create it at home, but there's only one Original.  The craft cocktails are quite good. I had a Manhattan with Tobacco & Leather bitters that was just phenomenal. I don't think it's on the current menu, so hopefully they'll still make it for you. Russel's Reserve Bourbon, Carpano Sweet Leaf Vermouth, Tobacco and Leather bitters, Maple syrup, toasted orange peel and Marasca  cherry. YUM.  For entrees: take a close look at the Meatloaf and the Short ribs. Both excellent!

Sat at the bar for a cocktail and late night snack. Had the Citi-Zen which was a drink with a stick of rock candy! Genius! Also had the pita plate which was a nice helping for about $8 and the beef skewers. Just ok, expensive and you don't get much. Nice atmosphere and service. Food took a while to come out which I found weird considering what we ordered. Overall, good experience. Not sure I will be back though.
been twice.  was great on both occasions.  nearby Cartel coffee is well worth a visit also.
Well worth finding a parking spot.  I have been for lunch and dinner both the same menu.  The food was excellent fresh and I was told local.

We really enjoyed our meal at Citizen Public House.  Our first move was to order drinks - my wife's sangria was particularly refreshing.   Our first bite was the optional bread service, served with a notably good olive oil. For starters we had the much acclaimed chopped salad. I typically don't address salads much in my reviews, but this salad was one of the highlights of the meal and our trip - it was awesome for a couple reasons. First, the flavors were great.  I didn't catch all the components, but the freeze-dried corn added crunch, and the protein came from smoked salmon. Second, the theater of the salad presentation and preparation was awesome. The server presented the salad with its ingredients nearly arranged in rows, and he added the awesome buttermilk dressing and tossed it at the table. The results were amazing. Our second starter was the Chia Seared Tuna, with purple sticky rice, asparagus purée, fried leaks and greens. The colors and presentation were great but the flavors were more muted. We liked it and it was fine but it was far overshadowed by the salad.   For entrees my wife had the scallops and I had the filet. The scallops were exceptional - perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned on a puddle of creamy and buttery grits. Loved them. The filet was fine but not really exceptional. I liked it a lot and the preparation was fine but it wasn't really all that memorable. I did like it though. I really wanted the scallops but decided not to order the same entree as my wife.   For dessert we had the brownie sundae, which was good but not exceptional. The brown butter ice cream was a little icy - not offensively so, but it didn't taste like it was made same-day. The brownies were ok too.  The bartender was particularly attentive (in a good way). My brother-in-law (to be) was interested in trying a couple varieties of Scotch and the bartender came to our table and delighted in detailing his thoughts and letting him taste several options.   One more comment on Citizen Public House is that it could really be anywhere - from the menu you wouldn't know you were in the Southwest - I didn't see even a single solitary chili pepper on the menu.  Recap: chopped salad, scallops and service were all high points. Great place. Thumbs up.

Let me begin by stating that I'm from Los Angeles, and was not looking forward to the food during my trip to AZ. I usually don't leave reviews after a single visit but given the scenario, I thought why not.  This place is very good. Even in the cut throat restaurant business in LA, this place would make the mark.  The food is all great. I tried the lamb sandwich, meat loaf and short ribs. The short ribs were outstanding, and for 30 bucks, it was also a steal. Very strong beef flavor. Meat loaf was also among the better meat loaf dishes i had ever tried. It's pretty hard to make meatloaf taste "not boring" but the dish here was solid. The lamb burger came with battered fries which were very good with the homemade ketchup which was like a marinara. I'm surprised battered fries aren't more popular. The appetizer was my favorite: the pork belly pastrami. Very rich, not for everyone but portioned appropriately.  Service is great, ambience is perfect not too loud, not too quiet. Not too bright, not too dark. Price point is fairly accurate.  What makes this a 5 star rather than a 4 star however are the mixed drinks. They are spectacular. I had a 'Manhattan' which was perfect. So good that it hit me hard without me noticing. The 'career ender' was also good.   It's hard to maintain 800 reviews and still have a 4.5 star overall but I certainly see why this place succeeded in doing so. Next time I'm in old town Scottsdale I'll stop by again for sure.

I've eaten here for special occasions and just as a night out. I always love it. The classic salad of course is great. It's the one they're known for. The chicken and meatloaf are great. The tacos as well. Nice craft cocktails. Basically they're great.

I've been to this place numerous times and every time I get something different it is an incredible delicious meal. They are changing the menu so I don't even know if what I ordered is still on there but all the food is absolutely excellent and the service is incredible. The place gets pretty hopping on the weekends and at night good atmosphere good people good food. Good time! A+

I came here once for lunch and was very pleased.  With all the great reviews on the chopped salad I new I had to try it.  It was the BEST chopped salad I've ever had!  It had the feel of an upscale pub, with upscale prices.  I would definitely come back for the salad.

The food is innovative and the drinks are interesting.  I like this place because I feel comfortable coming in dressed very casually or in a suit and getting great food.  The menu changes, but there are some items that have been there from the beginning.  The chef was big into bacon when he first opened up the place, but there are still hints of it like the bacon flavored popcorn.  I do miss the bacon in the bread pudding.   The place is really noisy.  Low ceilings with hard surfaces tend to reflect every word across the room.  Their sister restaurant The Gladly has a similar menu, but is much more quiet because of the high ceilings and carpeting.  The only problem is The Gladly is by the Biltmore Fashion Square and I live and work in Scottsdale.
Moscow Mules and the scallops were amazing, while their chopped salad was bigger and just as good as Cowboy Chio's.

My first time visiting this place and it was a great experience. We didn't have reservations, but the host was getting ready to seat 4 people to a table and that they would be freeing up 4 people from the bar, so BAM, we got seated at the bar in about 2 minutes. Branden was the bartender/waiter and was an absolute crack up. The food was fresh, drinks were great, and there is no reason not to go back.
Expensive, eclectic and something different. Try the  World's End and the $25 meatloaf if you want something different and don't mind paying for it.

Wow, Citizen Public House blew me away with the level of service, and quality of food and drink. I loved the ambiance in the restaurant, with the sleek and modern décor. I came here for a birthday dinner, with a party of 8, and our server was on point! He was super friendly, funny, and had an impressive memory. The Original Chopped Salad was absolutely to die for and even has it's own Facebook page! I'm not normally a huge fan of salads, but you have to order this if you come here. The ingredients include corn, arugula, couscous, tomatoes, garlic, basil, etc. Every bite is super flavorful and has a lot of texture. Everyone at the table ordered the same salad, and loved it.   For my cocktail, I enjoyed the Second Generation, which consisted of Absolut Pear, chareau aloe liquer, aperol, lemon, simple syrup, and cucumber and mint. This was light, refreshing, and delicious. Hats off to the bartender!  I loved this restaurant, and can't wait to come back to try out the other menu items.

Will have to give this place another shot.  To be fair, I think it's closer to a 3.5 star rating.  Came here with a group of friends for Yelp Eats.  It was a Saturday night and it was both crowded and loud.  The menu is familiar (think of Cowboy Ciao mixed with Kasimeriz's wine nibbles).  There is the famous chopped salad (which I actually like sans the smoked salmon), fondue, burgers etc.  They have a lot of interesting items like blue cheese mac and cheese, pickled vegetables and sausages you don't genearlly see on the menu.  As part of Yelp eats, a portion of the menu was half off.  You really can't complain about the prices.  What I do take a little issue to is the use of salt.  The restaurant uses salt like it is going out of style.  It might have been that night, but everything came very liberally salted.  Also, I love bacon.  However, it seems like 2/3rds of the menu has bacon in it.  To the point it is almost gimmicky.  Although to be fair I did like the bacon grease popcorn, I just thought slices of bacon in my bread pudding was taking it a little too far.  The drinks are delicious.  If I was rating the drinks along, I would have given the place a 4.5 The service still needs some work.  It is clear that on really busy nights, the wait will be long.  Make sure you have good friends with you to pass the time away.  I did have to send one item back that was so salty it was inedible.  I was a little sad to see that there was no explanation and it was not taken off the bill.  (A little disconcerning given the fact that we were a large group, consuming and generating a good sized tab).  Overall, good place.  Fun but I'm not sure this will be my regular hangout.  I still prefer places where you don't have to shout to hear your neighbor across the way from you.

Loved this spot from the moment we walked in: vibrant atmosphere, excellent service, and great food. 4.5 stars  Food: 4, Atmosphere: 5, Service: 5 Cost to worth it rating: 3 (barrel aged cocktails $12, entrees $26-34) Return worthiness: yes  Highlights: - Cocktail menu: extensive list and unique barrel aged ones. I went with one of the bourbons. It was potent and tasty. Paired well with the bacon popcorn  - Bacon popcorn: hub awarded this the best thing he ate during our time in Scottsdale. Pieces of bacon plus tossed in some bacon fat. Could get a bit greasy but flavor was great and surprisingly not too in your face. 4.5 stars - Salad: never heard of a more hyped salad--has its own Facebook page and all--but it was very good. Think why it stands out is the variety of textures: dried corn, pumpkin seeds, little date pieces, Israeli cous cous, and arugula leaves. Another standout flavor was the marinaded tomato pieces. Default was salmon but we went with chicken and enjoyed it. 4.5 stars  - Scallops: solid version with good sized scallops cooked well. Velvety layer of grits were delicious with it. 4 stars - Dessert: caramel filled mousse cake and chocolate biscotti with ice cream was decadent. 4 stars - Irish coffee: excellent version with just the right amount of froth, sweetness, and cream - Atmosphere: lively room with a square bar in the center of it all. - Staff: everyone was friendly, knowledgable, and on the ball - Gluten free options: so many of the menu items were noted as gf which was nice to see  Midlights: - Short ribs: bit dry for my taste. 3 stars  Lowlights:  - Didn't have room to try the sandwiches: they looked really good   Best dinner we had this trip and I'd come back for sure.

My wife and I decided to try places that we probably wouldn't try. Sometimes it's the drive or the menu wasn't desirable to us. However we're glad we tried Citizen Public. The food, service and atmosphere were perfect. We enjoyed the famous chopped salad, pork belly pastrami, and Swordfish. The Swordfish is supplied by Chula Fisheries. It is line caught and delicious. We would definitely return.   Tonight I had one of the worst dinners of my life at CPH. We are basically talking about the food from start to finish.  The Apps we had was the chunky Hummus. It was supposed to be creamy.   App 2 was the Pork Belly Pastrami. It was ok with a sloppy presentation. App 3 was the original Chopped Salad. Of course it's not original. It started many years ago at a restaurant on Stetson in Scottsdale named Steven. And the salad was called the Clearwater Chopped. Clearly a copy. And Stevens was much better with better quality ingredients. Dinner was awful. Swordfish tonight was overlooked and really salty. Airline chicken( was like it's name. It belongs on an airplane. A hunk of dried out breast with no flavor.  Service was fair but accommodating. Ugh!! On the rest.

I stumbled onto this place thanks to Yelp!  My friend and I were enjoying ourselves at a beer festival down the street - and decided that we needed better food than the hot dogs they were serving there at the Venue.  So we strolled in, they had just opened, and we basically had the entire place to ourselves.  Since it was happy hour, we basically ordered one of everything.  No, we weren't sober.  But, yes, we were loving every bite.  The service was equally impressive, and I can't wait to go back for a full meal!

There's nothing I wouldn't eat off this menu. Every bite of every course I've enjoyed here has always been perfect. Perfect in an okay  ready for heaven kind of way.   I do have to mention the deep sea crab cakes b/c they're the best crab cakes I've had in a while. Hands down.  I was there last night, and I'm still thinking about those crab cakes.   They put out high quality and wonderfully fresh food. Hats off to the chef.

Fun spot! We sat up at the bar (there was no seating in the dining room).  We ordered snacks and drinks.  The staff was friendly.  Seemed a bit like a touristy spot.  Drinks were good. We ordered the Charcuterie board and it was nice.

This was my second visit to this restaurant. And it did not disappoint.  Both my dining companion and I ordered the scallops and it would be an understatement to say that we were amply rewarded. The scallops were prepared JUST right. The tenderness was proof that the back of the house is in command.  Now that combined with attentive and courteous service, made it a very pleasurable experience.  Restaurants are a dime a dozen in the Old Town area. This I can tell you is a sure bet.  Thanks guys.  Will return.

Just had an amazing dinner here. The chopped salad was beautiful and delicious, had every component a salad should have. The service was impeccable, so attentive and informative. Brad was our waiter, not only good looking, but considerate of our palates. I highly recommend the crab cakes, one sniff made my mouth water and when that first bite hit my tongue...heaven!!! Thank you Citizen Public House for a fantastic dining experience. Will be back for more, most definitely.

I must preface this review by saying my expectations were very high for CPH. For no reason really, I hadn't heard any recommendations I just thought this place would be awesome.  Maybe it's all in the name, nevertheless I was disappointed. The food was above average probably deserving more them three stars but everything else was average at best. Well except the lighting, that seemed to be the perfect level of dim. The decor was bland, the walls seemed stark, random plastic house plants were the only decoration other then the poorly framed and hung black and whites. As you can probably already tell my disappointment lies almost totally in the ambiance. It just lacked that something cool that many other restrantuants in the Phoenix area these days have. But like I said the food was above average, i had the burger and it was good (the fries are exceptional). The service was very good and there are some good specialty drinks that were well made.  I would recommend at least 5 other places to try before this one especially given the price.
My new favorite spot to eat and drink! Excellent service and the food is phenomenal! I come here at least twice a week now and have tried almost everything. Highly recommended!

Indeed, this Citizen shall enter the House open to the Public!  I ordered the Connelly's Grilled Cheese with little expectations.  Wow! I was surprised with my first bite, savory ham, melted cheddar cheese, and the pickled cherry's to bring in that extra sweet kick.  The crusted toast was a most welcomed texture to my senses.  Well done good Citizen, well done!  We sat at the bar for some drinks (Czech Republic - Pilsner cool!) Service was excellent!  Decors, were really modern, but with a name like Citizen Public House, can't help but the think of the movie Citizen Kane.  "You still eating?": "I"m still hungry!" - Enjoy!
Good but not great food, drinks are 4 oz / $10 - tasty but disappointing, great atmosphere, trendy food, the chopped salad was good!!

Our group of 3 wandered in after 10pm looking for something to soak up the booze. Luckily, one of our 3 just happened to be the Duke, and boy were we treated well!  I ordered the pork belly appy - and it was everything I've ever wanted in a small bite. Pork belly pastrami. Rye spaetzle. Brussel sprout sauerkraut. Mustard jus. I will never look at a Rueben the same way ever again. This took something so comforting and elevated it. My mouth still waters just thinking about it.   Service was great! Definitely looking forward to my next meal here!

Been here twice and enjoyed it both times. Beware non pork lovers - there is a lot on the menu, or at least part of many dishes. The Burrata appetizer was delicious, I had the short ribs - they were the best I've ever had!

I love Citizen Public House. I always sit at the bar, try at least two or three of their cocktails and usually just have some appetizers. The staff, atmosphere, drinks, wine, it's all on point.   There's not much else to say. I just really like it here.
All the wonderful reviews are well deserved!  My mom and I loved the food, and the service was extraordinary ...Thanks Clark!
Excellent service and food.  Crabcakes and scallops were top-notch - expect small portions

I really struggled with what to rate CPH and contemplated over a few days......Yep, I care about my fellow yelpers that much. So as for my dining experience, it was very disappointing. I selected CPH not just for an early dinner, but to take my wife out for her birthday. Upon arrival, CPH was very quiet and only two other tables were occupied. With that said, you would think we would have been provided with a somewhat intimate birthday dinning experience...ummmmm, not so much.  We were taken over and plopped right next to the other two tables. The whole place was empty and we were placed there?!?! Really?! My only thought was staff were trying to save our waiter steps. Anyhow, we rolled with it.  For dinner, I noticed we caught happy hour and we decided to try their olives and cheese fondue that came with bread, sausage, and pear. The cheese fondue was good and the sausage was tasty. I was also pleasantly surprised how well the pear paired :) with the cheese. For dinner we decided to try out their signature original salad, the meatloaf, and the short rib. I forgot to mention our daughter came with, so don't be thinking we killed all the food alone. The salad was good, not five stars good in my opinion but good. Was glad my wife enjoyed it. The meatloaf was okay but not amazing. I really enjoyed the mashed potatoes that came with the dish. As for the short rib, it was awesome. I loved the sauce that came with the dish. Unfortunately, the parsnip puree that came with the dish was not good, but I would definitely recommend the dish and ask for mashed potatoes as the side. Just my thoughts.   Now as our dinner experience was coming to an end and aside from where we were seated the night was decent. The food was pretty good, not Top Chef kind of good, but fine. So for dessert, I assumed there would be some sort of acknowledgment of my wife's special day. When I scheduled our reservation, I informed staff of the reason for the visit. I also confirmed upon arrival that we were early for our birthday reservation. So as you can guess, she got nothing. No happy birthday, no little treat, nothing, nada.  Our waitress just quickly laid dessert menus in front of each of us and waited for our thoughts. At this point I am thinking maybe they will do up the dessert we choose and so after review of the menu we ask for the push pop dessert. So after a minute or two, out comes the push pop as plain as can be. No happy birthday, nothing. To top it off, the dessert was clearly not designed for three people. I take part of the blame as I thought the components of the dish would be functional for more than one mouth but at the same time, staff could have spoken up and offered their thoughts since they have seen the dish before. The icing on the cake for the cake she did not get was as we were getting up to leave, I noticed the table two over was provided with a little cake and candle. Good to see it does exist.  Anyhow, overall we left disappointed.  I expect a certain level of perfection when you are going to spend the cash CPH asks for. I have no issues paying the price, but just did not get what I was hoping for for my wife. I felt very sorry her night did not go as I planned. Bummer.
This place consistently has the best drinks, service and food. I am a regular and will continue to patronize this place. The chopped salad is pretty unique. The burger is usually my go-to.

Came for a late lunch/early dinner date with the husband. I had high expectations from all of the rave reviews. Ordered the Kiltlifter Fondue which comes with Asian pear, bread, and a wee bit of spicy sausage. It was good, but I kinda wanted a really cheesy fondue, and this one is more of a cheesy liquid sauce. Overall, pretty good but not rave-worthy.   We ordered the Lamb Burger and the Truffle Grilled Cheese. The lamb burger was... ok. It wasn't anything special or delectable. I've definitely had better lamb burger/sandwiches other places. The components were all there and decent, especially the bread, but the meat was just lacking. And the Kennebec fries? They were aight. Not crack as some other Yelpers have claimed.   The Grilled cheese was uber cheesy - probably the best thing we ordered. The mashed potatoes were an interesting addition and tasty... but I hate when my sandwich fillings spill out when you take a bite. It was really a great, tasty sandwich, but could have used a side of tomato soup to add a zing to it. The side salad was a great mix of cranberries, cashews, goat cheese, tomatoes and balsamic dressing.   Our waitress was wonderful and did a great job of keeping our glasses filled, BUT it took a loooooooong time to get our food, and we were one of 4 SMALL parties dining at that time. And I didn't feel that our orders were complicated. I dunno, but it was a really really long wait. And on a somewhat random side note, the bathrooms, while clean, smelled absolutely horrid. Like hold-your-breath-hurry-up-and-get-outta-here horrid.  Now.... would I come back? Yes, to try the pastrami and scallops that are so raved about, but I'm in no rush to do so. And I will also plan on using the loo elsewhere beforehand.

Having read these reviews i expected more. So very compelled to review myself.   Service excellent, atmosphere classy and chill, menu, same as atmosphere.   Gastronomically this place is classy, definitely aspires for that modern blend of fresh farm ingredients and high fat natural  elements like butter, cream bacon and cheese. TOO much bacon on this menu for sure, jews and muslims must not apply.   Food:  Pita and Hummus from Bar side of Menu: Oddly the best of the 7 things we had! I ate it up! the pita is too good, i think it's fresh baked, falls apart into s gooey bready goodness, the eggplant hummus amazing especially when combined with these little sour pickles that it's served with. YUM  Gaspacho- the tomato puree with slices of cucumber and radish was only ok, flavor profile definitely weak, resembled baby food to me and i LOVE good gaspacho, could have backed a little kick, even pepper would improve it, but the 2 shrimps that came inside it were cooked to painful perfection. Definitely executed well, the recipe itself is blah, won't have again.   Chopped salad- everyone raves about this salad, and it's good, but it's really not that good at all, it's own facebook page? ah sounds like a fad to me, the dry freezed corn in it is a let down, it's crunchy sure, but the seeds are enough crunch in there, but actual corn like grilled off the cob would have given this salad a gravitas it really needs, ground it, earthy it up, because it's  very light, it's got lox and seeds and etc so it's got various textures, but somehow nothing stands out so it's like a pleasant mush in your mouth, i think most of all it could be improved by a better dressing than the generic ranch it comes with, i might have had an entirely different impression of it if the dressing was lighter, sweeter, more acidic and again perhaps more peppery or spicy-sorry to say but this salad didn't stand out for me, and i live for salad  Watermelon salad- very different, never had anything like it, worth having just to try, beautiful on the eyes, but really is more of  cheese and watermelon plate, playing on the old and wonderful combo of fruit & cheese, take a bite of your watermelon with a bite of the cheese and maybe a salad leaf, it's tasty.   Scallops- Good normal well assembled dish....TOO MUCH BACON, must the gorgeous delicacy of a well prepped scallop always be obstructed by bacon? Over wrought, I feel like this trend ought to be retired, i get the appeal of surfy turfy plates, but scallops themselves are enough, i don't need them floating in bacon fat(not literally, they are served beautifully) surrounded by chunks of piggy, it's not that clever bringing the demise of these very contrary creatures onto the same playing field, we get it, none of gods creatures are safe when humans crack open their cookbooks, the novelty has long worn off for me, decadence is better served by letting one or the other shine, and not having them struggle on a plate for attention like two adopted siblings.   Grilled cheese sandwich - Sort of awesome if you are willing to take in about a weeks worth of fat and cholesterol, it's stuffed with mashed potatoes, you can taste the cream in them, truffle oil, caramelized onions and cheese, bread is soaked in butter cooked with egg, it's rich as hell, tastes really good, i could go with a little less rich and  little less butter, but i am not sure if the function of a good grilled cheese sandwich is not precisely to be rich, so i am torn. I think though i would have enjoyed it more if it wasn't such a heartattack cubed on a plate, came with a cute salad i enjoyed, and strange throw away veggies that looked better than they tasted.  Bread Pudding: We had to send it back, may be the worst i ever had, and that's rough but not an exaggeration. Hard dry old tasting coarse bread situation with icecream on top. Huge let down and not consistent with the quality of the food they served prior to it. i expect something of sublime quality even if not to my taste, but it was just a yucky afterthought.   Pros: other than the Bread Pudding food is quality, carefully assembled, thought out fresh and pretty. Everything is Cooked right. Service GREAT   Cons: Bread basket, stale and boring with surprisingly not good olive oil. no way to start a meal.  No coffee drinks other than espresso and no milk variations other than whole. a non fat latte would have really made my night.   Happy dining.

I was in town on business and came here off of a recommendation. Was not disappointed! I went with the filet mignon and it was perfect. Great ambiance, awesome food, and a knowledgeable bartender. What more could you ask for?

I had dinner here the other night and I was very happy with it. The chopped salad is the same as Cowboy Ciao's, and just as good. Later I learned that it's the same chef from Cowboy Ciao who brought over many or similar items. I ended up choosing the chicken as I had eaten a burger the night before. My girlfriend ordered the lamb burger and I was extremely jealous. My chicken was ok, it didn't blow me away, but the burger was amazing. The third in our group ordered the ribs and they were also fantastic. The meat just fell off the bone, was very tender, and had a lot of flavor. We'll definitely be coming back, and next time I'll get the burger.

Service was not very attentive. Bartenders were loud, numerous staff standing around chatting instead of checking on customers. Waitress did not offer bread or refill of beverages. Food was over cooked and when we informed our sever she made no effort to fix it. As we were leaving, 4 hostesses were at the stand and not one said a word such as; thank you or goodnight. Very disappointed as the prices were not cheap. Expected better quality overall.

Let me start my saying that we had fantastic service at Citizen Public House.   I was not impressed with the atmosphere. The famous Chopped Salad was probably one of, if not the best salads I have ever had.  My friend had the Seabass and it was not a thick filet like we are accustomed to, instead it was two very thin dry pieces with a strange tasting sauce.  I had the short ribs which were flavorful, but inconsistently cooked and the parsnip puree and greens again had a strange taste. At the price point, I would have expected more.

3.5. Mixed feelings about this place. We were really excited to dine here and I reserved for 5:30 since it was still Social Hour until 6 and we could take advantage of those deals in addition to our main meal.   We were seated promptly and the restaurant was pretty empty but it was early. It quickly filled up so that was a relief.   We ordered a featured rosé off the social hour menu and my husband ordered the Julep (barrel aged cocktail). My rosé was excellent and supposed to be $5.   We decided to go with the Charcuterie Board to start and it was a good choice. Great meat and cheese selection with an amazing apple butter and ground mustard and omg, the bread was so good!  Suddenly I was full so we didn't order another dish. However, my husband wanted another cocktail and we were hoping to take advantage of the social hour price but our waiter didn't come to our table from 5:50-6:06. He didn't offer my husband the price on the social hour and instead came back to the table after we ordered the drink at 6:06 to say it wasn't on happy hour anymore and were we ok with that.   I've been to plenty places and when the happy hour is about to end the waiter either comes to ask if we want anything else or they'll honor the price if they're late to ask.   Then our check came and my rosé was $10. No way. I got the waiter to correct it but come on...I shouldn't have had to point it out.   Sigh. Perhaps this is quite the spot and they don't care about lost revenue from visitors like me. Or maybe the waiter was mad bc we didn't order anymore food. I wasn't hungry anymore though and don't want to stuff my face just to get good service.

This place has been in business for 5 years now and not sure why it took me so long to try it.  The staff is friendly and helpful.    The menu offers many temptations and while I enjoy an entree I did not stick to the typical dining.   While they offer appetizers, salads, entrees and more they also offer a variety of small plates.  We ordered 6 different small plates.  Each were very tasty, especially the eggplant dish!  I look forward to dining again soon at this Old Town Scottsdale gem!

The service at Citizen was amazing! Our waiter, Brad was so personable and passionate, he made our experience SO wonderful! Very knowledgeable and so pleasant.  We went to Citizen last night. The highlight of the dinner was the chop salad- it is INCREDIBLE! The smoked salmon was delicious- soft, juicy, and so flavorful. The herb dressing- amaze! The most pleasant surprise was their signature roasted mix of pumpkin seeds, berries, etc. The salad is so good that we are going to go to the airport early just to get another :-)  I had the "Caesar" - a deconstructed Caesar salad. The meat was so moist and very flavorful. Brad explained this was because it was not brined, but soaked in a buttermilk mixture. Regardless, it was yummy. I was lost by the rest of the dish, though. The chicken sat on some Caesar dressing. With the amazing flavor of the chicken, I was confused why they chose to put it over dressing, leaving a grilled wedge of lettuce naked on the other side of the plate. There were two dollops of puréed vegetables. Very bland and cold- yuck.  My fiancé had the scallops. He said they were amazing and I kept eating the grits off of his plate- cheesey with some balsamic. Soooooo yummy!  Our friend had the short ribs- he said they were overcooked. Our other friend had the tacos and did not comment on them.  The service, the scallops, and the salad knocked this place out of the park! Unfortunately the others were just a little blah.

Sat at the bar last night and had the best time ever! Bartender took me through all the cocktails, helping me pick my first and second choices. Ordered the chop salad (yum) then the coffee-rubbed spare ribs. Holy moly, so good. Everyone there was so friendly and wonderful - even our busboy spent 5 minutes chatting with us about what we ordered. Seriously yum and such a good night!
I like this place, service is excellent and quality is great.. this is how should be in every restaurant in town. Good job.
I'm addicted to their chopped salad. I love to sit at the bar and have the bartender bring me his favorite wine. Cute place with consistent service, quality food and good wine. Get the salad!

I had an excellent dinner here the other night. The service was top notch- the hostess made sure we had a table with plenty of room for our baby's stroller and a few other waiters stopped by throughout the meal to say hi to the baby--everyone was super friendly! Our waiter was great- very on top of drink refills and gave us some great suggestions.  We split:  The Original Chopped Salad: A MUST when dining here. Unfortunately I'm allergic to salmon so had to have mine without that component but it was delicious. All the flavors are really unique- I've never had a salad quite like this. It was perfect to share with 3 people or have as your meal alone  Crab Cake appetizer: Great, fresh and tangy slaw  Pan Seared Scallop: Simple but tasty  Short Ribs: Rich, perfectly cooked  Heart of Caramel: very tasty- great end to a meal- pretty rich so it was perfect to share

Such a GREAT place!!! Food and service were fantastic! The rum punch was the best, Mac n cheese was wonderful... chopped salad was great... the scallops were truly PHENOMENAL!!! seriously my new favorite place!

The food and service here is amazing. So glad I was able to try this restaurant out during my short trip in Phoenix. This is a great place for couples and families. We did not have to wait for a seat on a Friday evening around 7pm for two people. I can imagine a long wait on Saturdays though.   We shared the pork belly pastrami, chopped salad, and meatloaf. It was way more than enough food for two people. My favorite dishes were the chopped salad and pork belly pastrami. I love the way the food was presented as well. I thought the meatloaf was just okay. I would probably pass on that next time.  The waiter was so nice and split our meatloaf into two separate plates for us because he knew we were sharing the entree! At first we thought he accidentally ordered 2 of the dishes, haha. Overall this is a great restaurant with amazing food and would recommend it to anyone!
Absolutely one of the best restaurants in old town.  The staff is friendly but not overly nice, which is a plus. The food is authentic, the people are genuine.

I picked this restaurant for an out-of-town dinner based on the Yelp reviews, and was very disappointed. I don't know if everyone else here just came on a better night with a different staff or what, but this was not the dining experience you all described. The food was just OK, not awesome or Earth-shattering. We had a variety of appetizer plates - mac n cheese, crab cakes, chicken & waffles - that were way overpriced and just average at best. We didn't get the pork belly because they wouldn't serve it without the sauerkraut - made from brussel sprouts!?! (seriously?) The server also raved about the drinks there and the "awesome mixologists" but the bar selection was tepid (no Sapphire, only Beefeater?) and they couldn't even make a mojito? I know that can be a  'specialty' drink in some areas but we saw plenty of them on other menus around Scottsdale. But the worst was the service and attitude of the staff; we were IGNORED all night. The server was affable and friendly but would disappear for long stretches of time. 20 minutes to get drinks, when the bar wasn't busy?? And our appetizers took almost twice that long to appear. He also forgot the bread, and didn't ask about another round of drinks until we were ready to leave! The place was a little busy but hardly packed (it was after 9pm), so we couldn't figure out what was going on.  It seemed like everyone working there was more concerned with enforcing the cool hipster vibe than actually doing any work. Except for the hostess - whose job apparently involved stomping through the restaurant periodically and angrily glaring at us like we were keeping her from something far more important. Seriously, we barely interacted with this woman (other than to ask for a table) and yet we were ducking the daggers shooting from her eyes all night. WTF was that all about? Look, any restaurant can have an off night; maybe they were short-handed in the kitchen or something. But to not acknowledge it all and generally avoid your patrons is not the tactic I would have run with.
Great food and service. We had the spicy burger and roasted chicken and it was very good. A good place for a date, friday night out, or even work happy hour.

Fancy pants meets working class watering hole.  I've visited this spot a few times via friend recommendation on the food.    Pork belly is amazing, shrimp pasta is surprisingly creamy and flavored with garlic and deliciousness.  Mussels are to die for!    What really got me about CPH is the gathering of every day people just wanting to enjoy a drink.  If you're in the service industry this bar will be a second home for you!  In spite of it's romantic feel, candle lit tables and linen tablecloths; you will feel right at home with the friendliest bartenders in Old Town.    Not pretentious but could be if it wanted to.

This weekend I took my girlfriend to Citizen Public House.  Before we were even done with our meal we were already discussing what we wanted to try on our next visit.  We started with two cocktails.  She had the Bellentini and I had the 1884 Manhattan.  I love Manhattans and this was one of the best that I have had--it was incredibly smooth and flavorful.  For our appetizer, we split the gorgonzola-emmental mac-n-cheese., and for our main courses we had the Grilled Cheese of the Day and the Fair Trade Coffee Charred Short Ribs.  Everything was incredible--including the service--and we wished we had room for an Irish Coffee and one of the many tempting desserts.

looking back, I think my expectations were a lot higher than the price and thought I was going to find a real gem.   The service was definitely good, but it was also very rushed. I sat at the bar and ordered the grilled peach salad and the hangar steak.   The peaches were tasteless and rock hard (although perfect grill marks) and although it was not over dressed, the vinegar just took over because there just wasn't enough flavors on the plate. Even the bacaon lardon crips were 'eh' and I love pork.   The hangar steak was so-so. But maybe this is my fault. Hangar steak is a great cut of meat if done right and personally, i think the only way to do Hangar is sous-vide that thing for a long slow bath. Otherwise, you don't break down the tough pars and the center is under cooked.   They slapped some asparagus on top, heaped a bunch of chipolini onions on the side and went light on the sauce.   There is good potential here and I probably ordered way wrong. I'll give it another try next time i'm in town but I was not overly impressed based on the many stellar reviews.

Probably the best porkchop I've ever had,  super flavorful (got it medium rare). Fondue is wonderful as well, also got the Four Seasons beer they had on tap and a Moscow Mule, which both complimented the meal well. A bit on the expensive side but well worth the price.

All around outstanding dining experience. Our waiter, Sam was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly. Nice open casual dining area. I've heard many good things about this place, and let me tell you, the ratings are true. Very attentive wait staff. Never an empty water cup. Price was good for portion size and quality. Lets talk about food now!  Had to take advantage of the great happy hour prices. Ordered the Kilt Lifter Fondue, which was served with sliced pears, sausage and bread chucks. Large portions & very tasty.    We split the chopped salad with smoked salmon. Incredible mix of flavors, every bit was a perfect mixture of awesomeness. This dish is a MUST TRY.  I ordered the crab cakes app as my main dish. They were very good, perfectly cooked with no weird fishy taste. You can tell they are made fresh, not from frozen. Very tasty.  BF got the meatloaf. It was recommended to us by our waiter. Glad we listened to him, it was fantastic. Great flavor, you can tell they use high quality meat. There was a perfect amount of sauce and nice portion of potatoes.   We sampled the bread pudding and chocolate brownie. Both very rich and decadent. We did not try any of the cocktails, but the selection was huge. Maybe next time. Can't wait to come back.
Always a lovely experience here. Staff is really nice and I'm crazy about the famous chopped salad. I could eat it everyday

If you like over priced food and tiny portions this is the place for you. Sure the ambience is nice. The staff is friendly. The service is fine. But I'm a gosh dang man and I need to fill my belly. I'm not a fan of a cocky Cheff in the kitchen drizzling his special sauces all over my plate just so it can look fancy and he can jip me on my portion size in the name of gourmet. Honestly the flavors don't blow my mind either. We paid $28 for a scallop "entree" that came with 3 scallops and some overly cooked spinach and of course Cheff drizzles. If you're a wine-o and get a bit tipsy before hand you should be fine. Call me uncultured, maybe I don't fit the Scottsdale mold, but I won't be returning. Tonight this citizen has been let down by the public house.

Citizen Public has some great reviews and they are justified.   My husband and I were seated in the smaller dining area inside.    It was  a nice  location out of the heat on the patio, and quieter than the big dining area.       We got there at the end of the Happy Hour and tried the Artichoke (soooo tender), and the Bone Marrow with Ricotta Pancakes (pancakes were great rolled around the marrow but there was very little marrow to share).   The Grilled Peach Salad sounded very good and it was different so we both ordered that.    We were disappointed and we provided feedback to our waiter.  The peaches were not ripe.  They were too hard and lacked flavor.   (More on this below).  For our main courses my husband had the Pan Seared Scallops (which he loved) and I had the Flat Iron Steak (very good!)   Partway through our meal our waiter showed up with  the chicken version of their famous chopped salad to make up for the disappointing peach salads.    I had told him earlier I wasn't fond of smoked salmon so he had one made with chicken instead.       OMG!  I could not stop eating it.   It was delicious and full of different tastes and textures.    We topped off the meal with the Heart of Caramel dessert.  We were already stuffed but couldn't pass up trying a dessert (good!).  We will be back.

My wife's company rented out the "upper room" area. We got to try multiple dishes.   The mac and cheese was bomb.   The chopped salad was amazing.   The chicken was flavorful, but nothing amazing.   The steak was ok, but had this disgusting mustard on it.   Our bartender was very nice and showed us a lot of cool tricks, and some secrets about this place ;)

It's no secret that this place is great.  Took my valentine here for dinner and it was beautiful.  The service was great, the food was delicious, and it made me look like a thoughtful boyfriend.  What more could a man want? I had the duck, which was cooked perfectly.

CPH is great for groups!  I admit it, (and I'm sorry, Chef Bernie), but I've only been to Citizen Public House on two occasions to date... That being said, both times I was there for events, and both times CPH did a great job.  My first visit was an event with passed appetizers and drinks shortly after they opened, and the other was for a happy hour / sit-down dinner for a group of 45 people, just last week.    Since it's more fresh in my mind, I'll go into more detail about the latter visit... We started on the patio and had drinks and some light apps including hummus and flatbread and their delicious bacon fat heirloom popcorn.  (They had vegetarian popcorn as well).  After about an hour, we moved inside to where there were three large rectangular tables set for our group with our own special menus.  We were able to choose from two mini-salads and four entrees and then we had family-style desserts.  I went with the infamous "original Chopped salad" to start and then chose the Pan Seared Scallops as my entree.  I think I cleaned both plates... and those around me likely had order envy as I definitely ordered right!  In addition, service was spectacular... somehow the Citizen staff managed to serve all 45 of us within minutes of each other!  They also kept our waters and our wine glasses full, which I'm sure added to the experience.  I recently saw a preview of the new fall menu which includes some interesting items such as Chicken & Waffles, Applewood Smoked Duck Breast, and Grits + Gumbo... I will have to head back over there soon to give these things a try... that is, if I feel adventurous enough to order something other than what I know I love (the original Chopped salad and the scallops).  Whether you stick with your old stand-by favorites or try something new, enjoy!
We had wine and the bacon fat heirloom popcorn. The bartender said it was like crack and he was right on the money! Great atmosphere and menu! Looking forward to my next visit and having dinner.

The cocktails are the absolute best in the city. Try the Aviation and the Citizen.  They keep all the best dishes on the menu while also adding other creative dishes. I hope they keep the pastrami pork belly for ever.  The service is always exceptional. Sit at the bar if you don't like to wait even a minute for another cocktail.  I have been there about thirty times, and I have never had a less than stellar experience.

Great service, great drinks be it wine, bourbon or tequila.  I sat at the bar during happy hour and had a few drinks then sat with a friend for dinner.  The bartender knew his drinks and made a perfect Manhattan.  When seated I ordered the pork chop which was cooked perfectly and glazed I think in bourbon sauce.  They have a great wine menu and the server knew her pairings.  I'm a die hard Cabernet drinker but she recommended an old vine Zinfandel that paired perfectly.  Every time I go I just like the hell out of this restaurant.  Damn good - get some!

I was in town for the Culinary Arts Festival and got a recommendation for this place for Friday night. The place looked cool and the server was very friendly. I started with the sangria and it was a good place to start. Between the three of us, we started with the flatbread, the original chopped, and the korean pear salad. All three were tasty and delicious. I loved the flavors of my salad the best, but the chopped had a lot of taste going on and the hummus was smooth and subtle (ie-not too heavy on the garlic). Great start to the meal indeed. For dinner, I ordered the halibut and my dinner partners-in-crime ordered the pork tenderloin and the short-ribs. Bites of all three confirmed tastiness once again. To round things out, dessert menus arrived.  We ordered the strawberry poundcake, the bread pudding, and the cookies and milk. And here is where they lost that fifth star. The cookies were terrible. Three of the four were hard as rocks. The spicy chocolate was the only one with flavor that was recognizable. The other three were kitchen experiments gone awry--and not awry in that "this is experimental and new so it must be good" kind of way. Awry in that spit this out and we know why they serve it with milk kind of way. If you are going to have an awesome restaurant and you want to be clever by offering cookies and milk, bake some good cookies. Or buy good cookies. If they can make bread pudding, they can make cookies (or take them completely off the menu).
Went for a Valentines dinner and was dazzled. Great food great service. 2 cocktails, one appetizer, 2 entrées, 2 glasses of wine, and dessert for $140. Very reasonable.

First time dining here - we went for restaurant week. Overall, it was ok. My expectations were really built up by these reviews, and in relation I was a bit underwhelmed. It's still a good restaurant, but I expected great, so that's influencing my rating here.  As for the deets... atmosphere was excellent and I'm glad to have a place like this in the area. We had mixed reviews on the food, however. The bacon popcorn was interesting and tasty. The chopped salad was amazing and I agree completely with other reviewers on that one. I would have liked that as an entree size and skipped my main plate. I got the pork sirloin, which was dried out and the flavors were trying too hard. Maybe it was exacerbated by the contrast between it and the salad before it, which was so lovely and subtle in how it came together. I was disappointed. I got my fiance to agree to split the entrees and had part of his Smart Chicken. It was certainly better - well cooked and juicy, with delicious crisp skin on top, but the flavors were overpoweringly earthy - the balance wasn't to my taste with too much mushroom (I love mushrooms but to be fair, these were one of the few kinds I don't like for this reason). As for dessert - I had the bacon apple bread pudding, and though I liked it, some of the bacon inside was too soft and put me off as far as texture. I also didn't like the strong smokiness left in my mouth in the end of the meal. I've had bacon in desserts before that did a better job balancing the sweetness with the meatness and this was just ok.

Best chopped salad ever ! It totally blew my mind away. I could eat this salad every day. Ordered lamb burger which was delish. The juiciest burger with an amazing sauce and pickled veggies which goes so well together. The ketchup for the fries was astoundingly good. Loved the service and ambience.

Made a reservation for MNO for 6 of us mamas.  When we arrived we had 2 people cancel and the hostess had no problems quickly rearranging the table set up for us.  We were quickly seated! Great start  We ordered some cocktails.  I had their mule, refreshing with a little zap from the alcohol!  Perfect  We started with some nibbles, the bacon popcorn and the chop salad to share at the table.  The chopped salad being their signature item did not disappoint! The bacon popcorn...who thinks of this stuff-totally delicious!   I proceeded to order the short rib which honest to God was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth! (Food!!! Get your head outta the gutter man!!! :P) I couldn't stop eating it and the next thing you know it was gone and I was licking the plate and my belly was full and I was in my happy place!   For dessert I don't remember what it was that we shared, but it was chocolatey and crunchy and creamy all at the same time - decadent and delicious!    I told my girlfriends that I can't wait to come back with the husband for a date night!      Bravo CPH...super crazy yumm!!!

Delicious food and lovely atmosphere: dim, candle lit, and the ambience of chatter. Substantial beverage selection and rich food options. Definitely an adults only restaurant, great for a date and nice for groups as well.

Came in from out of town for a weekend of Spring Training. A family member from the area recommended we try this place and the reviews on here are pretty overwhelmingly positive. We showed up at about 8:45 pm, put our name in and were told that it would be an hour wait. Normally, and hour wait for a popular place wouldn't have bothered me. Saturday night, Spring Training, etc... I get it. The only problem in this situation, was that the restaurant was half empty. I counted no less than 15 empty tables. So I pressed the host a bit and was told in a rather rude manner that the empty tables I saw all around me were reserved and that the best he could do is call us if something opens up. At this point I'm thinking to myself "Hm, the place is only open for another 3 hours and all those tables are reserved?! There was no line of people outside, no one waiting to sit down inside and a bunch of empty tables... I'm confused."  I definitely felt like he, for whatever reason, just didn't want us in there.
