Maybe it was that we were still decked out in our baseball gear from earlier, maybe because I didn't stroll in wearing a Rolex and offer him $200 for a table... in any case, I've never felt so sized up in my life. Kinda ironic that the name of the place is Citizen Public House... clearly they're not interested in serving an average everyday citizen.  Can't offer anything one way or another on the food because I never got a chance to try it. What I can say, is that I left that place very upset. Not a welcoming place, at least it wasn't last night.

We just landed and we were starving. Of course my husband says "I always wanted to try this place, well let's go."   We had to make a reservation so of course I made a Yelp reservations.   We arrived with an adorable hostess letting us pick our seat.    Citizens menu is similar to The Glady.  I had the scallops in a creamy grits sauce. It was delicious but the grits needed to be piping hot.  That's just me, I need steam coming out of my food.  LoL, but I really enjoyed it.   I would definitely try this place again.  Yummy!

I read the reviews on here so I decided to try this place. The original chopped salad was one of the best salads that I've had. It was very tasty with good texture. I also tried the pork belly pastrami which was also very tasty and moist. For the main entrees we had the seared scallops and the steak. Both were really good. To finish it off, we had the heart of caramel for dessert. I was impressed with the caramel however there's a lot of chocolate in the dessert which was a little too much for my palette. Overall it was a good experience and I will definitely be back. I'll likely just order and share the appetizers.
The chopped salad alone is worth going here. Service is ok- our waiter could have been friendlier but overall- the food was delicious so we would come back!

I was very impressed with this place and just about everything I got was very delicious. They have an interesting selection of cocktails and they are definitely worth trying.   The highlight of my meal was the chopped salad. My friends thought I was crazy for ordering a salad but I sure proved them wrong. One of the best salads I have had. It made me look at salads a whole different way.  Stay away from the chicken and waffles. I'm not sure if I just got a bad batch but it was way too salty.

My favorite thing about CPH is that it's consistent.  Consistently freaking delicious.  The service is outstanding, and when you combine that with their superior ingredients/menu options you have a triple threat.  It's modern, and pretty intimate - I'm a fan of the patio.  It's tucked away and I think a little hard to find, so keep your eyes peeled (and turn down the radio) when you're looking for it.   Must haves: fondue, bacon popcorn, pork belly pastrami.

Part of my Hubby's Valentine's surprise was bringing me here for dinner. It was perfect from start to finish! Our waiter was wonderful!! It was a set menu, I chose the chia tuna as my 1st and my Husband (JB) had the chop, both were amazing! I LOVED the chop!  JB loved the tuna! My second was the scallops, and it was up there as one of the best plates I have had. JB had the filet and it was good, but not amazing.  I noticed it had that same sauce as the meatloaf from when I was first here. I just don't think the taste is fitting to the dish.  Then dessert, the caramel sauce made the red velvet perfect and the flourless chocolate cake was so great! I think the texture made it the best!! Beyond rich! Soooo good! I look forward to another visit for sure! Maybe happy hour, I love a budget gourmet feast, the $170 tab for tonight was a little much, but very much worth it. It was the perfect way to end our romantic day!  Side note ... Thank you/sorry (what ever fits) to the fellow diners that had the deal with our loving affectionate way of dining... The feeding each other and kissing constantly is how we roll... :P  I love you SBM!! Thank you for an amazing Valentine's day!!!
Scrumdoddle. Great service and delicious food. We had the beet salad, mac and cheese, and pork belly pastrami starter (my favorite). The lamb (special) and beef tips were amazing

Saturday happy hour with deals on their barrel-aged cocktails? Sign me up! The bar team is super friendly, answering questions about unfamiliar ingredients in their drinks, and even letting us taste a few samples before deciding on what to order.   We tried three from the barrels- all were good, but the Bonded Boulevardier was my fave. The barrel aging really mellows out the Campari. B went with the Instant Gratification (cognac/scotch/amaro/grand marnier), also very good.   Grab a seat at the bar and watch the talented crew do what they do best- if you're lucky you'll even see them light something on fire. :-) Great place to start the evening.

All I can say this time is eh, we are here 6 months ago and was great, this time the food was just off. Sirloin tacos were over cooked and bland also really small for $17.00 also they were paired with frozen french fries which seemed off for this restaurant. Cocktails were good, staff was ok they didn't know what some of the sides were. Prices were premium as you would expect. I don't mind paying but I feel that I did not get my monies worth.
Excellent restaurant!  Our meal was wonderful!  Great atmosphere and service!!!  We had a really terrific time here and would highly recommend this place!

You'll come to CPH for the cocktails.....you'll stay for the food!  Citizen's Public House is my go-to destination for craft cocktails in the Valley. These guys mix all the standards exceedingly well, but take it to a new level with their barrel-aged concoctions. I often order a Sazerac (being a home-sick New Orleanian) and these guys make the best one you can find outside of New Orleans. The Happy Hour is a scorching hot deal, half price beer, wines and bar snacks (and they always have a great selection of all 3!).   The food is pretty amazing too....the pork belly pastrami is phenomenal. The chopped salad is iconic (has it's own facebook page?!) My favorite entrees are the scallops, Amaro meatloaf and Lamb Burger, but I've never had a bad dish here. Ever (and I work 2 blocks away and come here at least 1-2 times a month).
Great cocktails, service & food. The chopped salad & scallops were both amazing and the atmosphere was fun & upbeat. A must if in Scottsdale!

Legit the best chopped salad and maybe one of the best salads I've ever had all-time. The ingredients all compliment each other so well. The salad tasted so light and refreshing.  You get smokiness from the salmon, leafiness from the arugula, chewiness from the couscous, and crunch from the dried corn and currants. The dressing did not dominate the salad and allowed you to taste every flavor. It was simply a perfect salad.

Really love the decor and outdoor porch here. We walked there without a reservation and got lucky a table outside was available. It was also pretty late in the night. So my coworker and I sat under the stars warmed by the heat lamp and started ordering some wine and cocktails and started with their popular salad. Oh man.. it totally reminds me of a tea salad when the waitress explains all the parts and mix them together. The salad was just absolutely delicious and was a great starter. I then got the short ribs (rubbed with coffee), so I definitely couldn't resist that. The short ribs was so tender, I didn't need to use the knife they gave me. I wasn't a huge fan of the parsnip puree, but it was very smooth. My coworker's pork osso buco was also super tender and juicy. This place has a great vibe and great for hanging out with friends.
Very nice restaurant, our server Matt was friendly, genuine and knowledgeable.  The food was great, the mac and cheese was amazing (we try it at every restaurant we go to), cant wait to go back!

Great cocktail list. Great menu.  I had the smoked tequila cocktail - Mezcal.  The bar is nice and the ambience for dinner is beautiful.  They have an outside section that leads into the dining area thru an open air feel which makes it a great touch.   The service was outstanding and the restaurant is very well run with attention to detail.  We had the lamb and the scallops.  Both cooked perfect and beautifully plated.   It was a really nice date night and also perfect for a group

Really unimpressed with the service with the new manager. Was rude and refused to serve us. Brought our brother in law from the Czech Republic and he was jet lagged and tired but instead of a celebratory evening, we were refused service as they thought he had too much to drink. When we asked to speak with management, the manager told me to "do something" meaning to fight him. Really unprofessional and grossly overzealous. We have spent well over $2500 at this restaurant over the last year and a half and are heartbroken over the lack of professionalism after recommending CPH many times. Could not be more disappointed and will never return.

Very surprised and pleased with the food, service and ambiance. Our server, Gary, was very personable and attentive to our needs.  The chopped salad is as good as it gets. No need to say more except to make sure you ordered it. Excellent size for sharing with another.  The grilled ono was very good. Good piece of grilled ono on a bed of pecorino romano risotto cake, spicy arrabbiata, sauteed spinach, balsamic glaze. Highly recommended.

For just the food, I'd probably give citizen 4 stars. The food is great but very heavy. What bumps it up to five are the cocktails. I've tried several of the cocktails on the menu and all of them are amazing. The waitstaff and bar staff are also phenomenal. Great experience for dinner or to stop by the bar for drinks.
The chopped salad was delicious and really enjoyed the steak as well.  Different take on a steakhouse and lots of interesting dishes.

Fantastic dinner spot in the heart of Scottsdale!  The service was impeccable and the choices were very interesting.  The "famous" chopped salad was a must get.  It was prepared completely differently than I anticipated.  The smoked salmon (lox) in the salad was a tremendously tasty ingredient!  I loved the salad and would order it again in a heartbeat.  For dinner my wife and I got the Smart Chicken and the Wagyu Burger.  the Smart Chicken was rich and tasty.  Definitely a good call.  The burger had some very interesting flavor combinations that were all a good call.  The sliced carrots and pickled onions made a nice crunchy taste to the burger.  The Challah bun was a nice touch, but ended up being a little more dry that I would have desired.  To provide some honest feedback, I told our server that the food was great, but that the bun was a little dry.  She went and talked with the Chef and came back to tell us that they were really sorry that the bun was dry and that they wanted to comp our burger.  Wow, that was completely not necessary, but incredibly nice!  They said that they wanted to be sure we were completely satisfied with our experience and were sorry that it was not as perfect as they had planned.  This place was top notch on their presentation, service and quality!  I would go back in a heartbeat!  Many Thanks Citizen Public House!

The atmosphere is a little unique and I think either you love it or hate it.   The food and drinks however are creative and delicious! They have the original chopped salad which is a must order and I've never tried anything food or beverage I haven't enjoyed!   They also have a pretty cool restaurant week special when that rolls around too! Cheers!

I thought this place was unimpressive. I don't know if everyone else here just came on a better night with a different staff or what, but this was not the dining experience you all described.  But the worst was the service and attitude of the staff; we were ignored all night.   It took us a very long time to get seated despite it NOT being full and having a reservation. Not a big deal, but a party of 8 walked in ahead of me and was immediately seated. I guess CPH would make more money off of a larger party, so they were made a priority over someone who had the common sense to make a reservation.  The server was affable and friendly but would disappear for long stretches of time.  It seemed like everyone working there was more concerned with enforcing the cool hipster vibe than actually doing any work.  I was pretty excited to eat here because they had a great rating. However, my entree was a major disappointed and it took a major dent on my wallet. I will pay anything for good food. However, nothing makes me more angry than overpaying for a crappy entree. I ordered the short ribs based on a recommendation. They were extremely fatty, tough, and nearly burnt. Furthermore, the sides were also a disappointment. I don't think pureed parsnips are particularly expensive, but the portion I received was a joke. I was done with them within 2 bites. What a way to waste my time and money.

Busy, always busy. Great food, great cocktails, great service, always great in these regards. Perfect date place with a reservation. Bar seating is first come first serve, so try for that if you go on a whim. Ask about the specials too, always something cooking in the back there.

This place was phenomenal! I had the scallops and my boyfriend had the chicken- both were downright amazing. We also had cocktails that were unique and tasty. Our server, Nick, was attentive and made sure we were well taken care of. Overall, this was an amazing experience and I would highly recommend it for any date night, celebration, or anyone who is looking for an amazing meal.

For two people we ordered a lot of food (4 stars):   Chopped Salad is by far the most amazing and distinguished salad I have ever had. It comes with dried corn that acts like croutons of a typical salad, crunchiness, but unlike croutons, it adds a sweet flavor to the salad. Smoked salmon for the protein of the salad. There were also fresh chopped tomatoes, sun flower seeds, couscous, asiago, currants, and finally arugula as the main greens of the salad. Then it comes with an amazing sauce in which you have to mix into the salad.  Chicken and Waffles is a definite must try. The chicken is coated with a unique batter and topples over 2 pieces of waffle. There was too much butter on the waffles. This is kinda pricey for chicken and waffles, since in Los Angeles, there are places that service chicken and waffles at a cheaper rate but the flavors are unique enough for me to tell you to try it at least once from this restaurant.   Pork belly pastrami is overrated. I did not taste any unique flavors in this appetizer.   Lamb burger was too game for me. I usually eat lamb, but the lamb burger was too much for me. It was a decent burger but I would not get this entree again since it lacked flavoring.   Service (3 stars):   The waiter was very nice and we stroke up a couple of conversations with him. However, we noticed that other tables got bread and olive oil and we did not. In addition, we noticed that others that ordered the chopped salad, the waiter would help them mix the salad, we were not offer such service.   Ambiance (4 stars):   This restaurant is dimly lit, which sets a romantic atmosphere for those of love birds that want to only concentrate on each other. There is also a bar area that seems to be perfect for those are just got off work and want to have a good time with some co-workers.   Tips: Free parking is located in a lot around the corner of the restaurant. I would recommend making reservations since it can get packed during certain times i.e. dinner. We came around 630pm on a Thursday night and the restaurant was not full.

Won't go back.  Building was nice, clean. Wait was short. Waiter pushed his suggestions instead of listening to what we wanted.  Food seemed to be designed more on how exotic the ingredients sounded instead of how they might actually taste together. "shredded arugula with capers and a mango habenero mojo".   Stuff like that.

I tried to setup a 15 person dinner after dining at CPH several times. The customer service for group reservations is AWFUL. They could care about accomodating and do not get back to you right away. Decided to take my business elsewhere and wont be back soon.

Great decor. Great food and very good service. You have to try the pork belly pastrami. To die for! Their version of the Manhattan was very good. As for the main courses you can't go wrong with the scallops or the smoked duck. For dessert go with the black & tan pudding. Oh soooo good. Highly recommend this place.

This place is a legit 5 star place.  Lots of beautiful people.  I never realized the beautiful people of Arizona hang out in Scottsdale.  Chopped salad, pork belly pastrami, short ribs, scallops, dream jar, coffee, and the wife's sangria.  All well prepared, with quality ingredients, presented artfully and timely.  Frickn Scottsdale, had no idea, my boy TR3 would love this town, lotsa tall white people.

Another solid experience at Citizen Public House. How has it been four years since my last visit?  Of course, the signature Original Chopped Salad was a must and did not disappoint. It was even better than I remembered.  We then moved on to the fondue, which was also great. Who doesn't love cheese and bread?!?! And this was great cheese and great bread!  We had the scallops next, which, while small, were perfectly prepared and delicious.   The only disappointment was the deconstructed chicken pot pie. The chicken was amazing, but the rest of the dish was just OK. It wasn't bad, but I'd likely try something else next time.  We finished with the Heart of Caramel, which was a chocolate mousse cake, bourbon vanilla ice cream, a chocolate cookie and bourbon caramel sauce. Heaven.  Our server was great and helped us navigate the menu as we were putting together what we wanted to share. I had originally picked a cocktail, but expressed an interest in one of their barrel aged cocktails and he gave me a sip to try. Fantastic service all around and I was happy to come back and visit again!
Conn creek is an Amazing Cab to start off with. The pork belly appetizer is also phenomenal in taste and presentation. It definitely tided us over for our entrees.

It was Restaurant Week, so we save a few bucks.  The meatloaf was great, my wife had the scallops, and seemed to love them.  Drinks a bit pricey, but when your meal is about half what it should have been.....  Chopped Salad..yeah, its as good as everyone says...but get this, you can remove the salmon, and add a different meat.  If you ask.  Ask your server about R&D.

Wonderful dinner experience!  We had gone to a community event and looked for some good food, but nothing too heavy.  This place was great, not too busy with a somewhat quiet ambiance and great wait staff.  The fondue appetizer was a very tasty treat which we followed with the filet tacos and pork belly pastrami which we happily devoured.   Our only complaint was our food was not exactly hot, so left us wondering if we were the after thought for the night.  But still it tasted great and our service was awesome.

The service that we had here was one of the best dining experiences I've had in a long time. Our server was so attentive and the food was phenomenal. The Original Chopped Salad was truly insane, bringing so many textures and flavors to the bowl. It was debatably the best salad I've ever had. I will be back!

Everything's sexier with pork belly.  Expecially my belly when it's full of it.  Went here for a happy hour and was cursing myself for taking so damn long to visit the place.  The vibe is perfectly sexy and dimly lit - the kind of place where you can sip lethally addictive cocktails and order dishes that make you feel dirty for eating them, they're so good.  And then you order seconds and then dessert because you've been so bad already, you might as well go for broke.  The pork belly pastrami with brussel sprouts in whole grain mustard made me curse my ill fortune for not being able to eat it at every waking moment.  Unctuous, tender belly - get in my belly.   The heirloom tomato with burrata special was clean in presentation and a celebration of all that is glorious in the summertime, and the sausage and cheese plate was gobbled up so quickly I had to do a doubletake.  Dessert was heaven in an itty-bitty crock with the Black and Tan Pudding - a dark chocolate pot de creme with salted caramel pudding?  So I'm naming my firstborn Citizen Public House now?  Adore.
Liked it but meh is my overall response.  A bit loud and typical.  Food was fine...bill was, well, you knw the answer!

One word: amazing.  Was here for restaurant week, started with the Gazpacho, then had the Scallops, and finished it off with the bread pudding.   Great cocktails, amazing service, and outstanding food. They are awesome.

Great food, great service, great vibe. Amongst our group we had the rockfish, the buttermilk chicken, and the truffle grilled cheese - all were excellent. My chicken came with some perfectly prepared Brussel sprouts. Of particular note, however, is the chopped salad. This is unlike other chopped salads that you have ever had. It apparently has its own Facebook page. All that I know is that it is really, really good  CPH is in a great location. Our server was very knowledgable and engaging. The atmosphere is an attractive mix of hip and old school. I would definitely recommend Citizen Public House to anyone who finds themselves in Scottsdale

I used to go to Citizen Public House's bar and order the Sangria and go there just for the Sangria. I bet I funded the Sangria bank all on my own. When my husband and I went out last night,I was super disappointed to see they got rid of it so I ordered the Highlands Drifter and I was not disappointed. Not as awesome as the Sangria but it was tasty.  Our dinner and service was fantastic. I ordered the Chop Salad with smoked salmon which is consistently good and the Cauliflower Salad, as an appetizer. The Cauliflower Salad was a little bland in some (few) parts but overall very good. My husband said his "meat was perfect". One knock is their menu is a bit small, but man, they do NOT disappoint in their meat and veggies! So vegetarians and carnivores and pescatorians can all love each other and get along at Citizen! I love to end on a sweet note, you cannot go wrong with their Heart of Caramel dessert. If you're looking to trash your New Year's resolution to eat fewer sweets, do it. New Year's resolutions are an exercise in futility anyway.Wowza! My mouth is watering just yelping! One final point, our service has consistently been awesome. Our waiter was quick and when the kitchen was backed up due to a party of 30, he let us know they were running a little behind.  Four stars because they ditched my favorite drink but I will be back!

Fun place, great vibe. Service was close to impeccable. So why 3 stars? Our dinners were merely good, nothing to write home about, and you can do better for the same price or less at the Gladly (run by the same group) or Beckett's Table. I had the pork loin special, and it was pretty good. But for $28, it ought to be a lot better.

First time in PHX.  Friend recommended.  Friendly waitstaff.  They were understaffed and extremely busy, but we never knew.  The short ribs were tender, the duck breast was epic.  Waiter recommended splitting the Peanut Butter and Chocolate Cake among the party of 3- Bite of Cake with the PB dessert was insane.

We had just flown in from Dallas for the weekend and decided to give this place a try after seeing all of the great reviews on yelp. We were very excited and loved the ambiance from the moment we walked in -- unfortunately that was the only thing we loved, and their seasoned fries. We were a table of 5 and seated right away, which was nice. But from the moment we got to our table we did not get a great vibe from our waitress. She wasn't very eager to answer questions or even serve us at all. I always had an empty glass of water, even though our whole table was ordering cocktails. Food: Extremely subpar from what we were expecting. We had the "legendary chopped salad" -- and no one ate it. It just sat on the table, untouched, and our waitress didn't even take a moment to ask if our food was okay. I mean, she just took it off the table completely uneaten. Then we ordered the burger, which was only eaten because we were starving. There was another salad ordered that was pretty bland, and the filet mignon tacos were cold and a let down.  Giving this place 2 stars only because of the decor. I'm sure this place is great to grab a few drinks, but would not recommend it for a dinner out with family -- there are so many other great places to eat in this area instead.
We sat at the bar for happy hour food was amazing .... Service exceptional . A must try for your taste buds.
Love this place! They have amazing food and cocktails. It was my birthday dinner last night and it was great! The staff is always friendly and the food is perfection.

Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the cocktails are mediocre. They look great, but they aren't that delicious- but hey, if you're into that go for it.  Food was pretty good, albeit small portions. We had room for dessert and we were not disappointed.  Service was friendly.

I've had the pleasure of having drinks multiple times at Citizen Public House and each time it gets better and better.  The mixologist, Brandon, is one of the best up and coming cocktail makers around.    This past Saturday we finally indulged and enjoyed a meal at CPH and it was amazing.  The chopped salad really is the best in Arizona and the service and food was exceptional.  Highly recommended!

I went to this place for our anniversary dinner. Our server looks no joke like Stanley Tucci, and he was fantastic. His service truly elevated the whole experience to another level even though the food here speaks for itself. Price range is about average of what you see in the area and they have no problem splitting the meal if you want to. Try their salmon cobb salad it is delicious.

The ambiance is stylish and relaxed and the menu offers a manageable selection of American fare with a nice twist making them each inventive and unique. I figured we should try their prix fixe menu due to the special event week, but decided to delve into the regular menu for an additional starter. Their Grilled Octopus caught my eye, served with spicy watermelon gazpacho, chorico, fennel, fried capers and bacon fat brushed Noble bread. It was a stellar choice - stunning and delicious!  For their Restaurant Week selections our table opted to begin with their famous "Original Chopped Salad." This amazing salad even has it's own Facebook page! Trust me, I know..I looked it up! And they even give out the recipe on it. Well, it was absolutely scrumptious and you can bet, I'll be trying it out for myself. We also tried their Clam Chowder, done exceptionally well, creamy yet light, topped with herbed croutons and a drizzle of finishing oil.  For mains we selected:  Pan Seared Scallops with tender belly Hampshire bacon, roasted corn grits, wilted snow pea greens and cola gastrique. Seared Ling Cod with bok choy, red miso beurre blanc, pickled papaya and hazelnuts. Grilled Pork Loin with fava beans, baby shitake mushrooms, fennel puree, pickled mustard seeds and pork demi.  I did say inventive and unique! They were all super yummy and nicely adorned.  Dessert was included, although unnecessary as we were quite satiated with our meals. However, knowing that Tracy Dempsey was at the wheel creating their luscious sweets, we had to try one of each. The Black & Tan, a chocolate pot de créme with salted caramel pudding, whipped cream, roasted white chocolate streusel and browned butter shortbread. And the Bourbon Peach Bread Pudding served with vanilla ice cream. Are you salivating yet? They were seriously decadent, but kindly served in small portions with just enough to satisfy the four of us.  Our server, Greg was personable and friendly, knowledgeable and attentive ensuring we were well taken care of. Yes, this is going on my repeat list...I'm definitely going back for another taste. And since I was duly impressed, I plan to try Bernie Kantak's other restaurant in Phoenix, called The Gladly!
The coffee rubbed short rib here KICKS ASS. Great food, great little find in Scottsdale.

I was excited to finally try this place they have a lot of good reviews but honestly it wasn't that special. I see a lot of ppl rave about the scallops but i gotta say, not that impressed. mine were small did not have a great sear and were almost grayish in color...and 3 for $30?? the "omfg chopped salad" was tasty, but not exactly omfg level of tasty. I gave 2 stars for the good service and the beets starter was delicious, should have had 2 of those lol most likely would not eat here again :(

The tomfoolery has to stop.     Citizen Public House is just a bar in the guise of a restaurant.. And because it's Scottsdale, everything has a price tag  that hovers 30% above where it should be. Does anyone but me notice this problem?  If nothing else, the noise level at CPH is unacceptable. The reverberation of the diner's voices in the space is deafening. I was there on a Saturday night and I had to raise my voice just to have a conversation with one of my dining companions sitting right next to me.  The acoustics of the building are particularly bad and no one, especially the owner has done a thing to absorb the sounds by softening the surfaces. Does he even notice? My drink was tasty (The end of the world)  but not really worth $12 for five tablespoons of liquid. I get it though. Mixed drinks = high profit margin.  Our chopped salad was a tasty combo of ingredients. I did enjoy this salad.  I wasn't super hungry so instead of ordering another starter (our waiter said the tuna crudo was very small) I got the hippie dippie sandwich. What a disaster. The greasiest fries ever. The chunks of eggplant were only partially cooked. Too much mayonnaise - and why mayonnaise? In 'n out burger does better grilled onions and fries than CPH.  Such an unpleasant sandwich. Had it not been so busy, I might  have marched into the kitchen and demanded that the chef explain how this is acceptable, quality food in an expensive restaurant.    The young waiter was obviously overwhelmed and far too obsequious. The other diners had scallops which looked tasty but I couldn't hear their opinions due to the din in the dining space. $30 for three scallops? Some bars parading as restaurants will hopefully have enough reviews like this for them to sit up and take notice. A bigger menu is not better. I won't ever eat here again. But honestly the responsibility was mine to send back food that is poorly made. We as diners must demand more from restaurants.

The Dream Jar for dessert! Amazing. Rich. Not too much so I left feeling full, not sick-full.  All the food was great but we only got to sample the starters: Chopped Salad was my favorite, Chicken and Waffles a close second.  Service was ideal: friendly, attentive (and "invisible" for the most part).  My husband and I look forward to another Date Night here. Next time, we'll just order Entrees.

Omg! My daughter heard about this place and we decided to check it out on one of my trips to Phoenix. We shared the piggy and waffle, and the Cobb salad. It was enough food for the two of us would even know my stomach was portruding, I could have kept eating another round of both! Since then I've been trying to make chicken and pancakes so I could get that combination of syrup and meats! Can't wait to go back and see what they have on the menu next. And by the way, the Cobb salad was really unusual it had chopped smoked salmon pieces. It was fabulous!!

Food was good, not great. The chopped salad was the only thing I thought was great. The restaurant was extremely loud. The host/hostess didn't want to seat us at the table we wanted. The cocktails were tiny & mostly ICE for $12+. Hate restaurants that do that. Not very impressed.

Came in about 5pm, sat down right away. Brad, my waiter came over and introduced himself and asked me my name. I'd seen yelp reviews so told him they sounded good. Brad and the staff checked on me several times to make sure I was good even though the place was busy. AMAZING food and atmosphere. Highly recommended.  I'll be back for sure!!

Let's talk about a really good dining experience that was brought down by a HORRIBLE HOSTESS. We were in the area after some shopping at the mall close by and decided to check out this restaurant after doing some research on Yelp. We arrived around 8:15pm and requested a table for 3. The asian hostess, Stacey, snubbed us and told us that there was a 2 hour wait. We did not really have a problem with that since it was a Saturday night and the restaurant appeared busy. However, I decided to hop on Open Table to see if there were any reservations available. Low and behold, there was an 8:45, 9:00, 9:15... reservation for 3 available. We decided to reserve the 8:45pm reservation and hang out til our time was up....  We returned to the restaurant at 8:45pm and let the hostess know that we had a reservation. Again, SNUBBED BY STACEY and surprise, there was a table available for us! We were shocked at how she did not seem to care that she told us that there was a 2 hour wait when we were able to reserve a table for 30 minutes later...  Beyond the horrible waitress, I would rate this restaurant 4 stars.  Our waiter AJ was amazing. He should get 5+ stars He was friendly, had great recommendations and was very attentive to our needs. Everyone that served us was friendly and super attentive!  The food was 4 stars. We enjoyed the following items: - The Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn -- This was probably the most disappointing dish we had. There were hints of bacon fat but it needed some kind of kick like an herb to make it pop? - The Original Chopped Salad -- Apparently it has it's own Facebook page. It's definitely worth the hype! It's similar to a tea salad at a burmese restaurant in the way it is presented. - Buttermilk Chicken -- The chicken was juicy throughout. - Pork Osso Buco -- Fall off the bone good. - Pan Seared Scallops -- Recommended by our waiter and was delicious!   Overall, I would've rated this place 4 stars had it not been for our horrible hostess situation... so it's gets bumped down to 3 stars. To add insult to injury, I also want to add that I just received an email from Open Table stating that I "No Showed" for our reservation. I guess Stacey once again reiterated how much she didn't want us there...
The chopped salad was excellent. Well decorated but the noise was overwhelming.  We had to yell at each other to be heard and even that did not always Work.

After all the great reviews I thought this would be a fun place to take some friends for a night out. Over priced, not even average food. pretentious atmosphere and pretty cruddy service. HUGE disappointment which just leaves me wondering if people think just because a place is in Scottsdale it's good.   I honestly wanted to love it since I built the place up and was excited to try it out with my friends.    Good points.... the area, they have great location.

I would have to say this meal was a little above mediocre.  My hopes were high for this place and I do feel a bit let down.  I did like everything they served me, with the exception of the mashed parsnips.  It was very nice on the inside and a relaxing classy atmosphere.  When we arrived there were only 2 other tables of people seated in this large place.  They seated us all in a row, right on top of each other and we did not understand why they wouldn't seat us all in more of a private setting.  This really took away from the experience since we're were packed on top of each other when we all could have been seated in different areas.   We started off with the melted cheese dip, which was good. We dipped bread, pear and sausage into the dip. We also ordered the side of olives which was yummy, Just fresh green olives to share.  For the entrees we split the chopped salad, meatloaf and the short ribs. All were good and we enjoyed them.  So why the lower review? Compared to other meals at this cost, we weren't blown away.  I do take this into consideration when I rate places.  I do have to say that the chopped salad was bomb!  If I ever go back it will be for some happy hour appetizers and for that delicious chopped salad!   Lastly we ordered the push pop dessert. I did not care for the brownie nor do I like frozen bananas.  We did have great service though and I loved my mixed drink of the day.    It was a toss up for me on what to rate.. but after all this was a pretty pricey meal that just wasn't very memorable.

Hubby and I stopped in while visiting the area for Spring Training.  The beer selection wasn't as extensive as I had hoped a public house would be, but we found something we each enjoyed.  Our server was very helpful and gave us great suggestions...grilled cheese and short ribs...yum!  I so wanted to have dessert but we were stuffed and just couldn't do it.  We will definitely go back as there are other things on the menu that sound enticing and we really enjoyed what we ordered.

Probably the worst service I have ever had.  The bacon popcorn was good, but that was about it.  Took forever to get drinks, the orders were screwed up and the staff just came up with excuses why they could not bring out drinks within 20 minutes of ordering.  There are lots of choices in Old Town, don't go here.

So we ordered the pastrami pork belly. I love. Pastrami and i love pork belly- together at least for my pallet not so sure. The duck leg pure heaven with the burnt maple sauce. The dumplings rubbery and not sure why it was on the plate. I had the taco from the sandwich menu. Corn was just awesome perfectly seasoned. Tacos I expected the meat to be a little more moist a nice salsa would have worked better than the onion thing that came with it. All in all food was ok with some real standouts but the price... Not a great value.

Came here while visiting family in Scottsdale and our experience was superb. Everything we ordered was fantastic and the service was outstanding (I think our server's name was Clark, he was so dedicated and enthusiastic.) Clark even brought us a salad for us to try on the house which was also delightful. All six of us ordered different entrees and not one was displeased with their choice. I ordered the scallops, which were delicious, and went perfectly with the bottles of white wine. We all felt very welcome here and I certainly wouldn't mind stopping in on my next trip to Scottsdale.

After a long week in town for a business meeting we had decided to go out and have a nice sit down dinner at the end of the week (Friday night). After helping I found this place and I'm glad that I did. At the time we were there the crowd did seem to be mid aged but it was a very fancy yet laid back environment. The hostesses were kind and our waiter was very attentive and was always on top of things. I had the chicken meal and it was perfect!  The taste was great and the size portions wasnt small, as I would expect from a fancier sit Down! The drinks were also perfect!

This place is so lively with a large menu and delicious cocktails. The chopped salad is something that cannot be missed. Don't forget to take home so bacon peanut brittle to go.  I had the scallops my most recent trip there and they were cooked perfectly and had the best flavor.  I also had the pleasure of trying the meatloaf. I love meatloaf and have very high standards for it. They got it right!

Pork belly pastrami. Need I say more?  It is one of the best meats I've ever tasted. Then served as a deconstructed rueben. The cocktails are well thought out and served with a flourish. My  Manhatten with a flamed orange peel. We had several starters. All well executed and served either hot or cold. Just as intended. The desserts are the final touch. Pudding in a jar and chocolate chocolate brownie. The perfect anniversary dinner.

Service, cuisine, drinks and desert... 5 stars across the board. Chef, you've created a phenomenal menu and Gary, you made that first trip worthy of so many more. Thanks for taking the time to go through the entire menu making dinner and date night perfect!

Good food, but it can be a bit too pricey for the quantity of food, depending on what you order.  Waiter was too pushy on his wine recommendation.  Could be a bit less loud.  THE RABBIT NEEDS TO BE REDEVELOPED INTO A LARGER MAIN COURSE !  Over-all, a nice place, though!!

Excellent food, and I really do mean excellent.  The service was fantastic, and when the waiter described the meatloaf as "not your mother's meatloaf" I had to try it.  He also had stories and recommendations that would have made me order a plate of dirt, he was very convincing and passionate about the menu.  I also sampled the dishes that my other friends ordered (scallops, chicken) and those were excellent as well.  OK, so now that I got that out of the way, WHAT THE HELL IS WITH THE CORKAGE (OR LACK THEREOF) IN ARIZONA?!??!  We brought a bottle of wine, an expensive bottle, and as soon as we walked in they informed us that Arizona has only one or two restaurants that allow you to pay corkage and drink your own wine!  I thought Arizona was full of conservatives, and we all know conservatives love to drink so what's the deal?    We were disappointed, we wanted to drink our delicious wine, and since we were there for spring training and the night was young, we carried around an unopened bottle of wine all night and had to explain at every single bar we entered what it was all about and had to also promise not to open the bottle in the bar, as if we would waste such a great wine on just getting drunk!  Annoying. I will not deduct a star from this wonderful restaurant because of the wine situation, but I will tell you that I am giving the WHOLE STATE OF ARIZONA only one star for their stupid corkage regulations.

Oh man, I am SO glad I came here. I was have a rather shotty day (flew in from CA) and my friend told me I HAD to come here and get the OMFG salad. I sat alone at the bar and the bartender (guy with ponytail) was just great. I mean, great. He made a delicious drink - the margarita with infused popcorn or something and it was perfect. The salad - tossed in front of me was literally the best salad I've ever had, and the burrata cheese was heavenly. I had leftovers and the bartender sent me home with extra bread. Nailed the food. Nailed the drink. Nailed the service. Really awesome folks.
Most amazing restaurant in Scottsdale! Love the friendly and exceptional service, especially Gary!  Food is consistently fantastic and always on-point. Recommend to everyone. :)

We stumbled upon this place when looking for a restaurant for our anniversary dinner and I'm so glad we did. We were treated extra special by the wait staff- given complimentary champagne and bacon-pecan peanut brittle as a gift. The food was great- especially the OMFG salad. We got the filet and the meatloaf. We were especially impressed by our waiter's knowledge of the various cocktails and the fact that the bartender was able to make me a 'penicillin' which most places don't know how to make. Overall a great night! We would definitely come back!

CHOPPED SALAD. that is all you need to know. It is amazing, delicious, full of texture...beyond words. Service is almost always on point, and if they f*!$ up, they will apologize profusely. I've had the chopped salad, beet salad, pork belly, scallops/grits and they all tasted great! I've been here a few times, and I've never left disappointed. It's a perfect spot for a dinner date.

Dining here with a large group was a trip. Eating in groups larger than 8 can get interesting, but the peeps at CPH were on their "A" game from start to finish. Service was seamless and so was the food.  The Chopped Salad alone was a 5-star experience. WOW! It's been a long time since a salad has left me in a state of "awe." This is no exaggeration my friends. Israeli Cous Cous, roasted corn, tomato, pepitas, smoked salmon, arugula and currants with a wildly delicious buttermilk pesto dressing. This salad certainly does have it's own Facebook page, and I LIKED it! The salad is dressed and tossed table-side. It was love at first bite and I can't wait for my next visit to PHX to fall in love all over again.  Next, that bacon popcorn was delectable. Not really sure what makes popcorn "heirloom" popcorn, but that bacon fat and bacon lardons mixed in were perfection. This wasn't the first time I've eaten bacon popcorn, but it was the first time I didn't find it overly greasy.   U-10 scallops were my choice for dinner and they were seared to perfection. I'm not a fan of lot's of sauce and reductions on my seafood, so the dish was little on the rich side for my taste, but I think this would be winner in most people's books.   By the time dessert came around I wasn't quite sure I could take another bite of food I was so full! By this point I was entering my food coma and this part of the evening is pretty much a fuzzy.   I'll definitely be back to CPH. Food and service were excellent and they really made sure our group had a wonderful time.

I would rank the Original Chopped Salad as one of the best salads I've had. Although I don't like ordering salad at restaurants (meat for me!), I would order this in a heart beat. I don't even like salmon, and I loved this! I also got the Pork Belly Pastrami and also enjoyed this as well. I loved the brussel sprout sauerkrout on top, and the pork belly just melted in your mouth. Pork belly can come across as overly fatty, but this was so tender, and the flavor was incredible.  Both of these dishes amazed me- so I ordered another: the Ramen with pork belly in Chinese 5-spice, shiso leaves, bean sprouts, and soft marinated egg in a pork-based stock. I didn't think the ramen was on par as the chopped salad and the pastrami, but clearly, I'm Asian. I thought the ramen more had Chinese flavor than the traditional flavor, and it felt more like a bowl of Chinese noodle soup. However, the broth was pretty tasty, and the pork belly and egg were done well. Noodles were fresh.  ...I am so sad that I live so far from here...

If you haven't tried the signature salad you are missing out! It's the show of table side guacamole with lettuce.   The menu selections can come of as gamy; but they are so delicious.   Service was a little slow but worth it.

Not as easy to find as you might hope ... the front door is actually around the corner south of 5th Ave ... but well worth the confusion. Watermelon and cucumber salad was cool, refreshing, and an interesting presentation. Their barrel-aged cocktails will knock your socks off - almost literally - heavy on the alcohol, which I consider a plus in my drinks. Loved the coffee-rubbed short ribs. The accompanying cherry BBQ sauce was the perfect blend of sweet/tart, and wasn't thick or gummy as so many BBQ sauces can be. My only complaint about the short ribs was a personal preference issue on the side ... I HATED the pureed parsnips. Think of nasty mashed turnips, and then make them sweet .... BLECH!!! Thank heavens they didn't contaminate the ribs (lol). The waitress kindly brought me some mashed potatoes instead. Friends had the Cuban sandwich (pronounced both "tasty" and "huge"), and the chicken ("spicy and delish").  Friendly smiling staff, attentive but not hovering service, altogether a great experience. Word to the wise for anyone with hearing aids or other hearing issues - concrete floors mean the place is super loud.

The chopped salad is really as good as all the reviews say. It has a perfect balance of salty and sweet and has just enough crunch. I got the chicken with brussel sprouts as well, which was also delicious!

Been wanting to try this place for a bit now, and we were finally able to check it off the bookmark list.  We were greeted as soon as we walked in and sat (as requested) at a nice table outside. The decor and atmosphere was fun, eclectic, and welcoming.  Our server stopped over within a minute or two and took our drink orders. After a little deliberation and a few well answered questions from our server, I ordered the truffle grilled cheese and he has the lamb burger. The truffle grilled cheese was extremely tasty. The onions on it were cooked perfectly and the truffle flavor was distinguishable, but not overwhelming on the other flavors!  The side salad had some delicious berries and cheese topped with a light balsamic that made a winning combo.  Despite being relatively stuffed already, we just had to try the brownie dessert with caramel sauce.  The only things that could have made this delectable delight better - warm that baby up before topping it with the ice cream! It was however, devoured as it was, so obviously it wasn't a loss by any means.  Our server was friendly and wonderful from start to finish - he made (good) recommendations, checked in regularly, and made us laugh.  Overall: A When we are back in the area, this is definitely on our "do again" list!

We came here for my birthday dinner on a Saturday and had reservations for 8:30pm. We were visiting Scottsdale for the weekend from California.  When we arrived we were told to wait another 15 minutes for our table, but it wasn't a big deal. The restaurant is very loud, rowdy, crowded. It seemed like everybody was celebrating their birthday or bachelorette or something or another in here.   I opened up the menu and was surprised to see that it was actually Asian-fusion. When I had originally seen pictures on Yelp it looked like more of a gastropub/American restaurant. I had planned on getting the chopped salad because it looked so colorful and yummy in pictures, but couldn't resist the Duck Burger when the time came. My man ordered the Buttermilk Chicken. To share we ordered the Grilled Octopus as an appetizer.  The octopus was great but was soaked in a very strange spicy tomato sauce that was lukewarm. The whole thing kind of tasted like it was sitting on a bed of ketchup, honestly. I think mostly what threw me off was the temperature. In addition to small cuts of octopus, the dish came with hard cubes of grilled bread that were tough to chew.  My man's buttermilk chicken was delicious. It was very tender, moist, and flavorful.  My duck burger was just ok. The duck was honestly rubbery and not very flavorful.  Thumbs up for some risk-taking with the menu options, thumbs down for the quality and delivery.

I wasn't too excited to come here, since coming to Arizona I expected to be eating Mexican food. Now I'm sad this gastropub isn't on the East Coast. I forget the name of our waiter, but he was very friendly and extremely tall.   The food was delicious. Here's a rundown.  Appetizers: The Original Chopped Salad (corn, couscous, smoked salmon, asiago, pepitas, tomatoes, arugula, currants, buttermilk pesto dressing) - Despite all the raving reviews, I was really skeptical on how good a salad would be. Damn it was good. The textures were party-in-my mouth good. The buttermilk pesto dressing gave it a perfect tang. Do yourself a favor and order this above anything else. https://www.facebook.com/TheOriginalChoppedSalad/  Pork Belly Pastrami (rye spaetzle, Brussels sprout sauerkraut, mustard jus) - The pork belly was melt in your mouth, although some off-putting parts were all fat. The brussel sprouts were shaved leaves. I was confused by the rye spaetzle. Couldn't tell if it was meat or not, but overall the flavors of this dish are good.  Chia Seared Tuna (Thai purple sticky rice, asparagus puree, fried leek & micro green salad) - This dish was a bit bland overall. Both the puree and tuna had no flavor, but the purple rice provided a good contrast of texture. I love purple rice in general though.  Crispy Chicken Gizzards (pickled lemon, garlic yogurt, shiso)- The gizzards were dry, made a little bit better with the sauce. A little lackluster compared to the other appetizers.  Entrees: Tender Belly Pork Chop (dried apricot sorghum, shaved cantaloupe and asparagus salad with pink peppercorn vinaigrette) - This is on the pricey end, but definitely get this for entree. We ordered this medium and it turned out very juicy and well marinated. Good pork flavor. The quinoa provide nice contrast of texture and dried apricots provide extra sweetness.  Fair Trade Short Rib (coffee rub, dried cherry bbq sauce, roasted parsnip puree & seasonal veg) - I also recommend this for an entree, despite being pricey. So tender and the flavor was delicious. The bed of mashed turnips was a good combo. The tangy sauce is an explosion of flavor when it hits your tongue.  Yum Neau Wrap (grilled beef tenderloin, watercress, cucumber, mint, cilantro, yuzu vinaigrette, Thai eggplant & pickled cabbage slaw) - This was so overpoweringly salty. I could not taste anything it was wrapped with. The best part of this dish was the pickled vegetables, but overall I would not recommend ordering this.  Desserts: Pig in the Orchard (Apple bread pudding, bacon, brown butter ice cream) - This was recommended by our waiter as his favorite. Good recommendation by him, because this made dessert my favorite part of the night. The bread was so soft. Not sure I could taste the bacon This is a must get dessert  Cocoa Jar (chocolate coffee pudding, crispy rice crumble, whipped cream, cocoa cookies)- Not a big fan of cream, but everyone else in my family loved it. liked the cookie crumble on top and the cocoa cookies. There is a cookie/brownie at the bottom of the jar. Make sure you dig into the layers to get every layer in a bite to bring it all together.  Dim Lighting, fantastic food. Extremely popular so make a reservation if you can. I will definitely miss that Chopped Salad very much.

Just amazing! Visiting from out of town and went here for dinner with my husband during restaurant week.  We ordered from their special restaurant week menu and I had the most delicious scallops! Their barrel-aged cocktails are wonderful and the service is top-notch!

Citizen Public House is Fantastic! Every time I have dinner here, or just something at the bar, it is always consistent with wonderful & friendly service, great wine list, fabulous entrées & dessert! I've been a Scottsdale & PV resident for 24 years and have been to a lot of restaurants here in town! This is at the top of my Favorites!

SCOTTSDALE: Had the chance to stop in at the most popular restaurant in this sun-drenched millionaire metropolis and I was blown away.  Ambience and service (5 stars): The look is a little formal with white linens, candles and low lighting, but it is offset by very casual, approachable waitstaff and loud, jazzy, mid-century piano jam music.  FOOD:   Pork Belly Pastrami (5+ Stars/$13) Ahhhhmazing!  Order it: aromatic, flavorful in the extreme with a sweet pork/bacon taste  Scallops Atop Corn Gratin Purée (5 stars/$29): This was outstanding.  The smooth purée balanced the scallops wonderfully.  Lots of flavor, complexity and balance.  PB&B Pudding (4.5 stars/$10): This is delicious, smooth vanilla pudding, banana and caramel with peanut butter cookie spears.  I am already looking forward to being hungry again for my return!

Love the location first of all! and the customer service is great. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. The server I had was very consistent with service so that's a plus.  Their menu wasn't that great. Not much of a variety to choose from. Not only that, buut I think for the food they do have on the menu, it is just very pricey.  On the bright side the drinks were great really enjoyed the Thai Margarita and their macaroni and flat bread with hummus is delicious!  I ordered the meatloaf dish, I'd recommend that.
Everything was very good, especially the chopped salad, get the chopped salad! I had it weeks ago and I still think about it...The restaurant was beautiful and the service was nice.
Happy Hour...so far so good!  Love the vibe!

This is an awesome restaurant right in the heart of old town. I will start by saying the service was disappointing probably around 2 stars but the quality and creativity of the food and beverage is awesome and changed the experience. Server was rushing us through the meal, and my girlfriend had to push her for a description of the menu. She had a giggle that made us both a little uncomfortable. With all this said we heard other wait staff and they seemed awesome so I believe this is a one off. I had an amazing meat loaf dish and the chicken fried duck leg is amazing as well. Great spot to check out for date night

This place never ceases to amaze me.  The staff, service and food was incredible.    Let me mention the service- it was a Sunday evening and not too crowded, our group of 6, I have to admit we were a pain in the ass.......we DID have reservations, 1/3 of our party were running late (OK, it was me).....CPH not a problem.    Then when we finally all get there drinks at the bar chit chatting away...our table is ready.  We don't want to sit there, we want outside....CPH not a problem.    Ok, so it was another 20 minute wait, now we are getting kind of hungry, so we sit at our original table and order appetizers, but wait 2/3 of the party still want outside sitting!!!   CPH not a problem.  An outside table for 6 is finally available so they move us (Ahhh....2 tables over), we get our appetizers and lucky for us we still get to keep our fabulous server and FINALLY the group is content.   The food was fabulous!  I love going out with foodie friends because we all ordered something different from the menu.  We started with the original chopped salad and pork bellies and they were delicious!  Dinner, we basically order everything from the pan seared scallops, buttermilk chicken, meatloaf the fish and short ribs were all excellent!  Everything was absolutely delicious.    Back to the staff & service, I have to say were all fabulous and so accommodating.  Bravo!  I can't wait to bring new friends to experience this place ......and I promise we won't be PITA's.

It was our first time eating here and it was a wonderful culinary experience! My husband and I were celebrating our first year wedding anniversary and instead of the usual steak house, I wanted something unique. We originally made a reservation elsewhere but last minute changed our mind.  First of all, let me tell you about Gary, our server! He was phenomenal! Very at-tentative and engaging. He knew the family sitting next to us by name and by their food order. We ordered the ramen, hush puppies and mussels from the happy hour menu. All were delicious! We also ordered a main course each; I ordered the scallops and my husband ordered the pork loin. Everything was cooked to perfection. We would definitely return and make sure to ask to be seated in Gary's section again!

Great! Busy in a good way. A lot of pretty people, but the drinks and chow prove this place is legit. First, the barkeeps aren't hick town slingers. Enjoyed a Sazarac so smooth I should have bought it breakfast. Piggy & Waffle app made me wonder why the folks in the South stick with chicken... Damn! Roasted chicken and Brussels sprouts was not messing around, though the mantra "never eat anyone's meatloaf but your mothers's" was reinforced with a nice attempt, but not a home run. Dessert, drinks, wine, and service were all fantastic. Big recommend.
Superb in every way! Chopped salad is amazing and the grilled cheese is to die for. Service was great!

The chop salad from a restaurant nearby is considered best, but we were then informed that chef had moved to Citizen House and produced and equally fabulous version!  Delicious and one of the best in town!
The food was fantastic. The meatloaf is amazing. Interesting speciality cocktails and a great wine list. Prompt service. A great place for Happy hour!

Citizen has one of the best atmospheres in Old Town.  The servers are always friendly and engaging.  The drinks are strong, and the food is excellent.  The only downside is that reservations are needed a few days in advance.  The restaurant and bar are always packed.

This place was incredible! As an out of towner in Scottsdale for work, I depend on Yelp reviews to decide where to try. I was beyond pleased with the atmosphere and delish drinks. The chopped salad really deserves 5 stars on its on. Wow!

Can NOT say enough wonderful things about this place!! The staff, service, atmosphere & food!!! We had my daughters wedding dinner here (9/5/14)  and my son coordinated everything with Owen, the Manager & the Chefs Craig & Ben. Our party was an intimate 7 and from the moment we arrived we were treated with the highest of regard. Eric the Bartender started us off with the tastiest Sangrias, followed by several courses of appetizers (the chop salad was to die for!) and finished it off with their Porcini Filet Mignon - which was truly decadence!  We were full beyond measure and they packed us with to-go boxes for what we couldn't finish.  Absolutely every dish was beautifully presented and tantalizingly delicious!! I can not thank Owen, Craig, Ben, Eric and the staff of Citizen Public House enough for making such a monumental occasion so very special and personal.

I really wanted to love this place, but I just don't understand the hype. We were disappointed with our entrees (chicken and swordfish- both were blah and neither was hot), received inattentive service, and found conversation difficult because the dining room is LOUD. Like, really loud. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the OMFG salad was amazing. Nevertheless, I won't be back for it.

I think I'm in agreement with some of my fellow yelpers on this joint. I really like the ambiance of this place, but I was not too impressed with the food to be honest. We made reservations through Opentable which is a pretty cool and easy website where you can make reservations online and get confirmation. Anyhoo, we get there about 10 mins early and wait for our table, but things are running late. Luckily someone a table opened up fairly quick so it wasn't such a bad start afterall.   We ordered some drinks and I really am partial to the moscow mule. I like how they add cucumbers which gives it a refreshing taste. Also, they call it the Arizona mule here. (interesting). As for food, we got the pork belly pastrami (de-constructed sandwich without the bread), mozzarella (starts with V i forgot the name), scallops, and banana bread pudding. I think the best was the scallop dish which came with kale and was seasoned just right.   I would like to try other things to, so maybe it will change my mind about food.

AJ made my trip to Scottsdale worth it. Service and food come together to make a great dining experience here. We loved the attention to detail and flavor combinations. Best Braised Short Rib ever! Great craft cocktails too. We left happy. We'll be back.

I've visited Phoenix a few times on business and visited Citizen Public House the last two times (spaced a few months apart).  I had the same waiter both times ... and he remembered me the last time I went!  The chopped salad is indeed very amazing and I am tempted to order two of them the next time I go, in lieu of ordering an entree (I don't even remember what I ordered).

Good spot for dinner (definitely better than other places we'd seen in the area).   Definitely order the chopped salad! It really reminded me of tea leaf salads in Burmese restaurants. A ton of flavor and different textures - probably my favorite thing we ordered. We also got the duck burger (you can skip this - was a little burnt and not that flavorful) and the pork belly pastrami (alright, not as good as Id hoped)  Fun atmosphere though and delicious cocktails. In comparison to other places around there, this place definitely seemed to be the best option.

This place is amazing. I was in Scottsdale for a concert and we decided to come here because of the yelp hype and I couldn't believe how good the chopped salad was. I asked them to put the smoked salmon on the side and ate it as much as I wanted with the salad instead of having so much of it in the salad at once. It was the most amazing thing ever. We ordered a chopped salad to go when we left haha. I really liked the scallops I got, too. Can't wait to go back to Arizona just for this place.

Good food in a very hip atmosphere in Old Town Scottsdale area. Service was friendly and directed more towards the "dining" experience rather than quick service. In other words, we never felt rushed. The waitress as well as the several waiters whom helped us were all great. I had a "Julep" drink to start which was very strong, flavorful. We started with Burrata, which was quite tasty, just the right size for two to share, and the bread was excellent. My wife had the Pan Seared Scallops, which she enjoyed but could've used 1 or 2 more scallops (there were 3 total).  I had the Gypsy Pork Shank. It was tasty, smoky, but probably a little heavy and fatty for my taste. The desserts were excellent--wife had the Black & Tan and I had French Toast Bread Pudding, which to me was absolutely excellent. I docked one star just for the entrees--for the price paid, I felt there could've been a little better balance on food quantity, and I just wasn't 100% pleased with the shank. The environment was quite noisy--not really an intimate atmosphere, but I don't think that was the goal.

Came to cph on a friends recommendation, and right off the bat the menu seemed really familiar. I had just gone to Cowboy Ciao the weekend prior and it felt like deja vu. So much so that I had to ask if they were affiliated with one another- sure enough the chef for cph had worked at Cowboy Ciao for 15 years or something the waiter said. Ok. Got it. The thing about both of these restaurants is that the menu is very eclectic, interesting ingredients such as duck fat in the ice cream. Friends ordered the famous chop salad and loved it. Even this has dehydrated corn in it. This restaurant has beautiful decor, not stuffy but elegant. Not something I could see myself wanting to eat all the time. Very rich food. Just ok.

The short rib, skip. It's way too dry and basic for my taste buds. The crab cakes are also not that special here. But since I LOVE the chopped salad here, I get that Togo almost every week. It's also good with extra tomatoes upon request.

Amazing!  What an incredible first time to a place wonderfully run by an old friend!  Peg and I dropped in tonight (early enough so that we could savor the friendship of Bernie and Gina) and had an amazing meal.  Pork belly pastrami appetizer, the traditional chopped salad, and creative main courses of the scallops/grits and meatloaf/yukon gold potato. Of course, the pecan nut bars were an emphatic end to one of the best meals that we have had. It is so  nice to see gracious people excel at what they do, and this is one of the best ever.  We will return and bring friends!!   Love you guys!!

I love this place! It was a typical slow summer night with lots of open tables but we opted to sit at the bar. Then it happened... Found out they serve The Juicy Lucy! If you don't know what that is, it's likely because you're not from MN, and quite possibly have never visited. The bartender was just as excited as I was to have this available to order, I thought it was just a Minnesota thing. He confirmed it was, but the cook was from Minnesota. Ok now it all makes sense! Lol It tasted amazing, almost as good as the 5-8 club in my hometown! Thanks for bringing a little Minnesota happiness to the valley! Can't not say something about the amazing service and definitely felt the "Minnesota nice" vibe!

I love Houstons and Chelseas kitchen but I live near old town and I wanted a goto in old town. I think I found a contender. My first try I had meatloaf and Mac and cheese! Both good but not awesome. Nice service and atmosphere

The word "amazing" came up often in our description of food.  Choppped Salad, chicken & waffles, fondue. Ribs, meat loaf & duck. The atmosphere was great. The staff were friendly and courteous. It was quite obvious why this is a must go to restaurant.
That salad! It keeps me coming back over and over again. And they always have amazing desserts.

Our dinner wasn't perfect, and I can't wait to come back here again. I highly recommend CPH.  Went here with some out-of-town guests as a kick off to their visit. Some of the food was served cold, and the lamb was served undercooked from what was requested. We mentioned it to the server and requested the lamb to be cooked a little more, as he asked how our meals were. He went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with not only our food, but our experience at this restaurant. Everything was exquisite.   I've never felt more appreciated by a restaurant for our patronage. With all that was done I can't bring myself to give less than 4 stars, even for an imperfect meal. Hopefully on our next visit it will be a solid 5!

restaurant week menu not great. very small salad and three not very large scallops for main course. service barely mediocre. server never asked if we wanted coffee or  whatever for dessert. presented check without being asked for it. runners had no idea who got any of the courses. server never asked how the food was. had much better experience at previous visit.
Went for lunch with coworkers. We had quick and good service. I ordered the wild mushroom burger with truffle fries. Both were VERY good. It can be a bit pricy, but the flavor holds up.

Stark white, steel bar, dark wood beams....modern and chic. The chopped salad is wonderful...i've never seen anything like it.  It was rows of different ingredients and tossed together in front of me.  Apparently, it has been imitated by a lot of other places, which I saw later in my trip.  This version was the best though...smoked salmon, sunflower seeds, large couscous, sweet corn, arugula, tomato, and the creamy basil dressing is better than everyone else's...i'm guessing the ingredients may vary depending on what is fresh and available.  The bar staff was friendly and made me feel comfortable dining by myself.  The drinks are phenomenal...I got the Citi-zen, which came with rock candy that I can stir until my desired sweetness is infused in my pear ginger martini.  I had a great weekend visiting wonderful places while in Arizona, and this is one of them!

Nice restrooms.  I really should say up-front that I didn't eat anything here.  So why do they deserve 5 stars?  Because I want to give a HUGE shout out to my server (insert name here).  I had just come from eating apps at another restaurant up the street and when my dining companion got her scallops, well, let's just say my tummy wasn't all that happy with it's contents.  I was probably running to the restroom every 5 minutes or so.  Our server (forgive me, but I didn't catch the name during my sprints to the loo) was awesome.  She gave me several bitters and ginger in an attempt to calm my stomach and offered some other options I could pick up at the drugstore.  Unfortunately, nothing worked, but the fact that she gave a damn how I was feeling was cool in my book.  Oh, and the bitters and ginger were really tasty...too bad they didn't stay down for long.  Anyway, I can comfortably say these restrooms are nicely decorated...just wish I didn't have to spend all dinner there.
Reviews of chop salad were right. Very tasty and a light meal all it's own. Short ribs were excellent as well. Blueberry pie was very tasty too. I am a fan.

Went with friends who made reservations. They were friendly and service was good. Menu was limited. They had a tasting menu which was fine. The famous chopped salad was great! I had the smart chicken which was good. Dessert was not to my liking- a berry desert. This may have been a special for the tasting. Overall a solid restaurant but not my favorite.

Came here for dinner, make a reservation it gets packed, especially on the weekends. It's in the heart of old town, great location, big open windows with the bar in the middle, the ambience was great. Very noisy though, so don't think it's something intimate. You HAVE TO order the original chopped salad, the most amazing salad I've ever had. They put dried corn in the salad and it tastes like crouton but sweet, and the smoked salmon for protein, the flavors are amazing. The pork belly pastrami was good, but nothing special. It tastes just like any other pork belly dish but it was still cooked perfectly. The porcini fillet mignon was really delicious, the rub was very tasty and the steak was cooked perfectly to my liking. They have a great wine list and specialty cocktails. Great place to hang out with a small group and the people there are nice and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back.

I'm not sure what the hype is about. The good:  Great space (Atmosphere, crowd, ambiance, decor), great service. The okay:  Food was mediocre.  Seriously, everyone at the table was not impressed with their meal.  Bad night?   I appreciate chef's exploring, but do that on your own time.  The chef was trying to be creative, I get that.  But the flavors, textures and aromas - nothing harmonized. I literally had an upset stomach afterwards.  Anywhos, if you're looking for a kitschy place to take a date and not worrying about an impressive meal, this is your place.  Or if you just want cocktails, this is the place.

I have one (ok two) words: CHOPPED SALAD. Some people like to sub the smoked salmon for chicken, but I prefer the original (smoked salmon). It adds way more flavor.   The textures and flavors in this salad are unlike anything you've ever tried. The nuts and dried corn make it crunchy, the cous cous makes it soft, the the currents make it sweet and salmon make it salty, the creamy (but light) cilantro salad dressing is SO refreshing.  I order this to-go at least once a week. Order it unmixed, because it's fun (and more fresh) to mix it yourself. Even if you don't eat all of it, the salad is just as good 24 hours later (unlike a lot of salads).  If I had to eat one thing for the rest of my life... I could live off of this chopped salad. No joke. I've honestly never ordered anything but the chopped salad because it's SO good, so why would I?!

My favorite restaraunt in Scottsdale. The lamb burger, pastrami and chopped salad were delicious. Great selection of drinks but the real find is the bar upstairs. I'd suggest to go here for dinner and then drinks upstairs.   This is a great place for a date or to celebrate a special occasion with friends.

We decided to give it a try for our last dinner in Scottsdale before heading home after dropping our kids off at GCU. We had fondue and chopped salad to start. Both were very tasty. I almost ordered the salad again for dinner it was so delicious. Chose to have the meatloaf and the short ribs once again delicious flavors, a great ending to a super busy emotional week. We will be back when we return to visit the kids.

Where to start? Lex is the manager and really helped me out for Valentines night. He put my preordered roses on our table and brought over our bottle of wine that I preordered. Our waiter was very cool and knowledgable. Atmosphere was great and very clean. My steak was amazing! Couldn't have been better. My wife's chicken however was not the same. Her chicken breast was very dry. We didn't say anything because we were not looking to stir things up on a great night. The dessert was amazing and you have to try it no matter how full you are. That's on point. So for the price we paid, that was the sad part. I'm going to email Lex to let him know and I'm sure they will fix the problem.

This place was just amazing. Came here on a whim while traveling for work and was surprised by every bit of the meal. The atmosphere was classy, let laid back. The bar area was well organized and clean and the bartenders super friendly. They refilled my drinks promptly and suggested options through my entire meal.  I ended up with the pork belly pastrami which was just insanely good for too many reasons to write up. Simply put, just order it and experience it yourself.   I've always loved chicken & waffles and decided to pull the trigger here at Citizen. The chicken was super moist and the batter was pretty light so it didn't taste or feel overly heavy. The only gripe was the size of the waffle, which was a bit too small for my taste.  Lastly, the bread pudding made from doughnuts!?!!? You've got to be kidding me right?!! That just put me back a few weeks on my workouts by itself! That dish was just another one that you just have to order and experience on your own. So effin good!

I went to Citizen Public House for the first time for happy hour the other day and I must say, I was very impressed! They're staff is so very courteous and always attentive. Their happy hour specials are great too! I recommend the sangria :) We didn't have much of the food but we did try of the bar snacks was fantastic! I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an upscale, quaint place to have dinner and drinks. What a great hidden treasure in Scottsdale!

BACON LOVERS UNITE! Get your butts over to this place pronto! I found your heaven!!! My favorite bacon eater brought me here with a couple of friends without noting any sort of hidden agenda. When I saw the menu, I understood why we were here immediately...   Our server stepped up to the table and immediately started describing drinks and dishes to us without skipping a beat. He was educated about the food and it showed-- I appreciate that. He also made us giggle when he walked away from the table saying, "I'll get your drinks and oh, I'll grab your nuts!"  I must say, their nuts are candied and delicious. Just the way I like them.   So, my dearest friend was unafraid to try the artery-clogging dishes that he had lined up in his mind, and it started off with the "Tender Belly" bacon fat heirloom popcorn. Fact: It's pieces of bacon tossed in with some flavorless regular ol' popcorn. Does the bacon make it good? Sure. Is it something amazing? No, it's definitely a novelty and they are just having fun with it.   Next: We went for something healthy and highly recommended: The Mirliton Chopped Salad. As everyone has said, it's deeeeelicious. I wanted to marry it while I was on my salad high (I realized that marrying food just isn't sustainable...). Just so you know, it's not very big-- I recommend two people sharing it before your main dish.   Sandwiches: I got the Halloumi Sandwich. I love cheese, and I wasn't certain of what to expect with this dish, so I suppose I really had no expectations. The roll it came on was delicious, the chickpea puree was a great spread, I loved the tahini addition as well, but somehow I couldn't love the cheese. It just didn't have a texture that I am used to and it wasn't a strong enough flavor to balance it out. So...I "hmm" this dish. Not dislike, just..."hmm"...  My friend's dish: Another friend ordered the BLT and the other ordered the Pastrami. He ordered the Lamb Burger. This was described by the server as "gamey" in his initial description. I do not like that word. That sounds like the meat is going to have body odor, soooo I didn't order it! Fortunately for me, my friend did and it was a little overcooked for his liking, so we swapped dishes! HOORAY!!
