Be sure to order the house famous chopped salad.  My son had the meatloaf and he loved it.  My husband and I had the sandwich, it was alright.

One of the best of Old Town Scottsdale. Great service. Amazing drinks. Hubby loves the famous chopped salad. The burrata and bacon fat popcorn literally changed my life. The chicken is so juicy yet crispy on the outside. I have never been disappointed! Can be a long wait so take that into consideration.

FINALLY. Got the chance to try this chop salad so many people rave about...  We got the Spam Cuban, Chopped salad for a late lunch, the Instant Gratification and the Beast for our midday cocktails.  I like how they age their own alcohol in barrels next to the bar. Pretty neat and aesthetically pleasing. Hubs got the Instant Gratification which was a blend of bourbon and whiskey? or something like that... Anyways... it was an extremely smooth drink. I liked it a lot.   The Beast was a Tequila based drink which the server said, "is sorta like a margarita". Which in my humble opinion, was not the case. It was better than a margarita :) the citrus wasn't overwhelming and the balance between the mixes and the alcohol was perfect.  Onto the food... Spam Cuban was very good, great balance of the sweetness of the pineapple and Hawaiian bread with the mix of spam and pork. The home made dipping sauce for the fries (cuz Heinz wasn't good enough) was this chipotle sauce that had a slight kick to it, which provided a nice subtle touch to the fries.   My salad... oh my salad. I see why people rave about it. From the surface, it doesn't appear to be too complex but I'm sure even if I tried, I'd never be able recreate this salad at home. There is a certain level of umami going on in this dish. I'll have to go back several more times :)

Had a great evening here!! We ended up getting a couple starters to share - eggplant burrata, chopped salad and baked brown sugar gnocchi. They were all amazing but especially loved the burrata.   Drinks were great! Very fresh, didn't skimp on the alcohol and tasted fantastic.  Service was the best part! Our waiter was very attentive and many staff members checked on us to make sure our meal was perfect.   Thanks!

Visited this restaurant on a busy Monday night, it was packed and lively. We didn't have a reservation, and were told that it would be a 40 min wait, but we took a chance and hung out at the bar; we ended up seated at a table within 15 minutes. Our server Matt was very knowledgeable and friendly. We tried the delicious hand-chopped salad and the rosemary roasted nuts for starters, then enjoyed the short ribs and buttermilk chicken as our entrees. Matt was very patient with us, as we had a little trouble deciding on appetizers. We initially requested the pork belly pastrami, but changed our minds. Matt brought us the pastrami anyway and we tried it on the house - it was wonderful! The restaurant is a classy upscale place with soft lighting and hipster patrons; great environment but probably a little too loud for quiet conversation. We will definitely make time to come back here on our next trip Scottsdale!

The service was extremely attentive and helpful with suggestions. Our server was around just enough to ask how we were but not annoyingly around so often.   The restaurant itself is really nice. We came around 9:30-10 for a late dinner so I guess it explains why they were blasting the music for Saturday night but it was pretty hard to hold a conversation.   I got the Persian cocktail which was tasty but I prefer fruitier drinks so I'll probably order something different next time.  For my entree, I got the lamb burger which was pretty disappointing. It had a grainy consistency and wasn't seasoned well. I usually love lamb especially with tzaziki sauce but I could hardly taste any of that on my burger. The fries were excellent though. They give you a pretty large portion. The house ketchup is delicious but it's a little too sweet for my taste. I usually need a more tart or sour ketchup with my fries but this ketchup is pretty sweet and almost tastes like apple pie? My boyfriend got the meatloaf which was delicious. The mashed potatoes were were good with the gravy.

One of my favorite go to spots for cocktails and especially the chopped salad. Psst add the bacon ! It's always been a staple for me and my friends. Especially, if people are in town I always take them here for the experience. Service is always on point. I love that there quality and price meets the value.

Our knowledgable server made great suggestions and did a superb job describing elements of the menu. I ordered the Amaro(?) meatloaf and it was a giant portion! The loaf was simple but wonderfully seasoned and it was very juicy! The demi glacé tasted perfect and the mushroom cream was a delicious addition! The roasted zucchini was tasty and the Yukon mash was a great portion size and complemented the meatloaf nicely. I would've liked to have a roasted carrot for some crunch but this was undoubtedly the best meatloaf I have ever had. Scottsdale's food scene WINS so hard!

Keep on walking......  My friend and I each tried different dishes and shared.  He got nice roast and I got a hamburger.  The place is really nice....open, bright....  ..but the food is just a BIG disappointment.  A hamburger + 2 good beers was $37.   Expect to pay a lot for your food here.  Both dishes were poor.....  sorry, really wanted to like this one....

Great food.  Exceptional service.  Brought my 90 year old Dad there and they were very accommodating in every way and he really enjoyed the food although it was quite exotic compared to what he was used to.

Delightful. We went on a Thursday at happy hour. It was a special occasion, I was retiring from a 23 year career.  I opened Yelp to find a place near the ceremony.  CPH looked good to me.  I am vegetarian, they did not have any vegetarian entrees on the menu I found online, but I don't let that put me off.  As soon as walk in, you feel relaxed, and special.  The environment is elegant and not stuffy.  Our server, Paul, was genuine, professional, kind, sincere, and conscientious.  Happy hour drink prices are insanely reasonable.  It is evident immediately that we should relax and enjoy each others company and take in the experience.  I never felt forgotten, I felt nudged to savor my friends, my food, my drink.  We started with the hummus, the little cucumber salad was AMAZING! I told Paul I was a vegetarian and asked if there was anything we could do besides the salads.  He told me of a vegetarian entrée that was available yesterday and he asked the chef if it was still available. It was, it sounded delicious, so I tried it.  It was AMAZING, risotto, carrots, cauliflower, asparagus, parsnips.  The risotto was a teeny tiny bit overcooked but the flavor was awesome and the veggies were PERFECT!  And the portion was GENEROUS; Seriously, I took half of it home. It was $20.  My gf had the tacos, she loved them and the FRIES, she loved the fries.  My husband had the braised short ribs, he reports that they were very very good.  We all three shared the beet salad, it was so good I wanted to lick the plate.  The beets were cooked perfectly, the fancy lettuce was perfectly crunchy, the dressing was light and addicting.  Because it was a special occasion we ordered the black and tan dessert.  It was the best dessert I've ever had, I don't know what's in it other than chocolate and heaven, just try it!  But, share it, it's rich enough to satisfy four people.  We will definitely return.

Great service and drinks.  The Midwest Manhattan is outstanding. The food was delicious albeit a little salty. My husbands filet was generous and perfectly cooked. It was absolutely delicious. I had the scallops. Only three atop an extremely rich buttery creamed corn base.  The chopped salad is good but there's not much lettuce to it. Just goodies  - like a lot of currents.  I sampled our friends spare rib- very good and tender.

This place has a super cool vibe.  Definitely worth taking your significant other or family out to a nice dinner.  We went during new years eve 2017 and the place was super packed but my fiancé and I were able to find a seat at the bar.  The bartender was awesome and a true mixologist.  It was nice to sit at a bar where they don't serve you the traditional "club" style drink but offer you some nice options of gin, barrel aged whiskey, and bourbon to sip and talk through the night.  Using ingredients such as bitters and vermouth in their arsenal along with house made sweeteners like popcorn syrup makes their drinks that much more special.  My only gripe with the whole experience was that they ran out of filet mignon.  Not sure if they ran out or if they were saving it for the everyone else in the dining room who had the "new years eve set menu".  I was told I could get anything a la carte at the bar but that was one item they didn't have.    I settled for the meat loaf and my fiancé had the shellfish soup.  Both were delightful (sorry for the awful pics as this place is very dimly lit).  Overall a great experience.  Would definitely come back for the cocktails and maybe try their dinner service next time we're in town

All I can say is wow. I wish I was hungry.  We came here for its rating.  My hubby was hungry plus we wanted to grab a drink.   The decor is hip and has a nice open feel.   So, where to start. We looked at the menu and honestly everything looked good but because I wasn't that hungry we just ordered enough for my husband.   We ended up ordering the Original chopped salad (this is a must order!). You will not be disappointed.  The ingredients is like a chopped salad  like no other.   For the entree we ordered the Amaro Meatloaf.  Omg!  This Demi glaze sauce could have been a tad more generous but the entire Dish was unbelievable.   We finished off with the Black and Tan dessert.  Eat it In small bites cause it's a little on the heavier side but delicious.   I really wanted to come back here to try the scallops, the pork belly, Mac n cheese, the pork cheeks, the crab cakes, the gold and red beets I mean really?  Need I say more?  Strong Yay get yourselves down here to try.

Heard about this place from a friend and really wanted to try it out. To start out, the service was impeccable. I have a dairy allergy and Gina, our server, went above and beyond to accommodate me.  She even made my wife a special mocktail since she is pregnant.  The atmosphere is great- very comfortable.  The food was also excellent. We started with the chopped salad, which is the classic Cowboy Ciao chopped salad you could never go wrong with. I followed this with the chicken which was cooked to perfection with a risotto side.  My wife had the grilled cheese which she enjoyed (though not her favorite).  All in all, the five stars goes for the atmosphere, drink menu and service and good food....

Another trendy and tastefully decorated hang-out place in old town Scottsdale. CPH is among a handful of new resto-bars in Scottsdale that are transforming the image of the old town neighborhood. The menu is a mix of amazing comfort foods and lighter salads a dishes. Best is to go with a group and try everything! Also have a taste of The Persian cocktail! :-) I would rate this place one of the top 5 restaurants in the city.

We moved to Scottsdale from St Paul a week and a half ago and we have been to CPH twice. The first time was about a month ago when we took a trip down to apartment hunt and the second was Halloween evening right after getting into town. We sat at the bar both times and chatted with the bartender, Brandon (?). Very, very nice guy. They have Kim Crawford on the wine list, which is one of our favorites so we ordered a couple glasses of that. We wanted a snack but nothing too heavy. The bartender suggested we get the chopped salad and being new to town and not knowing anything about anything, we trusted his suggestion. OMG. So delicious. I thought I would be disappointed seeing as you can get a chopped salad anywhere, but this salad is out of this world. I don't remember what all is in it, but it is fantastic. The salmon is like butter it's so perfect and melts in your mouth. We got to talking with the bartender and we work in the service industry up in Minnesota and Brandon gave us a service industry discount. So nice. The second time we went we each got our own salad and scraped the bowls. The bartender even remembered us! I got the Citizen cocktail which comes with a rock candy garnish which I thought was really cool. We wanted to get an entree, but with small wallets, we decided we would wait until next time. Thanks CPH! You have a couple new fans.

Another visit to this perennial favorite of ours and another fantastic meal.     I had the short ribs - and as usual they were great.  Fork tender, situated on parsnips with just done greens.    Friends had the filet (always great) and the scallops    And don't forget their "the worlds end" martini.  Seriously.     Highly recommend for any occasion where the food matters and the service has to be great.  Just remember to book reservations

A wonderful, delicious respite in Scottsdale.  Visiting for Spring Training and disappointed by our first night's meal at Papago Brewery, we were excited at the anticipated visit to Citizen Public House. We were not let down. One of those wonderful places that make you struggle to select from a delectable menu, both food and drink.  The cocktail list is inventive and inviting. The New Amsterdam was intoxicating in a good way. Complex and delicious, deftly made with obviously excellent ingredients. The only hiccup was a bespoke order for a Basil Mojito, very simply replacing mint with basil that was made (twice) without any obvious effort to muddle the basil. A disappointment that was removed from the invoice. The food is spot on, creative and very well thought out. Started with the sublime Bacon Fat Heirloom Popcorn and intriguing Pork Belly Pastrami. A flavor packed, beguiling, complex offering served over rye spaetzle and brussel sprout sauerkraut. Big and bold but well designed. Entrees across the table included the Amaro Meatloaf and two Lamb Burgers. The Meatloaf was big, earthy and warming. A generous serving, worth the sporty $20 tariff. the veal demi-glace and mushroom cream delivering a rich arc, while the potatoes and roasted zucchini supplied the ideal sweep for the meatloaf. Lamb burgers were excellent with an exotic compilation of Serbian lepinja roll, pickled cucumber-onion, tzatziki. Enough so that a request was made to attempt replication at home. Dessert for the table was the PB&J Pudding Jar. Joyous companions all! The service was very friendly and attentive while not overpowering, knowing just when to service the table. Excellent. The space is warm, yet hip and airy, with a very manageable noise level. It was nice, for a change to visit a very popular restaurant that didn't have tables stacked on each other. Very refreshing.  A highly recommended spot for an Old Scottsdale visit..in fact for a destination as well.

Great service, the waiter was a menu expert and gave very good recommendations. The atmosphere is pretty bougie and a little darker than preferred. We ordered the bone marrow with pancakes as appetizer, followed by the roasted acorn squash and the ribs.   The bone marrow was meh. This was my second time having it and it was worse than my first; maybe I just don't know how to appreciate marrow. Or bones, really.  Squash was delicious and the ribs just melted in my mouth - went really well with the mash potatoes and mints. Def recommend if you are in the area!

Awesome place!! Very busy!! Order the chopped salad and you will understand why it has its own Facebook page. Amazing!!   Chicken pot pie was good too. It is deconstructed but very good. Too bad there wasn't more.   A must go to place in Scottsdale!!

This place is unbelievable!  I was visiting AZ from DC and saw that it has 4.5stars with 900+ reviews, so I knew there had to be something special!  The atmosphere is very chill, has indoor and outdoor seating.  Service was great, the waiter explained everything on the menu with such detail and passion that I couldn't  wait to try everything.  The chop salad is a must, perfect texture and flavor, the corn and salmon harmonize together wonderfully.  Also, for starters, we got the Tuna...one word....AMAZING.  Large chunks of tuna, seared and seasoned perfectly.  The three of us had the short rib, filet mignon and the osso bucco.  I couldn't tell which one I liked more.  The meats were prepped and cooked like nothing I have seen before.  The flavor, texture and juiciness were to die for.  I honestly could not find one single thing wrong with anything they had there, and I am an anal type of guy.    I even enjoyed two Thai Margaritas, that were the perfect balance of flavor and alcohol.  If you are in Arizona, you have to go to this place at least once.  I wish they had one in DC, I would honestly eat there twice a week!

Went in the late afternoon. We got the Pork Belly Pastrami and Rib Tacos. Nice portions, food tasted great. Had an appetizer called Meat. Cheese and Pickled Things which was also nice. Good all around. Attentive service.

This was a fantastic meal in old town Scottsdale. Not being that hungry we decided to share two appetizers and a sandwich - the beer salad, burrata, and veggie sandwich. All were delicious!   The restaurant is on the expensive side, especially for the entrees, so just know that going in. But, I would say worth the price.   Down side: a bit noise. If you want a quiet and intimate setting, this probably isn't the best choice.

Don't waste your time here, they try so hard to be sophisticated they end up ruining the food. I will say their take on a salad is amazing and I would recommend it to anyone, but their bread is over cooked and smells like smoke trying to make it fancy and the butter they serve with it isn't any good either trying to be fancy. (Can't recreate the wheel, Its butter!!) my wife got the filet mignon which could have been ok but instead of just serving a nice steak they stack it with their purple potatoes, green beans that have a sauce, and pile onions on the top. You add all that stuff to a cheaper steak to improve its taste. When you are getting a filet you don't want it hidden in a pile. I got the scallops and i will say they stand up to their recommendation and i would get those again. For the price we had to wait quite a while on our waiter regularly also and although this is a restaurant and we were there at 6 pm we had to scream across the table to each other do to a 10 person group of guys acting like they were in a bar at 1 am.

We had a nice dinner here. The service was very professional. Menu was interesting. I wish we had been more hungry so we could have tried more! I had the mac n cheese which was phenomenal. SO tasty! I also had the beet salad which was fresh and garnished perfectly. My husband had the Bahn Mi sandwich. He is Vietnamese so he is hard to please. He said he would not order it again as there was too much bread for his liking, but it was still tasty and one of the better sandwiches he has had outside of San Jose. I think this would be good for groups. The atmosphere is warm and inviting but not too casual.

The first thing our waiter suggested was the Original Chop Salad, and quite frankly it was the most surprising and delicious part of the experience! Service was phenomenal, we had a very professional yet personable waiter who knew the menu backwards and front.  Our main course included the the chop salad, coffee rubbed shortribs (cherry bbq sauce), and amaro meatloaf w/potatoes. The rib portions were small but made up for it in taste and quality of cut. Our heart of caramel and mint chocolate budino were perfectly refreshing as finishers- both the mint ice cream and roasted white chocolate ice cream were incredible!  Presentation was all very photo worthy, but we restrained ourselves ;)  Atmosphere is open and lively, moderate lighting and white table cloths, small candles atop- the bar is right in the center of the room. Our party of two went on a Monday night- I'm sure it would be much more crowded on a weekend. It's right in Old Town Scottsdale, after all. I definitely recommend anyone to try this place- I'll be back soon.

I had the scallops which were delicious. The creamy polenta was really good and the bacon popcorn was dangerously good! My bf had the tenderloin which he thought was great and I also had the Thai Margarita which had a spicy salted rim and was surprisingly delish. Service was very attentive and not at all pushy. For a mid-range dinner spot, it's as good as it gets! Entrees about $20-35.   The hostess was friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend!
Went on a date!! Tried the popcorn bacon  OMG to die for!! I love popcorn and bacon... And together heaven!! The service was impeccable and they were very knowledgeable.
Love the chopped salad. Great happy hour. The rest of the menu is also good. Drinks are good and reasonably priced

The chopped salad was as good as they say it is. The salmon was perfect in the salad. I wish I could recreate it because I could eat that salad every day! The scallops and short ribs were divine. Really great food and our waitress was amazing!

The food is fantastic, and the staff is very friendly.  We sat outside on the patio during the perfect evening.  We wouldn't change anything about the place.  Definitely recommend the popcorn, fondue and house salad.  All photo and news worthy!  Go try this place out now!

I'm always skeptical about going to a nice restaurant with the kids - will there be something for them to eat?  will the servers be accommodating and nice to my kids? will it be noisy enough to cancel out the occasional yelling of the toddler? Citizen Public House met all our needs and exceeded every expectation.  For starters, they have a TON of gluten free items.  I don't mean salad and broiled chicken.  I mean battered pork fingers and corn waffles.  We were thrilled, major bonus!  Then, the meatloaf was amazing - not traditional mushy meat loaf but not so "out there" that the toddler wouldn't eat it, so another huge bonus there. Finally, the noise level was just right - we could talk without yelling, didn't hear anyone else's conversations, but there was still plenty of sound and buzz so that it felt totally crowded and fun...and the little guy could make some noise without disturbing anyone else. The server was excellent, the busser brought our straws out neatly on a napkin.  Food came out quickly but not so fast that it felt like we were being rushed.  Service was attentive and polite and everyone treated my kids like guests, not pests which I really appreciate since they order as much as adults do and I expect that they should be treated as customers. Thanks Citizen Public House for a great evening out for the whole family!

I can't believe it took me so long to try this place! The fondue was delish and came with sausage, bread and fresh pears. The pate was so incredible I almost forgot I was eating rabbit. The meatloaf is big enough for two and looks like a decadent dessert. Speaking of dessert, if you don't have room, be sure to take home a bag of bacon pecan brittle. YUM. Everything was perfect from the service to the presentation. Great food. Friendly atmosphere. Amazing value!!

A great option for something different.    Found this place when attending a Yelp event, liked it so much I came back.  Great service.  Nice atmoshpere.  Great Alcohol options.  I thought the lamb meatballs were so good that I ordered the lamb burger but was sadly disappointed.  Tzatziki is very good.  Dessert options are wonderfu so be sure to save room.

Great ambiance but a little loud. I couldn't hear what the people were saying just a person over to my left.. Conversation was hard.  The wait staff was friendly and the place was clean.  Very busy place in old town Scottsdale right in the middle of everything and not far from all the bars.  The original chopped salad was amazing!! I've never had anything like it! I would go back again just for the salad!  The short ribs were good and you can fork it off without a knife but I felt like it was a bit dry.  Flavored were good though.  The mash potato was sweet underneath.. Which I wasn't a fan of but I suppose it goes well with the short rib flavor and the coffee compote sauce.  The mint chocolate budino was a little too sweet for me and the mint taste wasn't apparently strong.  The cookie on top was frozen and really hard to break into to share.  The desserts here were not my favorite but a big win with that chopped salad.  The smoked salmon and pesto dressing made the flavors but the kale, sunflower seeds and some black fruit gave it a crunch!  I want it again already!  I liked the salad so much I went back the next day before my flight to get the chopped salad to go so I can eat it for dinner on my way home!!! Loved it and couldn't stop thinking about it!!
Now, really, how much better can it get than expertly made cocktails and sausages dipped in cheese fondue at happy hour prices?  It can't.

First time in Scottsdale AZ. Originally from San Francisco, CA. Loved the food. Just as good as what you may expect from a SF restaurant. I had crab cakes and the cos which were both great. The Cod was delicious and the veggies cooked perfectly. My dining partner had the scallops which were also great with the peanut butte jar for dessert. Great meal highly recommend!

i dine at citizen any night of the week and enjoy taking friends who've not had the cph pleasure.  it's hard to explain/justify the greatness of signature chopped salad (i end up selling it my dinner mate du jour saying the salad is so good it has its own facebook fan page). the location is great, in the heart of old town and easy to get to as cph is on the corner of 5th and craftsman ct.  the vibe on any going night is easy going no matter how busy it is.  the familiar faces that do the meet and greet is an added touch being as how i notice with every visit cph is busy.   the atmosphere lighting is great and so is decor.  the seats in dining room could be a bit more "cushiony" to promote more relaxation.   menu terminology/ingredients could be dumbed down a bit diners who aren't the gourmand.  thankfully my girlfriend erica explained to me what an heirloom potoato is.  oh i get it, when asking what "this" is on the menu, the server can seize the moment to "sell" the dish to my awaiting tastebuds.  still, it's always a turn on to read and KNOW/imagine what the ingredients are than having to wander.  chopped salad and pork rind apps are top notch. i enjoyed the chicken with risotto, the smoke flavor was a bit much. chicken and waffles?  eh, the waffle was had a bit too much "buckwheat" taste to it.   mac and cheese would be much tastier if not served with sweet salsa on top.    i always receive impeccable service when sitting at the bar to eat.  drinks are great and i appreciate the bartender being constant in his attention to service /detail when i appear.  I've been a patron 8+ times now. he is singlularly responsible for the 2nd visit which has turned into unplanned but definite neverending visits to cph.  i order out here and there from cph.  when i came in one night to pick up the food he rang me up and i told him to keep the change, as i always tip when picking up take out.  (i'm in the service business). he thanked me and then asked if he could get me a drink while my order was being bagged.  i pick up all the time and am never asked this by waitstaff. this made the difference. i enjoyed a shirley temple in a to go cup and naturally he served it without charging.  i don't own a large operation like cph but how nice was it be served a non alcoholic beverage grazie.  again, the little added touches are what keeps a customer coming back.  if only other establishments offered free soft drinks while waiting for food.  the women's bathroom appears to be cleaned every time i've had to use lady's room. i've not yet (can't believe it) consumed any dessert.  i'm also wanting to try the grits app.    every person i've taken to cph has enjoyed it.

Disappointed. Based on rave reviews a group of friends booked a dinner. Upon arrival, the restaurant was busy, not crazy, but there was a lack of ambience of energy. I found the decor, layout and lighting uninspiring for a place with such raves in a trendy part of town. Onto the food..The portions are small. I felt like I was in an upper east side restaurant in Manhattan where skinny women eat. The beet salad was a frisee salad that had a few chunks of beets. If they were fresh, I couldn't have told you. The appetizers aka bar snacks  arrived at same time as our first course salads. That defeats the point of ordering something to snack on. It was olives, it didn't need to be cooked. And again, if they were fresh and unique, I couldn't tell you. Entrees are pitifully small for the price. Portions of them were yummy, but the scallops arrived with a cooked greens, stems attached and all of us were pulling them from our mouth. If it's on the plate it should be edible. Cut the stems off in the kitchen please. The meatloaf appeared to be the best entee of the 5 we tried. Dessert was the mini size, the 3 tablespoons of mousse side.  This is a pub..  I know it's an upscale pub but if I was expecting to healthier size portions. Service was attentive initially, multiple servers. We were talking asked if we wanted coffee with desserts, we were not askecif we wanted a second cocktail. Our waters were filled.  But hey, based on these reviews, it was like I walked into the wrong restaurant.

A MUST!!!!! Ask for SAM!!! I'm serious, he is what made our whole experience! Amazing recommendations, AH-MAZING food and fantastic drinks! My husband got the Manhattan and I had a France white wine ($5 on HH 3-6 M-F) and an espresso martini! TO DIE FOR!!! We also got the hummus & flatbread, cheese & meat (HH $6), Chop Salad (like a boss!!!) and scallops!!!! Ohhhhh and we had this phenomenal peanut butter and chocolate dessert. Most importantly - ask for SAM! He will make sure you LOVE what you get! Never met a waiter more passionate about what he does. Go here!!!!

This is one of our favorite places in Scottsdale. The food is delicious, atmosphere is great (although a bit loud on busy nights) and the waiters/staff are all friendly! It can be quite loud on busy nights, but I think that's  a good sign, it's busy! The chopped salad...no words. Just order it.  A great way to try this place is during restaurant week. Twice a year.

We had dinner in this newly opened restaurant from the former chef of Cowboy Ciao, Bernie Kantak. The location is very central and the room is spacious and not as noisy as other nearby restaurants such as FNB. The menu is excellent, with many good entree choices priced at $18 and below. Bernie's legendary chef's salad at $10 made a superb shared starter, followed by an organic chicken breast served over a rice pilaf. The wine list is excellent and extremely well-priced by today's Scottsdale standards(Lyeth Meritage for $9 per generous serving). Our waitperson, Ashley, was extremely attentive and enthusiastic. Worth a visit.

I had heard a lot of good things about this restaurant but after I decided to give it a try, I won't be back. Everything my party had to eat was heavily over salted and couldn't even taste the food. The drinks were okay and the service was okay but nothing special.

Wonderful food and service!  I was in Scottsdale for work and found this gem on Yelp.  Highly recommend walking through Old Town to get a feel for the area, though of course the weather might dissuade you.   Sat at the bar.  Had two Manhattans, olives, and the Scallops.  The bartenders were professional, courteous, and very friendly.  Even gave me a slight discount because I changed seats so another party could all sit together.  Little things like that really make me advocate for a restaurant.  Beyond that, the food was wonderful.  You can tell a lot of thought and passion went into their menu selections, and I was happy to partake in the offerings listed above.  I'll definitely visit again the next time I'm in town.

I was so excited to try Citizen Public House. I ended up going there to celebrate my birthday with a couple of friends, though I felt like we left somewhat disappointed.   When we initially walked into the restaurant and the vibe is upbeat, trendy, but cozy. There were two very bubbly kids that were standing around chatting with each other and didn't notice us for a couple minutes. We didn't have reservations, so they said it would be 15-20 minutes, which was fine, but this was a Tuesday night and there were at least 7 open tables, some of which were never filled while we were there. They also seemed to seat one of their friends who didn't have reservations as we overheard. That was a little frustrating but I was still excited.   We sat down and our waitress was very friendly. She apologized for the wait and immediately took our drink order.   I tried the beef short ribs which I thought was good, though, very fatty and somewhat small portion for 31 dollars. My friend had the lamb burger which he said was good, but somewhat dry. Overall, it was a pretty good experience, the food made up for the rest of the experience and I will go back again to try more.

If 6 stars was an option for 1 out of 100 ratings, this would be the restaurant that got it. Hands down best staff, service and food I've had in a while.   We had the bacon popcorn, chopped cobb, and buttermilk chicken. All were amazing. Try the specialty drinks, the journeyman was refreshing.  Sam was our waiter and he really made the experience special.
Cool ambience and friendly staff, coupled with awesome drinks and food!  The moment I walked in till my departure, I was served with care and great delicious dishes.
Great food, great wine and great service!  Thank you Kerrie for being so accommodating for our party!  We had a blast and I would def recommend this place to everyone who will listen to me!!

This was hands-down our favorite restaurant while visiting Scottsdale.  It has a lively, trendy vibe, fabulous service, and impeccable innovative food that's not too stuffy.   First, the hosts and waitstaff were exceptional and very helpful. Sam our waiter was wonderful throughout -- super knowledgeable and honest.  Cocktails are the bomb -- definitely try the spicy Thai margarita.  Don't miss the original chopped salad (which has its own Facebook page). It really is special.  We also tried the burrata and a special of the evening -- an amazing ramen with Argentine spot prawns.  The cocoa jar for dessert was also fabulous.  I wish we had more nights in Scottsdale as we would have definitely returned!

Had dinner our second night visiting Scottsdale from Los Angeles and I have to say, I was extremely impressed. We sat at the bar where both of the bartenders were extremely friendly, and truly knew the menu and what to recommend. We tried the Chopped Salad which was to die for, the scallops were amazing, the spare ribs were fabulous, and what can go wrong with popcorn with bacon added? Come on now. Definitely a place to try and a place to come back to!

Citizen Public House is a very popular fine dining establishment with a brew pub atmosphere.  The food is uniformly well-prepared, tasty, and attractively-presented.  The portions tend towards large, especially the rack of lamb which has about a pound of meat in it. The service is exemplary; the staff really tries to provide whatever you need (or think you need) and with genuine warmth instead of a frozen smile.  Should be five stars.  But what's the story, Richie?    Well, the story is that Citizen Public House doesn't measure up completely as a five-star fine food establishment.  The food is not innovative and the flavor profiles are simple.  Worse, it is just too darn LOUD!!  Noisy restaurants are a "style" today, but not my style.  On the other hand, Citizen Public House doesn't qualify as a five star casual eatery, because the prices are too high.  I really would like to sample the cuisine again, but I am not willing to subject myself to the audio assault (if you use a hearing aid and can turn it off, it might be okay).  I would like to go when it is not crowded, but apparently that is never -- be sure you make reservations.

While traveling to Scottsdale for a conference at the JW Marriott, we decided to venture off the resort to have dinner in Old Town Scottsdale.  Citizen Public House came highly recommended, and delivered a tremendously fun dining experience last night.  On a Wednesday night, Citizen was still pretty busy when we walked in around 8:30.  We were taken care of my Greg, who was one of most enthusiastic servers I've ever encountered, but he was a true service professional who really knew the menu from top to bottom, and talked about the cocktails, food, and dessert options with no difficulty, giving his appraisals as he went.  We started with the Char Siu pork tacos and Citizen's well-known chopped salad, which was mixed tableside by Greg.  I can see why people love the chopped salad, particularly with respect to its presentation, but the Char Siu tacos, while good, were less memorable.  For entrees we tried the evening special, a Bavette steak, the short ribs, and the venison loin.  The highlight for me was the venison loin, which was presented rare, exactly as ordered.  Nice cold center but well seared on the outside.  The bavette steaks were not quite as successful.  Based on preferences at the table, one was ordered super rare (blue) the other was ordered medium rare.  However, both came out pretty similarly cooked (I'd call it rare), and in fact the one ordered medium rare seemed to be the one less cooked despite the fact that it came out a few minutes later.   We enjoyed the steaks nonetheless.  Finally, the braised short rib was well executed with a coffee rub, again not particularly memorable but still a dish we enjoyed.  I really enjoyed the cocktails and in particular their barrel aged options.  The Instant Gratification was a scotch-based cocktail with Cognac and Amaro, and it's pure alcohol.  Definitely a slow sipping cocktail.  I also enjoyed tasting the Manhattan, which was well-made.  Their wine list is reasonably extensive and has options in all price ranges. We enjoyed the 2013 Chappelet Mountain Cuvee for $45.  Overall, this was a tremendously fun restaurant that was enhanced by our excellent server, Greg.  While the execution on the food was a bit uneven, I'd give high marks for presentation, quality of cocktails, and ambiance.

Great location, nice decor, varied selection, friendly and swift service, questionable value.  While in Phoenix for business, I stopped in to Citizen Public House on behalf of the overwhelming number of great reviews. I enjoyed my food and drink, I really liked the location and the decor, the service was great, but I walked away with a sour taste on behalf of the value component. Few things put me off more than the feeling of being ripped off, no matter how good I think the end product was. The end doesn't always justify the means. And I know...it's Scottsdale, but I'm from Brooklyn. I'm no stranger to expensive food. I still know what my money should look like on the plate.  I ordered the filet asada tacos, and I just wasn't down with the $16 they ran me. The 3 tacos were small, not particularly full, and came with a half a roasted corn cob. Everything tasted good, but at the end of the day that's basically $5 for a taco. Maybe a little more. And they weren't even very substantial. I feel pretty strongly that either a couple dollars should come off that price tag or another taco needs to be thrown on the plate.   I was still hungry so I ordered the flatbread/hummus app to tide me over. All in all, it's a nice spot but I wouldn't be back.
Know everyone has posted about Chop Salad and Pork Belly Pastrami.  You really need to try the Duck Burger it was heaven!!

Came here this evening with family while I was visiting from out of town. The area where the restaurant is seems really lively and hip but it seemed quiet, even for a Sunday night. One down side was that the restaurant seemed to lack atmosphere. It seemed really dark in there too.   We were seated immediately and our waiter was really great. He was really knowledgeable about the food and drinks, asked me where I was from (and even remembered at the end of the meal), and truly made us feel at home.   We decided on the bone marrow to start. The pancakes it came with were delish, but I didn't really taste the marrow. The meals were: short ribs, cod, scallops, and the deconstructed chicken Cesar. Everything was really delicious. I had a particular craving for meat, so the short ribs totally hit the spot we finished our meal with the peanut butter push pop and some of their bacon brittle. The push pop was good, but the brittle was hard to eat... my teeth were not diggin' it. I had really wanted the cake, but they were out!   Overall, it was a lovely evening! I'd definitely recommend.

This has to be one of my most favorite restaurants in Old Town. I bought a Groupon or Livingsocial or some deal to try it for the first time. Went with the bf on a Friday for a date night. We got there around 7 or so and the place was relatively empty - I was slightly nervous but I'd heard so many good things about this place, I knew it must've just been early.   We started with two dirty martinis, more like filthy martinis - just how i like it. Then we ordered the Chicken and Waffles appetizer, so good. It was mouthwatering delicious, I probably could've eaten 5 more plates. Then we had the Chopped Salad. It's effing amazing. I dream of this salad - I mean it does have its own FB page. Writing this makes me want it in my belly this second. For dinner, the beau got the scallops and I got the short ribs. Everything was cooked to perfection. Oh don't forget to have a moscow mule while you're there too.   By the time we left, the place was packed and I was so full I thought I needed a wheelchair.   I'm sure I'll be back for that salad and to try just about everything else on the menu.

I came here with my friend for the first time. The restaurant itself was nicely decorated and the service was great.   We ordered two appetizers, Bernie's Mac and cheese and chicken gizzard. Bernie's Mac and cheese was very good. You can taste the bread crumbs and tomatoes that were mixed in it and it had the right amount of cheese! The only thing I didn't like about it were the lemon zest that was in it. Chicken gizzards were lightly battered and deep fried and it kind of tasted like popcorn chicken.   For our entrees, we ordered the lamb burger and meatloaf. The meatloaf was simply amazing! It was very juicy, tender and it perfectly tasted well with the mash potato served on the plate. I wasn't a big fan of the lamb burger because the meat was dry and also the sauce that you dip your fries into had an unusual taste to it. It wasn't ketchup, but was some sweet red sauce that left a nasty after taste.   Desserts: We also ordered the coconut lemon dessert. I forgot what it was called but it sure was amazing!! The tapioca coconut pudding with small pieces of mangos in it was phenomenal!!

Wow! I had a incredible dinner here just last night. Everything was spot on from the moment we walked in the door- the hostess was delightful and welcoming, our server explained the cocktail list, and off we were. The cocktails were great I had the coastal sour along with another guest in our party and the others had something off the barrel aged list which was delicious as well. For starters we had the watermelon/beets, the bacon fat popcorn, and the tuna- all which were very innovative, interesting, and fun. For main courses we had the short ribs, scallops, and the hanger steak and nothing but rave reviews all around. Honestly- we couldn't have had a better time and our server (I can't remember his name unfortunately) was so helpful and friendly and described the dishes better than any menu could!

Chopped salad is hands down my favorite salad. I usually dislike salads in general, but the chopped is something else entirely. I prefer to get it without meat and it's still pretty filling. That's usually my go to order here, they also have a good happy hour and the salad is on there too!

Best meal we had on our trip to AZ! I loved the vibe and the food was delicious. The chopped salad was amazing and a must-try, and I also loved the Mac and cheese, ceviche, beet salad, and bbq sampler special. Our waiter was very patient and attentive to our large group. I wish we had one of these in LA!
Delicious food, for example the chopped salad, crab cakes, beet salad, chai tuna! I would give the restaurant a five star but the noise level is deafening!
Really neat vibe at the Scott. Would recommend for any meal or even just a drink if you're in the area!

Aside from terrible, dried out, flavorless, & non-creative desserts that do not even come close to reflecting how remarkable the rest of their dishes are, this restaurant is fantastic. Their signature salad is incredible. Their "Persian" drink is wonderful & very refreshing. Great fish dishes & very tender chicken. Not the best acoustics. Very loud restaurant.

Drove 30 min to check this place out. It made the perfect date night out with the husband. White table cloth, candle, menu that provided lots to talk about.  We got here 6pm on a Sunday night and were one of about 3 tables in a surprisingly big restaurant. By the time we left at 7:30 it was filling up nicely, but no wait.  Traded seats with my husband to have a better view of the bar which was romantic and manly at the same time (the bar, AND the gesture).  I ordered a Moe'scow Mule to drink (first one ever). Tasty and stayed ice cold my entire meal in that cool copper mug.  Hubby got the Original Chopped Salad and I got the other chopped salad - started with an M...Mir...I can't remember.  We SHARED which I highly recommend - these salads were a tastebud sensation - lots going on and they were different but both delicious.  Hubby ordered the Scallops (3-4 HUGE savory scallops, with gritts) and I ordered the Filet Mignon (cooked to perfection, awesome piece of meat, plenty to share with husband, on mashed potatoes and mushrooms).  We skipped dessert since we had Ben and Jerry's waiting for us at home. So lame I know.  Some deserts looked interesting - some involved BACON.  Bill came to $96.  This is a place that will keep you talking and bring out the foodie in anyone.  Enjoyed the ambiance, old 1920/1930's photos on the walls, and our knowledgeable/attentive server.  I'm feeling stingy with holding back that last star because I thought about a restaurant like DURANTS that might have a leg up on CPH.
This spot is hands down the best place I went to in Scottsdale! The barrel aged cocktails were so good! Definitely go here if you are within 50 miles of this place it is so worth it!

Atmosphere was a bit sterile, yet the service was excellent and the food was fabulous!  My husband and I shared the flat bread hummus, chopped salad and the grouper.  I will recommend to my friends and we will return!

Visiting Scottsdale as I'm used to I wanted to try something new. New at least to me. I was staring at a hotel near this place and the reviews couldn't be better, but what really made me decide was the pictures showing a very unique kitchen. As I arrived the place was packed but traveling by myself has its advantages I was able to find a place at the bar. This guys are friendly and even though the bar was full, the service was excellent. Started with a glass of wine and the crab cakes. They arrive within 5 minutes oil ordered them. Taste was fresh and not fishy at all, loved how well they go with the salad and sauce they came on top of. They tastes very good but I am sure there has to be another appetizer in the menu that would actually blow my mind. Not a bad start at all  To follow the trout: presentation was a 10, cooked to perfection with skin as it should. The flavor as good and perfect it was, also it was also missing something, I was set up to be impressed but I was stopped just just short of it.   As good as the appetizer and the entree were I would not repeat these dishes as it is my believe there has to be a mind blowing dish... Maybe the scallops ?   To finish the bread pudding... It actually has bacon on it!! STOP THE PRESS!!! I've found it!! One out of three. This is just fantastic and mind blowing. apple and bacon bread pudding with brown butter ice cream is TO DIE FOR!  This gives solid grounds to my theory that there has to be other mind blowing items in the menu I have not tried.  This is a very solid 4 star restaurant, I just need my mind blown 3 out 3 but being so close to do so I will definitely give this restaurant a try

The husband took me out for a night on the town, and I chose Citizen for dinner.   I have been wanting to try citizen for some time now, thanks to my yelp buddies, and was very excited that the time had come!  We made reservations for an early dinner before our show.  We arrived earlier than expected, no problem, they got us in right away.  Our server was quick, friendly, and knowledgeable.  He guided up through their specialty drinks and gave great menu suggestions.  We sampled a few of their specialty cocktails on happy hour, great drinks at a good price, and had the 'tender belly' bacon fat heirloom popcorn. I like that they list bar snacks and starters separately because this certainly isn't an appetizer, but its is a great bar snack.    I'd love to tell you what my husband had for dinner, whatever it was he liked it, but  you see my memory of the night is clouded by the memory of the decadent dream that is the Pan Seared Scallops.  Wouldn't you know, I had never had scallops before, well I have, but they have been raw, or just an ingredient in a pasta, I had been meaning to try them as the main course for awhile and boy am I glad I did. Scallops my friend, have been an underrated chorus girl in my life, but this dish gave them the chance to shine, and shine they did.  When given full billing they make you ashamed you had ever shoved them in the background in the first place. I will never again take scallops for granted.  I am actually in quite a pickle, because all of citizen's menu looks amazing, but I don't know that I can ever enter this establishment and order anything but those wonderful scallops again.

AMAZING!  I've never had a bad experience here. This is my absolute favorite place in Old Town. Chopped salad is amazing! My favs are the scallops and the chopped salad. The bartenders are nothing short of superb so order a crazy drink, it's bound to be good!

One of my favorite spots in old town, food is always excellent and the drinks and service are great. Love the crab cakes, the omfg salad (Stetson chopped). Highly recommend for a date night or going out with friends.

2nd time at Citizen and it continues to impress me. We recently went in for my a big birthday celebration. Not only did they accommodate our larger group of 8, but also put us in the best seats in the house located half indoor/half outdoor.  We had an earlier reservation which was great because regular dining was allowed to partake in happy hour dining and appetizers. We enjoyed $5 glasses of champagne, rose and house wine. A friend ordered a Mint Julep which he loved.   Service was friendly, quick and very knowledgeable. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I had the scallops over corn grits and it was fantastic!!!  Perfect portion of food. Don't let the three scallops fool you. They are large and tasted delicious paired with the corn grits.   I highly recommend for cocktails and appetizers or a meal. Great for a special occasion as staff goes out of the way accommodate and make your experience wonderful.

The salad...Do I talk about the amazing decor? The friendly staff? The amazing scotch selection? The unique main courses? No. This review will focus on one thing only, the salad.  The original chopped salad is sold as an appetizer  but don't be fooled. It's a wonderful mixture of various ingredients topped with fresh salmon and an amazing dressing. It's wonderful to share... But who wants to do that?! Don't forget to wash it down with son Oban 14 year!

Excellent service and warm decor at CPH. The food is solid but I was a bit let down. The famous chop salad was overly sweet and the menu is so overly red meat/bacon oriented. While that is tasty to be sure it's not that creative. The scallops were delish and the wine and cocktails were perfect. A bit more diversity to the menu would make it 5 stars for me.

I went here for dinner with a large group. The cocktails were just ok. Apps: The Original Chopped Salad was phenomenal, Bernie's Mac 'N Cheese was good and I didn't like the Kilt Lifter Fondue. Mains: the swordfish was pretty good but kind of tough and the Scallops were very tender.  Super cute place, great for a date or group.

We loved it.  Our server was friendly and interesting  We ordered the Members Only and a regular margarita. Both were enjoyable.  We came in for drinks and to try the chopped salad.  I, of course, loved it.  Since the other person with me doesn't like smoked salmon he would have preferred a different meat or fish.  They give you a recipe, so I will try it at home and use chicken.  In any case, he still liked it a lot which says something, when you don't  even like a main ingredient.  He was blown away by the pork belly pastrami.  So flavorful!    We came here from Cabo and had a layover until our flight tomorrow to San Francisco and thought it would be a good to roam around old town Scottsdale and try some of the ten things you must eat in Phoenix!

Amazing! I was with a group of six and we tried many dishes.  From the bacon popcorn to the drink service, we were delighted every step of the way. The place is a bit loud but that was perfect for us on a Friday night.

We had some people for out of town visiting and we were looking for a reservation for a large party and found Citizen Public. Me and my wife were the first to get there and right away the hostess tells us we have a hard out time at 8pm. We had a 6pm reservation. Sort of strange to me to pressure us right away but oh well  So they seat us in this semi private area with a large table away from the open dining area. You can see the dining area from our table. It just seemed like our server and hostess was very nervous to make sure we were out of there by 8. Anyways, our friends were a half an hour late which didn't help but oh well  I started off with the OMFG Chopped salad. It had raw salmon, dried corn, tomatoes, greens, etc with the dressing on the side. Mixed it myself. It was okay. Good salad. Would i order again. Not sure  I had the fair trade Short Ribs. Only reason I ordered this was because it was described as local coffee rubbed short ribs. Love coffee. You get four fairly large pieces of ribs with a dried cherry sauce on the side with some type of mashed potatoes and leafy greens. Ribs were moist and fell apart on a touch. Poured the cherry sauce on top and it was pretty good. Not great but good. The mashed potatoes were pretty good but just didn't think the greens went with this meal very good. So overall I thought the dish was ok.   My wife and son got the Amaro Meatloaf which was veal with mashed potatoes and roasted zucchini. It was pretty good. Moist and good. Thought the zucchini was overly seasoned but just my thoughts. It was a pretty good meal.   My mom and others got the tacos and it turns out this is three small street tacos. They said it was okay. Not sure. Didn't try but wasn't a lot.   Service was pretty good. Had people fill our water glasses. Check on us and took away our plates in a timely manner. Only thing that irked me was them constantly pressuring us to get out by 8pm. We left at 7:45 but felt pressured. So this didn't really help our meal. Didn't seem as pleasant as it could be.   The ambiance was very Downtown Scottsdale. Very loud. Upbeat. Dim lighting. Bar in the middle of dinning area.   So overall, the food was okay. Not great but good. Service really good but the pressure to get out was too much. Great upbeat ambiance for a younger crowd. Not really for older people who like peace and calm. Just really didn't feel the love at this place. So I give this place a 3 and a half star.   Will I ever come back is the true test. Not sure. The menu didn't really intrigue me but possibly I would give it another try.

I have to say, I think this restaurant may creep towards four stars, but the grand expectations from the Yelp reviews really let us down. Don't get me wrong, the food was not bad, but it didn't feel like anything stellar. We had some very nice dishes such as the chopped salad and swordfish.   However, the majority of the food just felt "meh." The cheese fondue, although cute in appearance, wasn't very tasty. The crab cakes had a bit too much breading and the short ribs were a bit too dry and over cooked and scallops were a bit chewy.   In terms of ambiance, it's definitely a bit less adorned and decorated than I expected, and overall the restaurant was very loud making it difficult to have a conversation.

Hands down, forks up!! Easily one of the best restos in Scottsdale/PHX!! Meant as a compliment, closest to a NYC/BOS/CHI resto-by far-in AZ! Great food, fantastic informed servers, and seasonally-inspired menu. Can't go wrong!

Old town Scottsdale for sure. Old Town prices on food, small portions but tasty. Prices on beers were fair for Old Town but nothing local and nothing too exciting beer wise, as is typical with Old Town the featured beverages are overpriced mixed drinks with fancy names-best to avoid them.  Food as I said had small portions but had an eclectic menu with a lot of variety and was prepared well.

I went here for my graduation dinner and I don't think I could have picked a better place. We had reservations, but got there an hour early and they were able to seat us immediately. Absolutely loved the vibe and ambience of the place. I would highly recommend the original chopped salad and the filet mignon tacos. You can't go wrong with their Manhattan either.

This place is legit. My wife and I started with the Heirloom Popcorn w Tender Belly Bacon Fat and then split the Burger and the Original Chopped Salad w Smoked Salmon. We only got the Chopped Salad because of the reviews. The hype is real!! It's the best salad I've ever had.

This restaurant is another one of Scottsdale's treasures.  Very nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and great food!  I underestimated the chopped salad.  It doesn't look like much, but it tastes wonderful!  Great drink menu, too.

If there was an option for 6 stars, I'd give it. This place is beyond great; from atmosphere and service, to drinks and food.   I have been meaning to write about Citizen's for a month now. I find that it's a breath of fresh air in a field of farts. Old Town had become so....well, old and it leaves a lot to be desired in the way of "classy joints". This is a perfect marriage of class and fun; I'd say laid back elegance, if you will.  The interior decor is such a drastic difference from the old Club "Next". It's sleek, modern yet comfortable, great bar space and patio and even rooms for private parties. I love the fresh flowers and candles.   I went with a girlfriend of mine and we sat at the bar. We started off with two specialty cocktails. I don't recall the names but one had cucumber and the other had freshly brewed tea in it. They were complex, fresh and most importantly, STRONG. Richie the bar manager took great care of us. He created their drink menu which is accessible but exotic. He is super knowledgeable and friendly. 2 things you need in a bartender. He's easy on the eyes too, so that helps.  For dinner, we shared the pork belly pastrami appetizer, chopped salad and scallops entree. Everything from start to finish was fantastic-you could taste and see Chef Bernie's influence in every dish. Complex flavors yet still had a comfort food feel, which I loved. At the end of the meal, Chef Bernie came out and talked to us. We saw him talking to every table and spending some time with all the guests which is pretty impressive, considering we went within the first two weeks they opened. He is a goddamn genius. Also, easy on the eyes...  At the end of the meal, I went to the bathroom and may have had too much to drink because I dropped my phone in the toilet. Richie offered me his extra cell phone for a few days until I got a new one. Now THAT'S service!   This place is awesome and you can't help but love and support two of the coolest dudes doing some innovative things with food and booze. Go support your local rock stars!
Great service, great mixology, great food and great atmosphere.   Loved the Beef Belly BLT, Boulvardier, Negroni, Pacific Coast Cocktail

The appetizers were amazing. Service was excellent. The original chopped salad is truly amazing. Nothing like it! We also had the Burrata and it was excellent. Ditto for the curry bisque...  slight kick and totally delicious. The drinks were good... but a little over hyped. For an entrée our server recommended the scallops but we decided to split the meatloaf... we probably should have listened to our server... stay away from the meatloaf. Honestly it was amazingly ordinary given how excellent the appetizers, salad and soup were.  All in all, a great choice. Definitely would recommend. Thanks's Yelp!
Favorite restaurant! The roasted buttermilk chicken and the chopped salad are amazing!

Great space.  Not too loud.  Sitting next to the false wall that opened to the outside and feeling the nice October breeze made for a soothing evening.    Nicely paced service.  - The beet salad was great!  Except for the tomatoes.  The tomatoes didn't go well with it at all.  However, the rest of the salad was splendid.    - My main, the pork shank was ridiculously huge.  By itself, it had a nice bark and a mild flavor, but combined with the preparation, it was excellent.  Savory, sweet, and smooth.  I really enjoyed my experience and will be back.

Everything about this place led to a great experience.  The food and drink menu are small but everything we picked was awesome.  Prepare yourself to try everything on the menu because you have to know how each item tastes.  I will be going back again soon and would recommend to anyone else looking for a good place on a regular week night.

Went here twice in 2 days during a trip to Scottsdale.  This was back in late May.  It's just that good.  Everything was delicious but what I loved most was there smashed potatoes. Just unreal.    Highly recommend to anyone looking for an outstanding meal and experience.

The chopped salad gets 5 stars, but the entrees get 3 stars, which puts me at an overall rating of 4. I had the scallops and grits...they were very flavorful, but a little too heavy on the oil.  Husband had meatloaf and said it was average.  We both loved the chopped salad though.  I wish it was a littlebit larger because I would be perfectly happy eating it as my entree.

I went to this restaurant for my birthday, it was delicious! The server was quite attentive and helpful. The food was excellent! I'd had a meal Mastro's the night before, this meal was much more tasty and about a third of the price. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that it was a little on the loud side-not too loud to carry on a conversation though.

I loved Citizen Public House and more importantly, their chopped salad.  We had a large group of girls celebrating a bday and walked in kind of late with no reservations.  Because we had to wait a bit, the staff opened up a bottle of champagne on the house and let us start the night with some bubbly.  Everyone loved what they ordered and special shout outs go out to the chopped salad (again), buttermilk roasted chicken and pan seared scallops.  The service was excellent and I would come back in a heartbeat whenever visiting Scottsdale.
Excellent food and service! I especially recommend the chop salad :). They allowed me to call in my order 10 minutes before the kitchen closed so I was able to eat before they closed.
Very special menu, including fried rabbit.  We had short ribs...fabulous. Plus the service was great.    Beautiful atmosphere too.
Best food in town!!  The hummus is wonderful and the chopped salad incredible. I highly recommend Citizens to anyone.

What a fantastic break from the monotony! Although I have been here before this place truly never disappoints. We arrived around 7pm to a packed house. There were a couple of seats at the bar and we walked on up. The bartender Will greeted us right away and crafted cocktails for us. We were looking for a great Cosmopolitan and in lieu of that he presented us with "The Socialite".  Very tasty, light, sweet with a non abrasive tartness and a hint of effervescent. Now for the edibles. The Jucy Lucy, stuffed with two cheeses, one being Velveeta and cooked to order fries that arrived hot and crispy and perfectly seasoned. The Original Chopped Salad which give you the best part of a salad without all that annoying lettuce in the way. Cous-Cous, smoked Salmon, corn and so much more, tossed table side and perfectly dressed. And of course there's the Mac N Cheese. Although, the noodles were a bit aldente, the sauce paired well with it. A happy marriage of Gruyere, Swiss, emetic and spices and the best part a tomato onion relish tested on top. Each bite of this decadent pasta paired so well with the relish as it cut through the heaviness of the cream sauce.   So in Short awesome service, fantastic food. No wonder they were busy.... We will be back!

This is the perfect place to take a group of people for an amazing dinning experience! Thomas is our favorite bartender! He always has  unique cocktail suggestions to start the evening off right! Moscow Mule is a good one! Fun and excellent priced happy hour! The scallops and chop salad are my favorite, but it is all so yummy! Can't wait to go back!

This place does it well in every way.  I had my birthday dinner here for a party of 16 on a Saturday night in December.  I had previously tried Citizen during restaurant week but my BF who arranged the evening had never been.  They seated us at a wonderful table near the front of the restaurant in the semi private alcove.  It was perfect, very intimate and I was able to hear everyone and mingle and socialize with my party.  The service was absolutely fantastic - never was anyone in my party left thirsty as our alcohol tab demonstrated at the end of night.  We actually had 2 servers who circulated and made sure that everyone knew what wine was open, etc.  We were there for over an hour before we began ordering appetizers.  When I apologized to the server, saying I hoped we were not taking too long in case there was another seating for the table, he told me not to worry at all, that this was ours for the night.  I like a leisurely paced dinner, especially when I'm the guest of honor.  My BF had bought me a Lisa's Rum cake, and even though they charge a $25 fee to handle and serve the cake, they did a wonderful job.  I declared it the best bday I had ever had :)    They are owned by the same group as Cowboy Ciao, which I have been a longtime fan of.  The original chopped salad which has it's own facebook page, yes, yes - they have it, and therefore I have not been able to order anything else to start.  It's just perfect.  I have also ordered the scallops each time I've been.  Corn grits and bacon along with cola gastrique combine with the scallops into the most awesome flavor and texture.  Not at all sweet, but rich and complex.  I also enjoyed their Moe'scow mule and they have a nice wine list.  The BF got the short ribs, and the first time he really really liked them.  I apparently tasted them but I was 2 hours into my bday dinner, and I can hardly remember due to the 2 martinis and countless glasses of wine. When we recently went back a week ago, he again ordered the short ribs, but he seemed less enthusiastic.  I tasted them, and I found the short rib itself to be quite good, tender, flavorful.  I did not care for the dried cherry bbq sauce.  I found it to be acidic and sweet, but not balanced at all.  The smell also turned me off.  I would go so far as to call it pungent.  It didn't compliment the short ribs, and neither did the roasted parsnip puree it was served with.  It was just too sweet.  I applaud their creativity, but in this case it just didn't work for me and I would have preferred something more garlicky and mellow.    Dessert and Espresso were fantastic, have tried the donutbread pudding and also the one with the chocolate pot de creme which I thought was more interesting.  Overall a totally solid 4 stars.  We will definitely be back again and again.
Great food, great staff and perfect execution. Beyond that, it's hard to add anything substantive to the already long list of great reviews. I can't wait to go back. You will not be disappointed!

After an event at the Montelucia my girlfriend and I headed to old town with another couple looking for a good dinner spot. We ended up at the Citizen House on their one month anniversary.  The first thing was the service was great. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and sat. Within minutes we had a server taking our drink orders and asking for apps. The only negative is the kitchen still may be learning because our food took a while.  We ordered the fondue and popcorn for apps and they were both great. The only thing is they don't give you enough dipping food for the fondue but bring you extra for more money. The popcorn was unreal I mean bacon flavored popcorn who could ask for more?  For entrees our table ordered the scallops, chicken and chopped salad. All received great reviews. For dessert we order the bread pudding which was good not great. The bread pudding was a little bland but the makers mark ice cream was great.   I will be making the Citizen House a regular stop in my old town dinner rotation.
Great food. Unique mixed drinks. Their chopped salad may be the best salad ever eaten.

Great experience!! We were feeling like trying multiple flavors/styles, so once we heard about the lamb chop special app that was it! Ordered that, olives, bread with dipping sides, shrimp ceviche, and the Mac n Chs - all to share! It was so fun. Flavors were awesome and presentation so attractive. The staff was very professional. Can't wait to go back!!

I've been waiting to try this place for a few weeks and finally got the chance on Easter. We started with the Mac and cheese and chopped salad... The chopped salad is everything they hype it up to be. AMAZING. Best salad I've ever had and I anticipate ordering it for lunch a few days a week. The Mac and cheese was ok - but the waitress never really recommended it anyway. Between our table we got the rack of lamb, short rib entree, and meatloaf... The short ribs were BY FAR the best thing by a mile. The meatloaf was good - very well prepared and the rack of lambs were simply standard... I wouldn't get them again but I would try the scallops next time. The desert is the best thing in Scottsdale - heart of caramel! Trust me on that one!!!  Service was wonderful but you can tell they are busy. I'm giving it a four star because the rack of lamb for 38.00 was very average and I was walking away pretty disappointed with that meal.

A trip through Scottsdale brought my Hubbie and into this restaurant.  We got in a bit early for dinner and got to enjoy 1/2 off drinks before starting off with the catfish appetizer.  One bite and angels were singing in my ears-the best I've ever had times a thousand!  Definitely recommended.  For entree I went with the short ribs and they too were sensational.  I travel regularly for work from Seattle to SF to LA and this place is the top of my list.

I really enjoyed this place, and everything I have ordered there so far...  I went for the first time this week and later in the week sent my mom and brother because I liked it so much.    The original chopped salad was as delicious as always.  I had a hard time deciding between the scallops, the halibut and the meatloaf.  They were out of the halibut, so scallops and meatloaf it was.  The servers I spoke to were all very knowledgeable about the menu.  I am not sure I could pick one meal over the other next time.  I liked them both so much.  I guess I am always going to have to drag someone with me and do the ordering for the both of us.  I can't wait to try the bacon brittle.  :-)
Delicious! Great service from Jordan, and nice comfortable upscale atmosphere. Prime Bavette steak was perfectly cooked and well seasoned, but the bone marrow risotto was the star of the dish for me.

Headed here after picking my husband up from the airport on a Wednesday night - a little nicer than I was going for, as we were pretty casual, but very nice atmosphere.  The scallops were to die for, and I had a really tasty seasonal mule.  Would definitely dine here again.
The chopped salad was TO DIE FOR, but I wasn't the hugest fan of the short rib entree I got. Overall would recommend this place in Old Town Scottsdale!

Two words - Chopped Salad!!  Oh my gosh. It's so good that every time we know we are heading to Scottsdale for a work trip, our team immediately makes reservations here and can't stop thinking about the chopped salad.  In fact, when we tell partners who have never been here and are going to join us about the salad beforehand they always say "salad? what's so special about a salad?" but then they are the first one asking for a second order!  I can't eat salmon so they make a chicken one for me.  The cocktails here are always delicious and they make a great sazerac which is my favorite.  For entrees I have had the short ribs and the pork shank and both are amazing but I might say short ribs are my favorite but just slightly.  The service here is always outstanding.  This restaurant is definitely our favorite in Scottsdale which is why we always return when in the area.

Molten drinks please.  Grand Master Mixologist Richie Moe @CitizenPubHouse whipped up a couple shots for my wonderful wife and I that brought much of the bar to a silence on a crowded Saturday night. When he heard we were celebrating our anniversary he said he'd like to make us a special drink...and he felt like burning something.  The end result was kind of like bananas foster in a shot glass.  It involved melting Mexican chocolate in a metal mixing cup, flaming 160 proof black strap rum, Richie repeatedly pouring a flaming mixture of orange liquid with blue flames from cup to cup in an arc that captured everyone's attention.  Outstanding drink with an outstanding show leading up to it.  We've been to CPH twice and had great food and outstanding drinks each time.  If I am in the mood for a cocktail, this is where I want to go. If you're in the mood to go out for drinks and a bite, this is your place. Enjoy.

Happy Birthday Elizabeth. I'm still smiling that your birthday is on the same day as my oldest daughter. Happy Birthday TJ.   This is a wonderful dinner house in Old Town. The use of white and black in the interior design creates a stunning and dramatic decor. White table cloths and napkins. Intimate nooks where a family or group can dine at a large table. Family photos framed and grouped on walls in a very precise manor. Excellent touch.  I begin with a Junipero martini 12. with a twist of lemon from Elixabeth. Did I say that right? A superb intoxicologist, super friendly and very sharp. She introduces me to Andrew Fritz, one of the partners and very friendly front man.  We speak of the upstairs, mixologist, partner, Richie Moe and I am sure that their new venture Citizen R+D will be cool as hell. Not to spill too much about the new venue but I can confirm the existence of a program known as Citizen Research + Development, upstairs over the Public House, that will showcase experimental procedures from the land of craft cocktails and spirits. Richie may become the worlds greatest living mixologist.  Last but not least Chef and partner Bernie Kantak. Bernie will be preparing a pork belly pastrami rye spaetzle with brussels sprout sauerkraut. 12. This appetizer is presented beautifully. These flavors mingle and marry and are a very nice treat. A little shout out to Thomas, I think we were having a little fun but after two drinks, I can't remember.  And I left forgetting to have desert, coffee and donuts 10. Next time my friends, next time.

OMG. Went here yesterday the second time. This time with lomita for my pre birthday dinner. While it is a bit loud, it's a fun atmosphere and the food and the service surpasses all your expectations. Our waiter Gary made this a special evening for us. We started with the pork belly pastrami (a party in your mouth), and then following with their famous chopped salad (it has it's own facebook page!!!), and shared the best filet mignon ("pass penny please") we had in a looooong time.  The desert, flourless chocolate cake with homemade strawberry ice cream, was on the house (nice touch) and served us well through the birthday night into the morning. Btw: make Gary sing, hehe

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  One of our favorite restaurants in the Valley.  Even if they took the pork belly pastrami off the menu, I'd love this place a little less, but I'd still love.  Atmosphere, awesome.  Drinks, very good (despite loss of amazing bar program upstairs.)    More than anything, we have loved a meat-centric approach to this place, and though heavy, it is delicious.  Apart from the aforementioned pork belly pastrami, which is melt in your mouth good with the sauerkraut and mustard to cut the richness, we've also enjoyed the pork cheeks and crab cakes.  The crab cakes are juuuuuust above my cut-off for having enough lump crab in there to make it worth calling a crab cake, but it has made it, and it's tasty.  Get the meatloaf, embrace the amaro.  My wife (as always) get the branzino and she loves it.  Also had the short ribs which are a little heavy-handed on the rub, enough to leave a bit of bitterness on the meat (not in a good way), but on the whole, is not a bad dish.  Tracy Dempsey does their desserts.  Enough said.    So from atmosphere to drinks to food, this is definitely one of the best casual fine dining joints the Valley has to offer.

This review is just for the bar and drinks (no dinner).   This was just one of those places where I felt comfortable sitting around, sipping on a drink, and having a conversation. The ambiance was really nice and I loved being in that environment. Maybe this is only at night when I was there and maybe during the day because it's brighter you might not get the same feeling, but going at night is a treat.  There are dinner tables all around the outer part of the restaurant with the bar in the middle. The bartender who served us was very knowledgeable and was not in our face about ordering more drinks.
